loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el   barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua madre soltera, tiene dos lindos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad lo cuales ha logrado salir adelante por sus hijos y gracias a Dios tiene una profesión, los planes para su familia es terminar de construir su casa para ofrecerle un patrimonio a sus hijos sólido y seguro. Doña Rosa se  desempeña como asistente de venta en una empresa tiene seis meses de trabajar y anteriormente trabajaba de contadora, sus metas en el ámbito económico es poder ganar mejor para realizar  todos sus objetivos,  esta es la tercera solicitud préstamos en  Afodenic, lo cual desea  comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, ladrillos y zinc dándole una vivienda cómoda y segura a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38-years old and lives in the Healeah neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother of two beautiful children, ages 7 and 12. For the sake of her children she works to get ahead and fortunately has a good job. What she wants now for her family is to finish building her house, which will be a tangible, secure asset for her children. Rosa has worked as a sales assistant for 6 months and previously worked as an accountant. Her financial goals are to be able to earn a better income, allowing her to achieve all her objectives. This is her 3rd loan request at Afodenic, with which she hopes to buy cement, iron, blocks, bricks, and tin roofing to complete a comfortable, safe home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish building house

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi (composé de 7 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 1 enfant. Elles résident dans le quartier  Bougoula Ville de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales suivantes, vente de condiments, du savon et des légumes. 
Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent s’est  bien dénoué.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 paniers de tomates, 8 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon et 12 cartons de savon. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et dans les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utilisent pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi (composed of seven married women) average 28 years age and one child. They reside in the Bougoula Ville district of the city of Sikasso and do commerce in the following: condiments, soap, and vegetables. To carry out their work and to satisfy the needs of their customers, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was settled.

The group members plan to use this loan to buy four baskets of tomatoes, eight 50-kg sacks of onions, and twelve boxes of soap. They get their supplies locally in Sikasso City (third administrative region of Mali) and in surrounding villages. The goods are sold retail, mostly for cash, in the marketplaces of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace) and from homes in the district. The customers are composed of women and men.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 19,000 francs CFA per month that they will use to support their families a little by helping their husbands and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, condiments, and vegetables

loans.name: Nuru Njema Group

texts.en:
Husna has been a firewood, perfume and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood, perfume, and juice for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money for future use.

Husna is 26 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina and Asha. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood, perfume, and juice for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị  Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 38 tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007 Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đều kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với mức thu nhập hàng tháng là 4.000.000đ   Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 38 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, both she and her husband sell construction materials. This is the business that brings the main source of income for her family, at VND4,000,000 per month.

In this L. cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to invest more in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for construction materials business

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa T. is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.

Jenifa is currently in the business of selling onions and is requesting a loan to buy more onions and cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
O. Phạm, 47, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, O. owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. O. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. O. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

O. is requesting a loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth taken out by O. from TYM Fund. O. plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Raisng

loans.name: Sogbadji

texts.fr: Mme A. Sogbadji est âgée d’une quarante deux (42) ans. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge cinq (05) enfants. Elle mène comme activité la vente de légumes (piments secs, oignons, ails…) et des poissons fumés dans le marché de son village. Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises afin de répondre aux demandes de ses clients. Cela va doper ses revenus et améliorer ses conditions sur le plan économique.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Sogbadji is 42 years old. She is married and has five children to support. Her work involves selling vegetables (dried chili peppers, onions, garlic,...) and smoked fish at the marketplace of her village. Because her customers are becoming more and more numerous, she's requesting a loan to build up a big enough stock of merchandise to respond to the demands of her customers. This will boost her revenues and improve her financial situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables and smoked fish

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia tiene 30 años, desde muy joven se esforzó por mejorar su vida, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos Sandra de 12 y Javier de 11, trabaja sin descanso para alcanzar las metas que se ha trazado. En su pequeña casa hecha de adobe, Emilia lleva 5 años trabajando tejiendo chalinas, guantes, chompas, etc, los cuales distribuye en los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde son los turistas los que principalmente adquieren sus prendas. Emilia se divierte mucho haciendo los tejidos artesanales, lo cual la llena de satisfacción ya que sabe que también de esa manera puede darle de comer a su familia. Con el tiempo espera tener  un negocio más estable que le brinde mejores ingresos económicos, puesto que sabe que tiene que darle unos buenos estudios a sus queridos hijos, quienes corresponden su sacrificio con mucho amor y siempre la acompañan a todo lado. Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca a tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a sus compañeras muy felices. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Emilia is 30 years old. Ever since she was young, she has made an effort to improve her life. She lives in her own house with her children, Sandra (age 12) and Javier (age 11). She works nonstop so that she can reach the goals that she has set forth. In her small adobe house, Emilia has been knitting scarves, gloves, sweaters, etc. for 5 years, distributing her knitwear at the most bustling markets of Juliaca, where mainly tourists buy her merchandise. Emilia has a fun time making her artisanal knitwork, which fills her with the satisfaction of knowing that this is a way that she can feed her family. In time, she hopes to have a more stable business that will bring in better earnings because she knows she must provide a good education for her children. They repay her sacrifice with love, and they always accompany her wherever she goes. This is her 2nd loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments, and has never had any problems with her microfinance institute, where she is in charge of bringing the joy that keeps her group members happy. With the 500.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to increase the amount of knitwork that she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for knitwork

loans.name: Fazilat Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy marble to sell. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Amna baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (tube lights, switches and switchboards) to sell. 

Fazilat baji is married to M. A.. They both are citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 17 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband has a cycle-repairing business. He has been doing this work for the past three years. Fazilat baji makes decoration pieces and sells them at the market to earn income. She saves her income in a committee and uses it when needed. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband’s cycle-repairing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Siddiqan baji is holding in her hand one of Fazilat baji's decoration pieces.

loans.use: To buy tools for cycle repairing business

loans.name: Karija

texts.en: Karija O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has five children. The children, two sons and three daughters, are all currently in school: senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Karija is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells from a tabletop stall, at the lorry station, in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Karija buys her goods from nearby communities and from Kumasi city. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 22 years old and single with no children. He works very hard to take care of himself and improve his business. He is a barber cum student: he completed the last two years of senior high but could not continue. While he was in school, he was barbering to make money to pay his school fees and other expenses. He takes his time to barber his customers well, so many like to come to his shop for their haircuts. Currently he is attending remedial classes to better his grades so he can continue his education to the university level. He is requesting a loan to buy barbering equipment such as a barbering machine, sterilizer, shaver, pomades and hair spray, etc. It is his dream to improve himself through higher learning.

loans.use: To buy a barbering machine, sterilizer, shaver, pomades and hair spray, etc.

loans.name: Violeta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Violeta del Socorro González F. tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad. La señora tiene 9 años de dedicarse de tener su negocio de mercadería en general, ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual además de vende granos básicos y golosinas, también vende ropa y zapatos. Ella empezó  hace 9 años con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, y con el tiempo fue que ella adquirió el capital necesario para establecer su negocio, a la que le ha estado invirtiendo todos los créditos solicitados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, ya que desde su establecimiento puede vender tanto los granos básicos como el vestuario. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una distribuidora en la cual emplee a otras personas y sea un ingreso fuerte para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Violeta del Socorro G. F. is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still minors. For nine years she has worked at her store which sells common merchandise. The store is located in the home she lives in. Here she also sells basic grains, candies, clothing, and shoes. Ms. F. started selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes nine years ago. Over time she acquired the capital necessary to establish her business, in which she has invested all of her loans.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains. Since starting she has been able to sell as many basic grains as clothes. Her dream has always been to have a distributorship which would employ other people and be a good income source to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus hermanas en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la agricultura y hace un mes y medio ha  sembrado camote en un terreno de una hectárea ubicado a pocos minutos de la ciudad, de esta actividad depende su sustento y el de los suyos, él trabaja incansablemente de sol a sol para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario y puedan vivir dignamente.

Su cultivo necesita mantenimiento urgente y él no tiene los recursos para comprar los fertilizantes y foliares que necesita es por ello que está solcitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan continuar con el cuidado de su cultivo.

Mariano tiene muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, tanto de la ciudad como del campo, los cuales lo consideran una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mariano is 61 years old, single, and lives with his sisters in the city of Ferreñafe, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has dedicated most of his life to agriculture. A year and a half ago, he began growing sweet potatoes on a hectare of land he owns just minutes away from the city. This activity supports him financially. He works tirelessly all day so that his family does not lack the basic necessities and can live with dignity.

His crops need urgent maintenance, but he cannot afford to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients. For this reason, he is making his first request to our Institution for a loan of 1000 soles so that he can proceed with the necessary steps to ensure a good harvest.

Mariano has very good references from his neighbors, both in the city and from the countryside. They consider him to be a very responsible and hardworking individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & plant nutrients for his sweet potato crop

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Elle exerçait le commerce d’alimentation générale pour aider son mari imprimeur dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04 enfants. Malheureusement dans son quartier, après l’ouverture de sa boutique d’alimentation générale, deux nouvelles personnes ont également ouvert deux boutiques de ventes de produits d’alimentation générale. A cause de la forte concurrence, elle n’arrive plus à vendre. C’est pour cette raison qu'elle a pris la décision en Janvier dernier de se lancer dans la vente de planches et de chevrons. Ce commerce lui réussit en ce moment. Elle vend des quantités considérables. Elle  a besoin en ce moment de lancer une nouvelle commande au Ghana ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 planches de planches et 30 chevrons.

loans.use: Achat  de planches et chevrons

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been managing a small variety store in front of their house. It has been her business for five years and she wants to further improve it. She is hoping to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 for the further growth of her vending stall. Her business is one of their sources of income and is one way to help her husband in generating income for the education of their children. The children are their inspiration in working hard in their business as they aspire to give them a good future.

Lydia is already 45 years old. Her family is residing in Cabisera 17-21 Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Alfredo U. who is already 49 years old. They have four children of whom two are presently studying. Their eldest, Jeffrey, is already a soldier and is working. Janice, who graduated in Criminology, is presently looking for a job. Joem, their third child, is studying in high school. Their youngest, Jincky, is also studying in primary school. Lydia is hoping that with the cooperation of her husband, they will be continuously able to send their children to college until they earn their college degree.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is 38 years of age, she manages a retail store in their village for almost six years,her weekly net income is PHP 1,500.00, she requested a loan amount of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase some grocery items to sell. She works hard for her family to support her family in their daily needs.

She is married to Reynaldo R., a barangay Captain in their village. They have one son named Reynald- 17 years of age, 2nd year college student. They are three family members residing together at San Francisco Cauayan City, a rural and plain area, 15 kilometers away from the city proper of Cauayan. She is optimistic when it comes to business. She said that we should anticipate a positive outcome in handling a small business.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase some grocery items to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sus deseos de superación la motivan a seguir luchando por el bienestar de sus 5 hijos, con quienes vive junto a su esposo.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bocadillos para los eventos sociales que se realizan en su distrito, donde ya es reconocida por su gran habilidad en la repostería, pues no pasan desapercibidos ninguno de los deliciosos pasteles que prepara. Sus hijas son quienes la ayudan con su labor, ya que en ocasiones tiene que preparar cientos de pastillos.
Verónica considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en la preparación, pues tiene la capacidad elaborar sus deliciosos bocadillos invirtiendo la mitad de sus ganancias teniendo la posibilidad de seguir aumentando su capital con el fin de cumplir su meta de instalar una fuente de soda, donde venda y exhiba los diversos pasteles y tortas que prepara con tanta dedicación.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con esmero y puntualidad en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal del cual es parte. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá algunos utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus dulces bocaditos.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and a hardworking woman. Her desire to excel motivates her to continue fighting for the welfare of her 5 children, with whom she lives along with her husband.

Veronica prepares and sells snacks for social events in her district. She is recognized for her baking abilities and none of her delicious pastries go unnoticed. Her daughters help her fulfill orders because sometimes she has to prepare hundreds of pastries. Veronica considers her business to be profitable because she is able to invest half of her profits into making her delicious snacks and saving the remainder to increase her capital. Her goal is to open a soda fountain where she can display and sell the various pastries and cakes that she prepares with much dedication.

This is Veronica’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She expects to continue working hard and making her payments on time, just like the other members of her Communal Bank. With the money she is requesting, she plans to acquire some utensils used in preparing her sweet snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina A. is a hog raiser in the village of Sto. Tomas, Saguday, Quirino.  She and her husband Orlando, who is a farmer, are blessed with two children: nine-year-old Ribelyn and four-year-old Jessica. The couple are working hard to improve their lifestyle, and they hope to provide for the needs of their family through Rosalina’s business.

Rosalina would like to obtain a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 for the renovation of her pig pens and the purchase of feed for her hog-raising business. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: additional capital for the development of her hog-raising business

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna A. is from the village of Mibantang in Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Jhonna is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Jhonna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Jhonna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jhonna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jhonna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Jhonna's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of thirteen people, is located in Svay Village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sok H. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Hean Pheap, is a fisherman. Aside from his fishing, he is also a construction worker. This couple does not have any children yet.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. Thus, Mrs. Sok H. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: T. Philomène est née en 1953 et vit depuis 32 ans au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Philomène est mariée à ZODANKPO Adrien, un agent retraité de l’Office des Postes et Télécommunication au Bénin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Philomène n’a fait que l’école primaire. Pour assurer l’entretien et l’éducation de ses enfants, Philomène vend du charbon de bois et du maïs en gros et en détail, à Synapostel (en face de la pharmacie Saint Martin) à Cotonou. Philomène s’approvisionne à Tchaourou dans le Nord du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Philomène sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans l’optique d’agrandir son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Philomène T. was born in 1953 and has been living for 32 years in the neighborhood of Avotrou in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Adrien Zodankpo, a retired employee of the Post and Telecommunications Office in Benin. They have four children, who all attend school. Three of them are in their care. Philomène lives together with her children and husband. The parents provide together for their family. Philomène attended only elementary school.

To provide her children with care and education, Philomène sells charcoal and corn, wholesale and retail, in Synapostel, opposite to Pharmacy Saint-Martin in Cotonou. She gets her supply in Tchaourou in northern Benin. Philomène is a long-standing client with Alidé, since she got already three loans, which she repaid to Alidé on schedule. She came now to Alidé and applied for her fourth loan, which she will use to expand her activity level and meet the ever increasing demand from her clientele.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Miguelina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun depenD. D. ella.  

Miguelina, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que ejerce. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea: Esika y ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo D. actividad.
En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, venD. sus productos D. belleza al contado y al crédito, con pagos D. manera diaria, semanal, quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000.00, comprará productos D. belleza como: colonias refrescantes, perfumes para damas y caballeros, billuteria como aretes, collares y anillos. Anhela implementar más su negocio y contar con una buena cantidad D. productos D. belleza en stock, D. esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes fijos.

Miguelina, sueña con crecer en el negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miguelina, is a customer of the Communal Bank “Las Orquideas II”, Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She is married, 48 years old and mother of 3 children all of whom are still her dependents. Miguelina is devoted to her family, joyous and charismatic. Her qualities help her in her line of business, the sale of beauty products from the “Esika” brand. She has many years in this and has an established clientele. Her sales are paid in cash or credit, payments are maD. on a daily, weekly, biweekly or monthly basis. With a loan of 1000 soles she will buy beauty products such as: aftershaves, perfumes for men and women, fashion jewelry, earrings, necklaces and rings. Her goal is to strengthen her business and have a good stock of products to satisfy her regular customers. Miguelina’s dream is for her business to grow and be a top seller. She is grateful with the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her and other women like her start their business and grow personally and professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina D. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop such as vegetables, salt, sugar, rice etc and is requesting a loan to buy crates of beer to sell.  Dina is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a pub.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a hard working woman. She is also a friendly woman. She uses her friendly skills to attract and retain customers for her business. She sells sarongs and head gear of various colours and shapes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to really expand her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Arce

texts.en:
Arce Q. is from the village of Kahulugan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Arce is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Arce owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Arce has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arce joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI; that loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Arce is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arce from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phom

texts.en:
Mrs. Phom T. is a 40 year old who lives in Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Un, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field and grow crops. Aside from farming, Mr. Sokhom Un also sells duck eggs to earn a small income to support his family. 

In order to support the farm, Mrs. Phom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy pesticide and gasoline to support the farm. 

Mrs. Phom T. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a driver while the other three are students and also support their parents' business. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
N. Isaiah is a hardworking man aged forty-four years. He is a resident of Nansana Kampala. He is a doctor by profession and he owns a clinic which he has been operating for over four years. He employs one person in his clinic.

Isaiah is using the loan to purchase medicines and so forth to meet his customers’ needs. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to improve his clinic.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Burhanova Tolkun`s Group

texts.ru:
Толкун, 63 года. Она вдова и мать 2 детей.Старший сын работает в РОВД, младший сын занимается наемной работой. Она активно занимается сельским хозяйством, имеет парник где выращивает саженцы помидора и планирует посадить их на своей земле. Кредит нужен для закупа телки для откорма и реализации.

Турсунали, 41, вдовец. У него 7 детей.Сыновья занимаются сельским хозяйством и перепродажей овощей. Невестки присматривают за детьми и помогают в бизнесе.Клиент сам откармливает 4х овец, 17 кур, подготавливает землю к посеву.На кредит он планирует закупить одного бычка и закупить минеральные удобрения для земледелия.

Адолатхон 64 года. Ее супруг пенсионер и присматривает за хозяйством.У нее 4 детей. Старший сын преподаватель в училище, младший сын работает охраником ТЭЦ, невестки активно помогают в бизнесе.На 0,20 га посадили картофель, на 0,41 га планируют посадить помидоры, дома имеют парник, где разводят саженцы помидоров. На кредит планирует закупить минеральные удобрения для картофеля и помидоров, а также манеж для новорожденной дочки.

Кенжехан 61, ее супруг также пенсионер. У нее 6 детей.Старший сын тракторист, младший сын занимается оптовой перепродажей овощей и фруктов, невестки занимаются с/х. В день визита готовили зелень на продажу. На 0,20 га посадили капусту 8000 шт., на остальное 0,25 га планируют посадить помидоры. За счет кредита она планирует расширить бизнес и  увеличить поголовья КРС. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Tolkun is 63 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 2 children. The oldest son works at the District Department of Internal Affairs, youngest son is involved in contract work. Tolkun is actively involved in agriculture, has a greenhouse, where she started growing tomatoes and plans to re-plant them on her land. She needs the loan for the purchase of a cow for fattening and subsequent resale. Tursunali is 41 years old, a widower. He has 7 children. The sons are involved in agriculture and resale of vegetables. Daughters-in-law look after their children and help with the business. The client is raising four sheep, 17 chickens and preparing the land for sowing. He plans to use the loan to buy one bull and mineral fertilizers for treating the soil. Adolathon is 64 years old. Her husband is retired and looks after the household. She has 4 children. The oldest son is a college teacher, youngest son works as a security guard at the thermoelectric plant, and daughters-in-law actively help with the business. They planted 0.20 hectares with potatoes and plant to plant 0.41 hectares with tomatoes. They have a greenhouse at home where they started to grow tomatoes. Adolathon plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizers for potatoes and tomatoes and also to buy a newborn crib. Kenjehan is 61 years old. Her husband is also retired. She has 6 children. The oldest son is a tractor driver, youngest son is involved in wholesale sales of vegetables and fruits, and the daughters-in-law are involved in agriculture. They were preparing greens for sale on the day of the visit. They planted 8000 pieces of cabbage on 0.20 hectares and plan to plant tomatoes on the remaining 0.25 hectares. Kenjehan plans to use the loan to expand the business and increase cattle headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Felicia, 56, is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums north of the Capitol Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Felicia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small food stand by purchasing more vegetables, rice, salad and beans to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to invest in her home by changing the walls from wood to concrete block, a huge improvement in the Hurricane prone, termite ridden Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, salad and beans to sell.

loans.name: Adzo Afefa

texts.fr:
Cette dame de 35 ans est célibataire avec un enfant. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale.
Son activité se déroule à son domicile situé dans la banlieue de Lomé. Elle y vend des boites de conserves, des pates alimentaires, de l’huile végétale. Avec le crédit sollicité, elle envisage acheter de nouveaux stocks de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire la demande.
Elle compte sur l’accroissement de ses activités grâce à ce nouveau crédit pour mieux contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This 35-year old woman is single and has one child. She sells general food products. She carries out her activity in her home which is in the suburbs of Lomé. She sells canned food there, as well as pasta and vegetable oil. With the loan she is requesting she is planning on buying fresh supplies of goods in order to be able to satisfy demand more readily. She expects her activity to grow as a result of this loan and thereby to be able to contribute more to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Miguelina;   ella tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes en Cusco en la superior; su esposo es agricultor y la socia vende verduras en el mercado y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y los vende. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores para la crianza y la venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC” communal bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba, which belongs to the department of Cusco.

Our client is Miguelina and she is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children who are students of higher education in Cusco. Her husband is a farmer and she sells vegetables at the market and also raises young animals and sells them. She is requesting this loan to purchase younger animals to raise and sell.

She is grateful and values the support provided by these means. She promises to repay her loan in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of younger animals

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is from the village of  Talon, Gingoog City. She is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Susana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Susana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonio Simao

texts.pt:
Antônio Simão C. nasceu na Província de Inhambane no Distrito de Vilanculos, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 1 filha de 3 anos de idade. Fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Vilanculos para o Distrito de Namaacha a procura de emprego. Iniciou sua actividade comercial ha mais de 7 anos, hoje é dono de um estabelecimento de venda de eletrodomésticos cita no Mercado Central de Namaacha. Conta com 1 empregado que auxilia no seu negócio e consegue um lucro de cerca de 6.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. 


Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos também comerciantes. Este é o quinto empréstimo de António na Hluvuku e quarto com Kiva no valor de 20,000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (recargas de telemovel, eletrodomésticos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de (5.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt) também foram para a mesma finalidade.

 Esta confiante que mais uma vez vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto, e solicitar novos empréstimos.
texts.en:
Antônio Simão was born in the province of Inhambane in the District of Vilanculos in Southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of a 3 year-old daughter. He went to school until 7th grade but didn't finish due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports two siblings who live with him. He left Vilanculos to look for a job in the Namaacha District. He started his business more than 7 years ago. Today, he owns his own appliance store in Namaacha's Central Market. He has one employee who helps him with the business. He has an income of 6,500 meticais per month, which is used in household expenses and still saves some in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors who are also salespeople. This is Antonio's fifth loan with Hluvuku and fourth with Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 meticais. He intends to purchase prepaid cell phone cards, appliances and others to increase his inventory. The previous loans were for 5,000, 7,000, 10,000 and 15,000 meticais. All were used for this same goal. He is confident he will once again pay the loan back ahead of schedule and request new loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (prepaid cell phone cards, appliances and others)

loans.name: Aliyev

texts.ru:
N. Aliyevu 47 let . On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. N. i eqo semya jivut v regione Absheron. Natiga detyam devochke 13 let, sinu 15 let i starshemu sinu 20 let. 

N. zanimayestay etim biznesem remonta mashin uje 7 let. Teper on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya remonta mashin. V budushem on xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichit pomesheniye qde on rabotayet chtobi tuda pomeshalis bolshe mashin.
texts.en:
N. Aliyev is 47 years old. He is married and has three children. N. lives with his family in the Absheron Region. His daughter is 13 years old, and the sons are 15 and 20 years old. He has been in the auto repair business for seven years already. At present he needs 2000 AZN to purchase spare parts. In the future he would like to develop his business further and expand his shop in order to be able to accommodate more cars.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business: boys' and girls' clothing, toys, flatware, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura, se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar algodón y maíz. Como el sustento económico de su familia depende de esta actividad el se esfuerza diariamente para poder cuidar de su cultivo de manera adecuada, de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción que le asegure buenos ingresos.

Flavio desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Flavio es una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor deseo es tener exito en esta campaña agrícola y en las campañas posteriores para poder asegurarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Flavio is a family man, he is 46 years old and he lives together with his wife and their children in the Laynas sector of the La Matanza district. This district is a primarily agricultural district in the province of Morropon of the Piura region. It is located approximately four hours from the city of Chilayo in the Lambayeque region. He has worked as an agriculturist since he was young. He has a plantation field where he cultivates cotton and corn. This is the only source of income and the family depends on this business so he works very hard every day to provide the adequate care to the fields. This way he will ensure he will have a better yield and generate good earnings. Flavio wishes to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to help his plantations. To reach his goal he sees the need to request a first-time loan form Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to 500 nuevos soles. Flavios is a very calm and responsible person. His greatest wish is to see a bumper crop this season and in future cultivations, so as to ensure that his family will have an improved way of life. In the region where he lives, his neighbors and his acquaintances consider him to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to improve his cotton and corn plantations.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for the last twelve years. Her farm produces milk, tea, maize and beans which she sells at a local market. Norah is 37 years old. She is married with 5 school-aged children.

Norah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of  45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and increase her stock of maize and beans.

In future, she hopes to buy more agricultural land and acquire two  more dairy cows. She faces the challenge of animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard N. is 28 years old and single. He supports a family of eight, which includes his mother and his siblings. He does small-scale horticultural farming, which he started two years ago. This business is able to give him a monthly profit of Kshs 15,000.

Leonard has borrowed a loan of Kshs 25,000. This is his second loan in KADET, and he intends to use Kshs 3,600 for fertilizers, Kshs 5,400 for irrigation pipes, Kshs 2,800 for seeds and the remaining Kshs 13,200 for wages and other working expenses.

Leonard anticipates using the profits from the business to rent more farmland to expand his business. Having repaid the first loan successfully, Leonard hopes that he will be able to repay this loan and expand his business and also marry in the next two years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, irrigation pipes, seeds and other farm expenses

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 33 años, vive en la casa de su suegra en compañía de ella y de su esposo Juan  de 30 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos buscan que progresar cada día. Desde muy joven se acostumbró a trabajar, y cuando se junto con su pareja no dudo en continuar haciéndolo para ayudarlo en los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que en la actualidad se dedica a la labor de limpieza pública; y le gusta mucho este trabajo porque lo desempeña en un horario flexible que le permite atender a sus hijos; además las ganancias son considerables. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas personas menosprecian este trabajo, pero ella no le da mucha importancia pues es un trabajo honrado. Así transcurren los días de esta laboriosa mujer que ha sabido combinar a la perfección su trabajo con el rol de madre, y como siempre piensa en el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa; para atenderla en sus ratos libres, es por eso que quiere refaccionar una pieza de su casa,  de esta manera espera continuar adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con sus planes. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita para refaccionar una pieza de su casa, pues quiere instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and lives in her mother-in-law's house, together with her mother-in-law, her 30 year-old husband, Juan, and their two small children.  Each day, they seek to progress together.  She has been accustomed to working since she was very young, and when she got together with her husband, she did not doubt that she would continue doing so in order to help him with household expenses.  For this reason, she currently works in public cleaning.  She likes this job very much because it has a flexible schedule that allows her to tend to her children.  Furthermore, the earnings are considerable.  She dislikes that many people disparage this type of work, but she doesn't give those opinions much weight because it is an honorable job.  So that is how this hard-working woman passes her days, knowing how to perfectly balance her job with her role as mother.

As always, she is thinking about the future.  She plans to set up a small grocery store in her house, which she will tend in her free time.  In order to do so and to keep progressing, she wants to renovate part of her house.  This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to make her repayments punctually because she does not want to look bad to the people providing the money that will make her plans possible.  Vilma plans to invest this loan in the purchase of necessary materials for renovating part of her house, so that she can set up a business selling food items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate a space inside her house where she will set up a grocery store

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Keng B., age 64, has been living in the province of Kompong Tom, which is the best territory for farming. Keng B. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. Keng B. is now married and has nice children. Her husband (pictured here) works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Keng B. currently plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. Keng B. will use the income from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs during the financial crisis. 

Keng B. said that she always rented the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Currently, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. Keng B. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy her own cow

loans.name: Phán's Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming a group. They are located in Kandal village, Kandal province. The group has selected Mrs. Phán M., a 37-year-old married woman, as its leader. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chet Phat, are farmers who own a 1.10-hectare field to cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Phán M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice and vegetables. Aside from farming, Mr. Chet Phat also earns income with his plowing machine. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She graduated from primary school. She will use this loan to develop her business and to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. The borrower has a high reputation and she is a trustworthy woman which has made her gain lots of clients. The borrower has acquired a great deal of experience in sewing women’s garments of good quality and at reasonable prices. She will benefit from this loan and can also raise the income of her family.

loans.use: For purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy B. N. is a 47-year-old married man and father.  He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Cham province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother.   Luy B. N. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living, and his wife also helps in the farming business. 

Luy B. N. has six children, four are single and the other two are married.  Three of his children are employed in different occupations, and they always share their profit with him to help with the whole family’s expenses. 

In the previous month, Luy B. N. has been hiring a domestic labor to plow in his farmland, but now he lacks money to pay for the plowing cost. The remaining fund will be use to buy seeds and fertilizers to support one of his children, who is also a farmer, to plant his crop.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee, and buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco comunal Despertar, tiene 31 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Norma se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Norma empezó a trabajar en una tienda de prendas de vestir en Lima, ahí aprendió el negocio, junto un pequeño capital y comenzó a vender en la calle como ambulante. Norma viajaba a Ayacucho para las ferias de Semana Santa, nació su hija y se quedó en Ayacucho hace 9 años y casi el mismo tiempo está en FINCA, ahora tiene una tienda en la Galería Unión Olarte. A Norma le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y ahorrar.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para surtir su mercadería ahora que se aproxima la campaña navideña.
Su sueño es poder tener su propia tienda comercial y poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Awakening Communal Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner and 3 children. Norma sells women, men and children's clothing. She began working in a clothing store in Lima. There she learned the business, and with a little capital she began to sell clothing as a street vendor. Norma traveled to Ayucucho for the Holy Week festival. Her daughter was born and she stayed in Ayacucho 9 years ago and almost at the same time she is in FINCA, and now she has a store in the Union Olarte Gallery. Norma likes the x that she receives in her Communal Bank because she can access her credit and savings accounts.

She is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing clothing articles to increase her available merchandise now that the Christmas season is approaching.  Her dream is to be able to have her own commercial store and be able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing

loans.name: Kahondo Twimu Group

texts.en:
Silver is fifty years old, married with six children living in his own house in Kamwenge Uganda with a desire to educate his children up to the university level.  He has been farming tobacco for seven years now and he confesses to have not met any big challenges as the business is steadily progressing.  

He started with capital of five hundred but now has two million.  He is a member of the Kahondo Group where each member guarantees the other.  Silver needs the credit facility to plant more tobacco.

loans.use: To plant more tobbacco.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Justine has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business selling fruit and vegetables.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house. Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Âgée de 46ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant de 15ans ,Elle est dans la vente des chaussures et vêtements  pour enfants depuis 1993 avec un capital de 18500f, elle a rembourse et a fait des épargnes durant le premier cycle de son prêt 
Le second prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock de sa marchandise en achetant les vêtements et chaussures pour enfants te que  les baskets, baby boots pour fillettes et garçons, les bottes, sandales pour garçons et filles. 
Le choix dans la qualité de marchandises, la recherche des articles à la mode sont ses stratégies de vente. 
Elle veut générer beaucoup de bénéfices et devenir importateur afin  ouvrir une boutique de ventes des chaussures pour enfants. Dans son milieu de vie, elle est considérer comme une femme courageuse parce qu’elle améliore et s’occupe de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
This woman is a 46-year-old single mother of a child age 15. She has been selling children’s shoes and clothing since 1993, starting with a capital of 18,500 francs. Her first loan, which was fully refunded, allowed her to save. 

This second loan will allow her to increase her stocks by buying children’s clothes and shoes such as sneakers, baby booties, boots, and sandals for boys and girls. Her sales strategy is focused on the quality of her merchandise, and offering trendy items. 

She wants to bolster her profits and become an importer in order to open a children's shoe store. In her circle, she is seen as a brave woman for improving her child’s lifestyle and education.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes, dresses, smocks, shoes, baby booties, and sneakers

loans.name: Arasa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Arasa Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la compañía de Hugua Rey, Distrito de Santaní.
El comité Arasa Poty está en el 5to. Ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
La sra. Salmi es la presidenta del comité, ella posee una tienda general donde trabaja con algunas de sus compañeras, ellas desean poder aumentar su lista de mercaderías o productos a ofertar, por ello necesitan el crédito, ya que por recursos propios todavían están incapaces de lograrlo.
Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The Arasa Poty committee was formed when several neighbors from Hugua Rey, Santini district, joined together.

The Arasa Poty committee is in its 5th cycle with 12 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive and responsible.  The members have a great enterprising spirit since they are up to date with their payments and intend to finish this stage with very good results respecting responsibility toward the institution.

Salmi is the committee President.  She has a general store where she works with some of her fellow members.  They want to increase the list of stock items or products they offer so they need a loan because their own resources are still insufficient to do so.  Getting the loan opens many doors for their enterprises’ progress.

loans.use: To buy clothing, fruit, vegetables and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 31 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 5 years old. For 4 years she has been selling Irish potatoes. Her business is open from 7am until 7:30 pm everyday. Clementine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell. If this satisfaction is reached, Clementine hopes to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura,  natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri, de 34 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, convive con Marino de 41 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 01 hijo llamado Ronaldo de 05 años y juntos viven en su propia casa, situado en la Av. el Aeropuerto perteneciente al distrito de Kimbiri. Rosaura, empezó su aventura culinaria trabajando como empleada en distintos restaurantes y con el conocimiento adquirido quiso montar su propio negocio de comidas donde ofrece sus platillos en las carretas de manera ambulante en el distrito de Kimbiri. Viene realizando este trabajo hace 05 años; con sus ahorros acumulados más el ingreso de su pareja  construyeron una casa  de 02 pisos; el primer piso esta arrendado y funciona como depósito de la Municipalidad de Kimbiri, en el segundo nivel existen 08 cuartos y están destinados para alquiler. El arrendamiento de los espacios de su casa le genera buenos ingresos. El crédito solicitado es para mejorar las fachadas de su vivienda. Los planes que tiene en mente es construir un 3cer nivel para así tener  un mayor ingreso. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar los cuartos de su morada. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante y se  siente muy agradecida con Ia Institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales de construcción  para mejorar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosaura is originally from the city of Kimbiri. She is 34 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking person. She lives together with her common-law husband, Marino, who is 41 years old. The fruit of this relationship is one child named Ronaldo, 5 years old. They live together in a house which they own located in El Aeropuerto Avenue in the district of Kimbiri. Rosaura started her culinary adventure as an employee in different restaurants and with the skill that she acquired she wanted to start her own catering business, offering her prepared foods along the streets itinerantly in the district of Kimbiri. She has had this business for 5 years. With her savings and her partner's income they built a 2-story house. The main floor is rented and it serves as a depot for the Municipality of Kimbiri. There are 8 rooms on the second floor and they are rented as lodging.  The rental of the spaces in their house is a good source of income. The loan that she requests is to improve the house. The plan she has in mind is to build a third level tot he house in order to improve their income. But for now the priority is to purchase construction materials to improve the bedrooms of the house. This is the fourth loan she has had with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making all of her payments on time. She wishes to access a loan in the future and she feels very thankful to this organization for granting her a loan. With the 2000 nuevos soles she requests she will purchase construction materials to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to improve her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the materials she needs in her business

loans.name: Yovanny Alfredo

texts.es:
Yovanny de 29 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad en la venta de pollo por el sector donde vive (en la foto aparece con su esposa).

En la actualidad de ventas de pollo trabaja todos los días junto con su esposa. Tiene un hijo de esta en escuela, con el préstamo desea comprarse una moto para la distribución de pollo y mejorar sus ventas. En un futuro quiere ampliar su negocio para darle un buen vivir a su familia.
texts.en:
Yovanny is 29 years old. He is a hardworking man who started his activity selling chicken in the area he lives in (he appears with his wife in the photo).  

At present, he sells chickens everyday with his wife. He has a son in primary school. With the loan, he wants to buy a motorcycle to distribute the chicken and improve his sales. He wants to grow his business to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Augusto, el socio tiene 42 años y aunque en su D.N.I; diga que el tiene el estado civil como soltero él dice que es conviviente, el socio es pareja de la socia Luisa y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad; el socio trabaja prestando el servicio de transporte, el traslada carga pesada con su camión y alquila su camión a todo aquel que lleve carga pesada para la construcción u otros; el socio desea en esta ocasión renovar un par de llantas para su camión y es por eso que el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” (Pro Development) and is located in the town of Pisac which belongs to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Augusto, 42, and even though his D.N.I. (National Identity Document) says his marital status is single, he says that he lives with his partner.  He is the life partner of the member, Luisa, and they have two children together who are 13 and 11 years of age.

He works providing transportation services.  He transports heavy cargo in his truck and also leases his truck to whoever needs to transport heavy loads for construction or others.  On this occasion, he wants to replace a pair of tires on his truck and this is why he is asking for a loan: to buy tires.

He is grateful and wishes to express that he will pay his installments in a disciplines way.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad; El socio es conviviente;  El socio pertenece a este banco conformado inicialmente por mujeres y ahora invitarona  sus conyugues y parientes; El socio tiene 2 hijos de 10, 8 años de edad; el socio alterna sus actividades con el servicio de taxi, el socio tienen un automóvil propio y el sale de su casa a las 6 de la mañana todos los días y toma un receso a la 1.pm hasta las 3p.m y vuelve a salir hasta las 10 de la noche; el socio desea el crédito en esta ocasión para poder hacer el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, el socio planea comprar una llanata de repuesto para su vehiculo también y pasar por la revisión técnica, para todo ello el requiere el prestamo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su auto (taxi) y comprar una llanta de repuesto. 

El socio se encuentra satisfecho con el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is 30 and is a member of the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers) communal bank located in Tica Tica District, Cusco Province and Department.

He belongs to this bank, formed initially by women who now invite their spouses and relatives to join. He has a live-in spouse and two children who are 10 and 8 years of age.  He alternates his daily chores with providing taxi services.  He has a car of his own and leaves home at 6am every day.  He takes a break from 1-3pm and then goes out again until 10 at night.  He wants the loan this time to repair his vehicle. He is planning on purchasing spare rims for his car and also to pass the technical revision. He is asking for the loan to invest in vehicle (taxi) repair.

He is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle (taxi) repair.

loans.name: Seiran

texts.en:
Seiran comes from the village of Tsira, in the southern part of the country. Seiran is 52 years old and married. He lives with his family – his wife Manushak, two adult sons (25 and 30 years old), his daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (five and one year old). 

Seiran is a taxi driver and earns approximately 450 Laris per month. Along with this job, Seiran also gets income from agricultural activities. In particular, he has a business raising calves. Also, with the assistance of his younger son, he cultivates family-owned 1-ha land and grows potatoes, maize and haricot beans, which are sold on Akhaltsikhe open market. 

With the requested credit, Seiran will purchase calves, which will be raised on the farm. In fall they will be sold locally for a higher price. 

Profit received from this business activity will be used for expansion of the family business.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, an electrician, and is a mother of two children, one  is in college and the other is working. By the grace of God, Evelyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to enable her son to finish college.  This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Evelyn, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance they can leave to their children.

Evelyn maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer’s order is prepaid in cash by dealers such as Evenyn, and given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference is the profit that the dealers earns as their income.  Evelyn's regular customers are her neighbors and people in her local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1100 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Evelyn is requesting a loan for Php 22,000. She will be utilizing this loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Evelyn dreams of being successful in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week an where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: order more products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married.  She has two children aged 6 and 12. She runs a snack and drinks shop where she sells cakes, soda, tea and food. Josephine employs two people and has been running this business for 18 years. She intends to use her loan to purchase more ingredients needed for baking cakes, yogurt, and equipment needed for making fresh juice. 

Josephine hopes to use the profit she makes to expand her business and to pay for her children’s education. She also dreams of being able to build residential and rental houses. Josephine describes herself as creative and innovative.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients needed for baking cakes, yogurt, and equipment needed for making fresh juice.

loans.name: Diego Leonel

texts.es: Diego Leonel tiene 46 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 21 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y mantener a su familia. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, el empezó esta actividad desde muy temprana edad al lado de su papa pues él le enseñaba este negocio hasta lograr independizarse de su padre. Solicito el préstamo para comprar vacas, toros, chivos. Con esta inversión esperar sacar una producción con calidad.
texts.en:
Diego Leonel is 46 years old and works buying and selling cattle.  He has done this work for more than 21 years, and with a lot of effort and sacrifice, he has managed to get ahead and support his family.  He has two young children in his care.  He started this work from a young age, working alongside his father.  He taught himself the business so that he could become independent from his parents.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase cows, bulls, and goats.  With this investment, he hopes to have a production of good quality.

loans.use: to purchase cows, bulls, and goats.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Sarah has a business selling shoes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business.        

Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lourdes
