texts.es: Lourdes es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 67 años es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas.La actividad de Lourdes es la venta de comida, lo realiza en la vereda de su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija con quien lleva ya casi 2 años trabajando en este negocio.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede distraerse al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos, además le gusta mucho estar a lado de su hija quien es su principal soporte en el negocio, lo que no le gusta es tener que cerrar todo y no vender nada cuando hay fuertes lluvias que son muy comunes en la región. La ubicación de su negocio esta en una avenida muy transitada por lo que siempre tiene clientes fijos y algunos viajeros quienes se van encantados por su trato amable y lo cómodo de sus precios. Ella tiene en mente hacer crecer su casa para así no tener que estar guardando todos sus productos cada vez que llueva.Este es el primer préstamo entre Lourdes y MFP, espera poder pagar a tiempo y no fallar a la persona que le recomendó ni mucho menos al grupo que le trato muy bien desde que ingreso.Con los 1000 soles solicitados ella comprará materiales para arreglar la fachada de su casa, entre ellos listones, maderas y calaminas; además ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Lourdes is a hardworking women. She is 67 years old, married, and lives in her own house along with her husband and one of her daughters. Lourdes’s business is selling food. She does this in the entrance to her home and she tells us that with the help of her daughter she has been working in this business for almost 2 years. What she likes most about her work is that she can have fun at the same time she is earning an income. Also, she really likes working alongside her daughter, who is her main help in the business. What she doesn’t like is having to close up and not sell anything whenever there is a heavy rain, which is very common in her area. The location of her business is a busy street which is why she always has regular customers and some travelers who are very pleased with her friendly service and comfortable prices. She is planning to expand her house so that she doesn’t have to bring in all of her products every time it rains. This is Lourdes’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She expects to be able to pay on time and not let down the person who recommended her, and much less the group, which has treated her very well since she became a member. With the PEN 1,000.00 she has requested, she will buy materials to expand the front of her house, such as wooden supports, wood, tin roofing, and also ingredients and other inputs for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand the front of her house, such as wooden supports, wood, tin roofing, and also ingredients and other inputs for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending and networking.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Asylkul's Group

texts.en:
Asylkul, the treasurer of this group, is 46 and married to a farmer. She and her husband have four daughters and a son. Their first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, while their son and second daughter are at school, and the other two daughters are twins of preschool age.(under seven).

In order to earn a livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock for eventual sale. With money received from the loan, Asylkul wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with nine children; two still attend school, while seven have already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a basket-weaving business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With her KES 15,000 loan, Mwanasha wants to purchase building materials, timber and blocks so she can construct a permanent home. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, timber and blocks so she can construct a permanent home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for age-appropriate furniture, musical instruments, and outdoor playtoys.

loans.name: Sokheoun

texts.en: Sokheoun, 51, is a fisher and fish seller who earns $2.5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter and earns $3 per day. They have five children - one is studying and the other four work, earning $10 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. Her husband has been a carpenter for about five years and he can have a lot of customers. She wants to buy more fishing equipment to make more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is applying for another loan to reinvest in his motorbike (boda boda) business. He will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase spare motorbike parts. In the future, Gilbert wants to operate a large automobile shop. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Gilbert has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase spare motorbike parts.

loans.name: Giselle María

texts.es:
La  Señora Giselle Maria tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive en  la Comunidad de Agualote, Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Su esposo trabaja de operario en una empresa maquiladora.
Comenzó su negocio de venta de alimentos hace 3 años, con el propósito de obtener otros ingresos y apoyar la economía familiar.
Doña Giselle ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de insumos y utensilios de cocina para la preparación de los alimentos. Ella espera que sus ventas aumenten ya que con los utensilios que comprara podrá realizar la preparación de los alimentos de manera más rápida.
Con los ingresos que ha obtenido logro mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a su hijo con la educación escolar.
Para el futuro planea destinar sus utilidades en la construcción de un local propio, ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Giselle Maria, age 23, is married and has one child.  She lives in the Agualote community in the Azacualpa municipality, Santa Bárbara.  Her husband works in an assembly plant.

She started her business of selling food three years ago.  Her intention was to get other income and to financially support the family.

Giselle has requested a loan to buy supplies and kitchen utensils to prepare food.  She hopes that her sales will increase.  With the utensils that she will buy she will be able to prepare the food more rapidly.

With the income she has received she has managed to improve her house and to help her son with his education.  In the future she plans to use her profits to build her own place because she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy supplies and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jovinille

texts.en: Jovinille is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Jovinille has a public utility van that provides services to the community. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Jovinille has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovinille hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 28 años de edad convive con Teofilo de 40 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Isabel, desde muy joven trabajaba en la venta de productos de primera necesidad. En un inicio lo hacia en la feria del distrito, porque no contaba con un local adecuado. Pero con el pasar de los años junto un pequeño capital más el préstamo que antes saco de MFP, construyó su casa y en ella acondiciono u lugar que ahora es su tienda, donde ofrece sus productos sin preocuparse muchas veces de sacar afuera como ambulante. Ella  poco a poco fue ganándose la confianza de sus vecinos quienes son su clientes potenciales, a si de esta manera es como trabaja Isabel para poder darle el bienestar a su familia. Mientras que su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pero en ocasiones él le apoya a su querida esposa, pues lo mismo hace Isabel cuando su esposo requiere de ayuda. Este es su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Isabel seguirá trabajando poniéndole más ganas por el bien de su banco comunal. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Isabel, 28, lives with Teófilo, 40, and they have a son.  They live in their own house located in Sivia District.  Isabel has worked selling basic staple items since a very young age.  At the beginning she did so in the local district street market because she couldn’t find an adequate locale.  However, as years went by she saved up a bit of capital and added to her previous MFP loan was able to build her house and she equipped a space there that’s now her store where she can sell her wares without having to worry about having to go out to sell as a street vendor.  She gradually won over her neighbors’ trust who are her potential customers; this is how Isabel works to provide wellbeing for her family.  Her husband works as a farmer and sometimes he helps his beloved wife just like Isabel sometimes helps him when he needs help.

This is her second MFP loan and she pledges to make her installment payments punctually.  Isabel will continue to work hard and giving her best for her communal bank.  She will use the 2500 new soles to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Séraphine s'est spécialisée dans la vente de Bananes, oignons, choux, oeufs et tomates au marché Vèdoko. Elle fait ses empruntes dans un autre marché et chez les jardiniers de la place. Dans le but d'élagir son domaine d'activité, de satisfaire sa clientèle et de maximiser ses intérêts, elle sollicite et obtient un prêt à Finadev. Le revenu issu de ce prêt l'aidera à couvrir partiellement les charges de son foyer et à renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Séraphine is married and the mother of 2 children. She specializes in selling produce, including bananas, onions, cabbages, eggs and tomatoes, at the market of Vèdoko in Cotonou. She gets her supplies at another market, and from local gardeners.  

With the goal of expanding her business, satisfy her clientele and maximize her revenue, she sought and obtained a loan from FINADEV. The revenue from this loan will help her to cover part of the cost of her household, and to reinforce her stock.

loans.use: to buy 60 trays of eggs, 2 baskets of tomatoes, 1 basket of onions and some fruit.

loans.name: Sam Soom Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SAM SOOM  Banco que ya tiene una secuencia, pero con dos socias nuevas,  esta conformado por nueve  personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona Tembladerani por se dedican a la venta de cd venta de artículos para celulares   otros que se dedican a la venta de ropa en el alto cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo,  también están dos varones que viven en la misma zona, La presidenta se llama Shirley ella tiene la actividad de venta de accesorios para celular y cd y su puesto en una avenida céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  ella es socia antigua muy responsable, trabaja con esta actividad hace 2 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de accesorios de celular para esta época de fin de año la Sra. Shirley es una persona joven trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank SAM SOOM which already has a loan cycle, but now has two new members, is made up of 9 people. 

The majority of the women live in the Tembladerani area. They sell CDs and mobile phone accessories, others sell high end clothes which are well known in the group. There are also two men who live in the same area.

The president is called Shirley, she sells mobile phone accessories and CDs on a central avenue that runs through the city of La Paz. She is an established member and very responsible. She has been working in this trade for two years.

She will use the loan money to buy mobile phone accessories for the end of year holiday period. Shirley is a hard working young person and grateful to the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: to sell mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Luci

texts.es:
La señora Lucí se dedica  a la venta de comida hace ya varios años,  vive con su cónyuge el señor Guillermo, actualmente  cuenta con negocio de venta de comidas (almuerzo), el negocio se encuentra ubicado por la zona del parque industrial, se sitúa el mismo en la casa del padre del esposo, le va muy bien con su negocio ya que por que por ser populosa la zona incremento su clientela      
La Sra. Lucí es clienta antigua y solicito el crédito para  la compra de material de construcción para hacer construir un galpón para su negocio ya que es temporada de lluvias y necesita techarlo,  La Sra. Lucí  agradeció por el apoyo que le dio la institución, y también por la rapidez del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Lucí has been selling food for some years. She lives with her common-law husband Guillermo. 

Currently she has a business selling food (lunch). The business is located in the industrial park zone, in her father-in-law's house. Her business is going well as it is located in a populated area which increases her customer base.

Lucí is a repeat client of Emprender asking for a loan in order to buy construction material in order to build a roof protecting her food stand as it is the rainy season and she needs a roof overhead. Lucí appreciates the help the institution gives her and the fast funding.

loans.use: to buy construction material to build a roof over her business

loans.name: Twishyirehamwe 23964 Group

texts.en:
The client has 35 years old and is a widow. Even if the client is a widow has four children. The first child was born in 1999, the second child was born in 2001, the third child was born in 2002 and the last one was born in 2005.

The client is the president of the group which is called TWISHYIREHAMWE 23964 and she is the second person from left side in the picture. All members are 19. The client sells beans and sorghum to the community, even at the market. 

She has 3 years in this business and she has 2 people in her business to help. with a profit The client says that she will expand her agriculture business by buying fertilizer to grow up her beans and sorghum to get more profit, she will be able to build her own house, she will buy a goat, she will be able to continue paying school fees easier for her children...

The client thank so much Vision Finance Company which is providing loans to the Rwandese.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is married with four children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She sales fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes,onions,cabbages,egg plant,mangoes,oranges.  She works and sells to all categories of people but on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees,rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes,onions,cabbages,egg plant,mangoes,oranges

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en: Adolfina is a 46 year old widow with 4 children. She has been a widow for 14 years and during that years to date Adolfina has been taking the responsibility to be the householder. Ever since, Adolfina had given opportunity by a school party nearby her house to allow her make a business. She then prefers to make cakes and sells it for the students. The only hardship that Adolfina found is the school holiday for Christmas is coming soon. It means that she could not make money, but then she has an idea to produce cakes and sell it in her own house. Therefore she requested a total loan of amounting 2.250.000 IDR. This loan will be used to pay for building materials because Adolfina would like to improve her terrace to be a small simple kiosk where she could sit leisurely and sells her cakes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build the kiosk as cement, sand, etc

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is an awesome lady. She is a widowed mother of three beautiful children. She joined Life in Africa in 2003 and is now the WE Center Manager. She is loved and respected by all who work with her.

5 years ago, Monica's husband died of injuries he suffered in a trucking accident. After he died, his family came and claimed all his property, including their family home, leaving Monica and her children left on the street to start life over from scratch. This sort of thing happens far too often in Uganda and there was nothing legal that Monica could do. When she found her way to Life in Af-rica she was destitute, but realized that she could learn new skills that might improve her situation.

Monica learned quickly and worked hard. She is now the Manager of the Life in Africa WE Center and earns a steady income. Her children are all in school and their lives have greatly improved. But they still have no home to call their own, and this is a painful memory for the whole family. Monica feels it's important to give her children a home that no one can take away from them or evict them from.

She has sold some property her family owned in her village and has managed to buy a plot of land in Kireka on the outskirts of Kampala. Here she plans to build a solid family home. She has carefully planned and the project will be completed in three years using money she saves from her salary and a series of loans. The total budget for the house she wishes to build is shs. 13,000,000 ($7220).

She is seeking a loan in the amount of shs 800,000 ($475) for the first phase. This will build the foundation of the house. Once this loan is repaid, she will start on the next phase and continue until the house is built. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy: hard core stones, bricks, sand, and cement, all for laying the foundation of the house.

Based on her current income, Monica can repay this loan in 12 months. She has designated 1/4 of the interest she pays on her loan to support Life in Africa's Internet4Change training program.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE MACHINES FOR HIS CYBERCAFE

loans.name: Abela

texts.en: Mrs. Abela J. is 35 years old and lives in the urban area of Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She opened her own business in 2002. She is happily married with two children. She plans to use her loan of USD350 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of drinks

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Mrs. Chi was born in 1964 and her husband is the same age. They have two sons, age 13 and 18, who are students at secondary and primary school. Mrs. Chi and her husband sell fresh fish at home. Their income is $11 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to invest in their business. They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell fresh fish

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli joined the programme in 2005. Her husband is unemployed and they have  7 grown up children to look after. She joined SPBD because she had nowhere else she could get financial support for her family. She started off with selling snacks such as Twisties, chewing gum, lollies and so on in the village school. She currently runs her own snack shop. In the future she hopes to extend her shop and is looking at running another business in addition to her shop.

loans.use: To assist with her shop.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elsa is 32 years old, married, and her husband works as a chauffeur in the public transportation system and she sells clothes in her home. She buys the garments in a place called la Mesilla, located on the border with Guatemala, where she finds variety and good prices. She belongs to the group Reina 5 and the other members are doña Maria Paula R. Mazariegos, who sells chicken meat in her home and doña Irma Martínez Pérez, who sells delicacies from outside her house. The loan will be used by Maria Elsa to buy more clothes on her next trip to la Mesilla and that way she will increase her sales. Marisa and Irma will adapt a space in their home to display their products in a more attractive way.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

MARIA ELSA, tiene 32 años, es casada su esposo trabaja como chofer de locomoción colectiva y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en su casa. La compra en la frontera con Guatemala en un lugar llamado la Mesilla donde encuentra gran variedad de surtido y precios. Pertenece al grupo Reina 5 y las otras integrantes son: Maria Paula R. Mazariegos (venta de pollos trozados en su casa) y doña Irma Martínez Pérez (vende antojitos en la puerta de sus casa). Con el préstamo esperan invertir Maria Elsa comprando mas ropa en su próximo viaje a la Mesilla para aumentar sus ventas y Marisa e Irma adaptaran un lugar en su casa para exhibir mejor sus productos.

loans.use: BUY MORE PRODUCTS TO INCREASE SALE OF CLOTHING

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary F. is 43 years old,  married with four children. Her plantation is her only source of income, but she is experienced in running it as she grew up on a plantation. She has applied for this loan in order to buy weed-killing chemicals. She sells her crops at the market three days per week and makes a profit of 230 Tala ($92 USD) per day. Mary plans to use her this loan to expand her plantation in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Ilkhama

texts.en: Ilkhama (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 3 children. The M. family lives in the Khachmaz region. She is 42 years old. This family has been in the farming business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy fertilizer for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P., 49, lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works selling rice and a variety of Khmer food to the people in her area, earning about $5 each day in profit. Her husband works as a fisherman and typically earns about $2 each day from selling his fish. Four of her children are enrolled in school and the other is currently unemployed.

Mrs. Sok P. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for her unemployed child so that he can use it to transport passengers in his area. This will enable Mrs. Sok P.’s family make additional income and raise their standard of living. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Sok P. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle with a trailer to use to transport passengers

loans.name: Tatu's Njinjo B Group

texts.en:
Nuru, 25 years old, has been selling chips for two years. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Nuru has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling medicine, fish and clothes.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rosalina Maria

texts.es:
Rosalina beongs to the Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús and sells sweets in front of the district's National Bank, in the province of Carhuaz, department of Ancash.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy 10 packets of chizitos (cheese puffs) 10 bags of candies, 4 boxes of cookies, and 8 packages of soft drinks.

She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children who support her in her business. Her husband sells ice cream in the Plaza de Carhuaz.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Divino Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, frente al Banco de La nación del distrito, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 10 paquetes de chizitos, 10 bolsas de caramelos,04 cajas de galletas, 8 paquetes de gaseosa.

Ella tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, quienes la apoyan en este negocio, su esposo vende helados en la plaza de Carhuaz

loans.use: With this loan she will buy cookies, soft drinks, etc. for her sales

loans.name: Efrain Ricardo

texts.es:
Efrain S.'s dreams are to give his children the best education and examples to follow. He has a seven-year-old son with his wife, who is his support in everything and who work as a store clerk.

He is employed as a top national policy official who has twenty years of service to his community, helping to reduce delinquency and maintaining order and security.

With the loan that he is requesting, he want to lay bricks in his house and make a small enlargement.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Los sueños de Don Efrain S. son los de darle la mejor educacion y ejemplo a sus hijos, quien tiene un hijo de 7 años con su esposa quien es su apoyo en todo y trabaja como dependienta en una tienda.

El se desempeña como primer ofiical de la policia nacional quien tiene 20 años de servir a la comunidad constribuyendo a minimizar la delincuencia manteniendo el orden y la seguridad. Con el prestamo que solicita quiere ponerle ladrillos a su casa y hacer una pequeña ampliacion.

loans.use: Bricklaying on the floor of his house.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi P., 38 years old, is living with her husband and 4 children with their ages ranging from 3 to 13 years old. She joined the Fund since 1998. At first, she used her borrowed money of 50 USD to breed animals. Although the activity went well, she did not earn profit regularly. Therefore, she switched to rice-milling. She saved her profits and spent them on buying rice-husking machineto assist local people. Also, she shipped her husked rice into the city for the wholesale stores. Her average income every year is 2000-3000 USD. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy unhusked rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Phượng, 38 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con từ 3 đến 13 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ năm 1998. Số vốn vay ban đầu chỉ có 50USD được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Công việc tuy cũng mang lại lợi nhuận nhưng thu nhập không thường xuyên. Các vòng vốn sau, chị chuyển sang làm hàng xáo. Số tiền lãi tích cóp qua các vòng được chị Phượng mua máy xát lúa phục vụ bà con nông thôn. Ngoài ra chị còn mua lúa xay xát rồi đưa ra thành phố nhập cho các đại lý gạo. Thu nhập bình quân hàng năm của chị lên đến 2000-3000USD. Vòng vốn này chị Phượng đề nghị xin vay 950USD để mua lúa về xay xát.

loans.use: Buy unhusked rice

loans.name: Habilova

texts.ru:
D. is 25 years old, with two children. Her husband works abroad in Russia to support the family. After finishing middle school, D. matriculated in a medical course for her certification. For the last five years since then, she has been renting a space where she runs a pharmacy and successfully sells medication.

D. has a license for distributing medicine and has many regular customers, since she's very communicative and is known for giving reliable advice on the use of various medicines. She is applying for a loan to expand her business.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Дилафруз девушка в возрасте 25 лет, имеет двоих детей , муж на заработках в России. Дилафруз окончив среднюю школу поступила на медицинские курсы, окончив получила сертификат и уже 5 лет как она арендовав помещение под свою аптеку успешно торгует лекарствами.

У Дилафруз имеется лицензия на розничную реализацию лекарственных средст. У нее много постоянных клиентов и так как она коммуникабельная женщина она многим дает хорошие рекомендации по использованию того или иного лекарства. Сейчас она собирается получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Sale of pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
These are Ibrahim C., Derick B., Daniel B., Foday K. and Alusine K.. They are all working for the army. These soldiers want loans for various reasons. Ibrahim K. wants to use the loan to build a house. Derick, Daniel, and Alusine will use theirs to give to their wives to add onto their current business capital. And Foday will use his to pursue his education. They are requesting a loan of US$ 1,550.

Lamin Turay who is the leader of this group was born in Freetown, 31 years ago. He is married with 2 children.

loans.use: To give to their wives to invest in businesses

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario started the business because she likes sales and through them, she could earn extra income to help her husband with the household expenses because what he was earning wasn’t enough and their children's needs were increasing. She started in May of 2000. Before, she tried to find a job but was unsuccessful. It was then that she began to consume the naturalist products that she now sells. A friend encouraged her to become a salesperson because the commissions obtained from sales of the products were attractive. Nevertheless, she lasted only a short time doing this because her sales were good in the beginning but little by little began decreasing. For this reason she looked for something else to do to that could allow her to take advantage of her existing client base and began to sell silver jewelry.

Rosario needs a loan for US$800, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase articles of silver jewelry like trinkets, bracelets, chains and earrings to offer an extensive selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario inicio el negocio porque le gustan las ventas y a través de ellas podía obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que lo que el ganaba no les alcanzaba y sus hijos cada vez mas necesidades. Comenzó en el mes de Mayo de 2000, antes trató de conseguir un empleo pero no lo logró. Fue entonces que empezó a consumir los productos naturistas que ahora vende; una amiga la animó para que fuera vendedora ya que las comisiones que se obtenían de la venta del producto eran atractivas, sin embargo duro poco tiempo con esta actividad ya que sus ventas empezaron bien pero poco a poco fueron decreciendo, por lo que busco otra actividad donde pudiera aprovechar la cartera de clientes que ya tenia y empezó a vender joyería de plata.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar artículos de joyería de plata dijes, pulseras, cadenas, aretes, etc., y ofrecer un extenso surtido a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea T., 50, is married and has started a business since 1979 buying recycled items from different locations in her town and reselling them to the recycling plant for a profit, each day making about $2.30 of net income. Her husband has worked as a farmer growing rice and feeding cows since 1979 as well. She has seven children. One is a student, three others are employed by a garment factory, and the other three are married and live outside the family's home. Mrs. Chea T. and her husband would like to purchase two more cows to help with their farming work. Cows can greatly help with plowing and carrying heavy items.

loans.use: To buy two cows to help her farming work.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné N. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants avec 2 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des  poissons séchés et de poissons fumés. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b>
texts.en:
Ngoné N. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is also responsible for 2 others. She has been a member of the village bank of Pire Gourèye for three years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling dried and smoked fish. She wants to bolster her little business. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Kadiatou M

texts.fr: Kadidiatou M D., 36 ans, mariée, 04 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides qu’elle décortique et transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou M D., age 36, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Sinthiang Coundara for four and a half years. Her business consists of buying peanuts that she husks and then transforms into peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to help with family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, firewood, and buckets and to hire help

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mr. Phorn S. lives in Ang Ta Kouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who earns a small income by cultivating rice on his small piece of land. In order to improve his living, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. Phorn S. is a 52-year-old widower and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie B. is a widow with five children.  When her husband passed away  three years ago, Marie started  a small business  by  selling shoes so that  she can make  some  profit  and take care of her children. Now the demand has grown up and her needs as well.  Marie would like to enlarge her business buy buying more shoes. Unfortunately she is limited financially and that why she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars. With the loan, she will be able to sell more shoes, make profit and pay back her loan  within 18 months.
Thank you so much for supporting her.

loans.use: Selling Women's, Men's  and Children's  Shoes

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess O. is 54-years-old and is married with six children. She sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She creates lovely designs for her customers. The demand for her clothing is high. Princess is requesting a loan of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art S., 38, is married and lives with three of her children in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2.50 each day. The weather conditions and inflation most negatively impact her business. The domestic price of rice and fertilizers has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the a recent government report. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, including Art S.. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to expand her cultivation. The rest of the loan will be used to repair her leaking house. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seed and repair her leaky roof.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela B. makes hats for a living. She is 59 years old and has 3 children. She previously worked as a waitress in a restaurant in her town. When her husband proposed marriage, she stopped working and went back to their barrio. Her business is making native hats and mats. She earns enough income to pay for her children's education. Aside from weaving native hats, she has a small garden in her backyard. She and her children water it every day. She uses the profit from her harvest to pay for their other needs.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her beautiful hats. She is also interested in establishing a small sari-sari store. Her loan will definitely help her expand her business and get started in a new business.

CEVI supports Rosela in her business. She is provided with the same credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making hats

loans.name: Ozulonye

texts.en: Ozulonye sells crates of drinks. She started this business in 2000. She requests a loan for 80,000 NGN ($550) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Thưa Nguyễn, 35, lives in the town of Hiải Dương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Thưa owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Thưa has engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Thưa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thưa has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase breeding livestock. Thưa is requesting a loan of 20000000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her ninth from TYM Fund. Thưa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
Estefa es persona de la tercera edad pero sigue trabajando como pequeño agricultor y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos para la comercialización de los mismo en la feria de Viacha; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su hija y nieta; viven en casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para obtener mas leche y aumentar su producción de  quesos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Estefa is now elderly but she is still working as a small agricultural and dairy farmer. She uses the cows' milk to make cheeses, which she sells at the Viacha market. This is her primary source of income, and she uses it to support her daughter and granddaughter. They live in a house they own in Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to get more milk and increase her cheese production. This is her fourth loan with Impro, and her history of faithful payment has ensured its approval.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Aracelly Petronila

texts.es: La señora Aracelly Petronila A. , tiene la edad de 34 años , habita en le barrio San Juan de la Concepción en la ciudad de Ticuantepe , junto  a su esposo el cual trabaja , como albañil para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace nueve años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , doña Aracelly inicio con esfuerzos propios , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ,  en un futuro quiere diversificar sus cultivo . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mejorar la producción y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Aracelly Petronila A. 34, lives in the San Juan de la Concepción neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband. He works as a bricklayer to help with the household expenses. They have two children who are currently in school. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. She has been doing agricultural work for nine years, a business she started through her own efforts. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. In the future she would like to diversify her crops. With the loan she will buy the necessary supplies and fertilizers to improve production and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and agricultural fertilizers to apply to her crops

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Irshad bano baji wants a loan to buy costume jewelry to sell. 
Sumera baji wants a loan to buy readymade garments to sell. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy decorative pieces to sell. 
Safia baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her candle making business. 

Shamim baji is married to M. I.. They have lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and has been in this profession for the past 5 years. "I am applying for a loan to change the body of my husband’s rickshaw, " she says.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: "Bushra baji is showing her decorative item in this picture".

loans.use: To change the body of auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Martha es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, leña, verduras, carne, gas, además prepara chupetes que también vende en su tienda.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, fideo y leña.
Los sueños de Martha son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Community Bank Suni which means Plenty in quechua. Marths is married, she is 45 years old and has 4 children, Martha has a store at her house where she sells groceries, wood, vegetables, meat, gas and also prepares and sells ice pops at her store. Martha needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, noodles and wood. Martha's dream is that her children turn into professionals, and to grow her business to increase her profit.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, noodles and good.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of one child, a boy who is currently in school. Akua loves selling goods and this is how she makes a living. Above all, she is dedicated and time conscious to her work. She trades in bulk supplies of onions. She takes delivery of stock from the northern region of Ghana; this, she said, prevents her from using middlemen who would supply to her at higher price. For lack of capital, she requests a loan to buy bulk onions to increase her stock of goods. She has been in business for the last two years and hopes to save more for taking care of the child and for the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies of onions in bags

loans.name: Las Artesanas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Artesanas Unidas esta conformado por tres mujeres provenientes de  San Juan de Oriente un pequeño poblado localizado a un kilómetro de Catarina. Este pueblo  es uno los más grandes productores de artesanía en barro nicaragüense.

Las integrantes de grupo  son M. Elena López Medina, L. M. B. C. y Gregoria Bernarda V. C. todas ellas son artesanas y necesitan capital para poder comprar materiales para la producción de sus piezas en cerámica y barro.

La coordinadora es la señora M. Elena López Medina de treinta y nueve años de edad de los cuales tiene veinte años dedicada a la producción de artesanía. López quien elabora piezas de cerámica para negocios y turistas  ya ha trabajado con Adim con lo que pudo logran un crecimiento en su negocio y mayor estabilidad para su familia.

Actualmente el mayor desafío de ella es la crisis económica del país que perjudica al negocio sin embargo ella esta segura que esto se combate con trabajo y esfuerzo. Su mayor anhelo es que su negocio prospere y que sus dos hijos de puedan seguir estudiando y prepararse.

Las otras dos integrantes son la señora Gregoria Bernarda V. C. de cuarenta años de edad quien produce artesanías y  la señora L. M. B. C. de treinta años de edad quien tiene su propio taller de artesanía las cuales vende a los turistas. Ella lleva siete años en este negocio junto con su esposo Carlos Sebastián López quien es artesano.  
 
Todas ellas esperan poder seguir  trabajando en esta hermosa y difícil profesión  tradicional e hereditaria para demostrar la belleza nicaragüense.
texts.en:
The United Artisans Group is comprised of three women from San Juan de Oriente, a small town located a kilometer outside of Catarina. This town is one of the biggest Nicaraguan pottery producers. The members of the group are M. Elena López Medina, L. M. B. C. y Gregoria Bernarda V. C., who are all craftspeople and need materials for the production of their ceramic and earthenware pieces. The group leader is M. Elena López Medina, 39 years old. She has spent 20 years working in handicraft production. Lopez creates ceramic pieces for businesses and tourists and has already worked with Kiva partner ADIM, through which she was able to grow her business and create more stability for her family. Right now, her greatest challenge is the country's economic crisis, which has hurt her business. Still, she is sure that she will meet this challenge through hard work. Her main goal is for her business to prosper and for her two children to be able to continue going to school. The other two members of the group are Gregoria Bernarda V. C., 40 years old, who [also] produces handicrafts, and L. M. B. C., 30 years old, who has her own shop for handicrafts that she sells to tourists. She and her husband Carlos Sebastián López, who is also a craftsman, have had this business for seven years. All the women hope to be able to continue working in this wonderful, yet difficult, profession, which is one of tradition that has been passed down through the generations, showcasing Nicaragua's beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for creating ceramic and earthenware handicrafts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells snails and other food items. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more snails and other food items to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Ricardo Orlando

texts.pt:
Ricardo nasceu na Província de Inhambane (530 km a norte de Maputo) tem 37 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 1 e 12 anos. Somente o filho mais novo é que não freqüenta escola. Estudou ate 5 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições por parte dos seus pro genitores. Para dos filhos e esposa, não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria.

Saiu de Inhambane a maputo juntamente com seus irmãos mais velhos a procura de melhores condições de vida. Vive no distrito de boane há 8 anos. Foi neste distrito que aprendeu a fazer pequenos negócios, como forma de ganhar dinheiro para sobrevivência. Vende roupa nova que compra na áfrica do sul (calcas e fatos para homens). Compra, por exemplo, um fato a 870.00MT e revende a 1.200,00MT. Consegue vender peças de roupas equivalentes a 16.000,00MT por mês.

Já foi cliente de TCHUMA (instituição homologa concorrente e primeira a se estabelecer em boane). Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos que lhe falaram das vantagens de juros baixos e flexibilidade de calendário de reembolso. Este é o primeiro credito do Ricardo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupas novas.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua obra e comprar uma viatura para transporte pessoal e carga diversa.
texts.en:
Ricardo was born in Inhambane province (530 km north of Maputo). He is 37 years old, married and is the father of 5 children between the ages of 1 and 12. All of his children except the baby attend school. He studied until the 5th grade and stopped due to the financial situation of his family. Aside from his wife and kids, he is not responsible for other family members and he lives in his own home. He left Inhambane for Maputo with his older brothers to seek out a better life. He has lived in the Boane district for 8 years. It was in this area that he learned how to do small jobs as a way of earning money to survive. He sells new clothes that he purchases in South Africa (pants and swimwear). For example, he buys a swimsuit for 870MT and resells it for 1,200MT. He earns about 16,000MT per month with this business. He has already been a client of TCHUMA (a similar loan institution in Boane). He heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends that told him about the advantages of a low interest rate and a flexible repayment schedule. This is Ricardo’s first loan [with Hluvuku-Adsema] and it is for 15,000MT to buy more clothing. He pleges to repay this loan without problems so that he will qualify for more loans in the future. He would like to eventually purchase a vehicle for transportation and hauling various cargo.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth G. is from the village of D-6, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 49 years old. Ruth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel L. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a business offering motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
38-year-old Susan B. lives in Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan del Sur. Her business is rice farming and she helps her husband till their small rice field to provide their family with adequate food, clothes and other basic needs. She doesn’t mind anymore working all day under the heat of the sun; what she cares about is to be able to raise her children well by doing her best in her business.

Susan would like to ask for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business and to buy all the farming necessities to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden J. is currently in the business of selling goods like sugar, bags of salt, soap, etc. and is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as: maize flour and milk to sell. Kiden is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by opening a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase goods such as: maize flour and milk to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
It is usually hard to raise a big family. Dedication and hard work is required to support all of the needs of the family. But for Teresita S., this problem did not arise because she is lucky that her husband Alberto strives hard to provide for their family in spite of his low income as a farmer.
Teresita is now 51 years old with 11 children who range in age from 10 to 32 years old. Most of the younger ones are still in school but the older children are already working and helping to support the family. This family of 13 lives in the village of Bi-ao, in the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.
To help her husband support their family, Teresita started with pig fattening and raising chickens, selling the chickens in the local market after raising them for 45 days. This venture became a family affair as the younger kids were able to help with the chores of feeding the animals and cleaning their pens, which were all located in the backyard of their house.
Seeing that she could earn a respectable income from such an activity, Teresita wanted to expand her pig fattening and chicken operations but she needed additional capital to buy the piglets and the chicks. This is the reason why she decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000. 
With access to additional funds, she was able to increase the number of animals and was also able to start a general store adjacent to their house. Now her lowest monthly profit is 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from these business activities. This has a big impact in defraying their household expenses and has enabled her to set aside some money for the higher education of her children. They have also been able to buy a small sugarcane farm that her husband now manages.
Her previous loan of PHP29,500 was used as additional capital for her business activities and now that she has paid that off, she is borrowing the same amount of PHP29,500, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store, feed for her piggery, and fertilizer for their sugarcane farm. She hopes to use the profits to make improvements to their household.  


 About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and other businesses

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is 36 years old and married with 2 children . She is a friendly, hard working woman . She sells tailoring materials in her stall and she is a tailor. She has been in this business for 5 years. Abiodun is an LAPO client and she used her LAPO loan as capital to start her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. This is the high season for business and Abiodun hopes to make more profit. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Phelomina

texts.en: Phelomina M. A. sells raw rice, onions, canned tomatoes and other items at the sea shore. Phelomina has no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Phelomina has been selling these items since 2004. She helps her husband with payments for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and onions and more canned tomatoes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and onions and more canned tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en:
Lemau L. is 31 and married with 3 children (ages 5-months - 10 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lemau has many years of experience in this business.  Lemau needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 tala or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lemau joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lemau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lemau L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.87 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is a resident of Libis, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 46 years old and a mother to four sons. She is education-oriented and makes sure her four children attend school regularly. Two of her children are college students, one is at high school, and the youngest is at elementary school. Rosemarie is married to Ricardo B., a barber and a supportive husband.
Rosemarie is busy retailing a variety of small items, a business she finds very productive. She learned the business from experience and using her own initiative in dealing with costumers. The proceeds of her business are a big help to the family, especially in meeting the educational needs of the children. Now Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP from Kiva partner, ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.). She will use the loan to buy volume stocks of different goods for her retail business.
Rosemarie's ambition is that her four children will be able to finish their schooling with a degree and find stable jobs. She and her husband have also a great dream of investing in a piece of land and building a house of their own. They have rented for almost 15 years now, which is why it is hard for them to save money. Rosemarie is hoping that, with ASHI's support, there is a big possibility that they can fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy stocks of a variety of goods to retail

loans.name: Laura Jonas

texts.pt:
Laura Jonas N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul deMoçambique tem 32 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de13,07e 02 anos de idade, os mais velhos vao a escola. Retomou na 6ª classe este ano depois de ter parado com os estudos apos o casamento. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, o marido é carpinteiro de profissao . Sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro para ajudar em dispesas familiares.
Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, vive e trabalha no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infância. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 7 anos, não possui nenhum empregado conta apenas com a ajuda do seu esposo e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende mais capulanas, que por vezes desloca se ate ao reino da Suazilandia. Neste negocio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa ).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de visinhos que também sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos( capulanas e lenços ) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt ambos para  a mesma actividade.
Tem como objectivo diversificar o produto para a satisfação da sua clientela assim como aumento da sua renda.No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  iniciar com as actividades de salao de cabelereiro.
texts.en:
Laura Jonas N. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are 13, 7, and 2 years old. The oldest go to school. She repeated the 6th grade after having left school to get married. She lives in her own home with her family, and her husband is a carpenter. She supports her parents by sending them money in order to help out with family costs. She has never left Maputo Province; she has lived and worked in Boane District since she was young. She has had her own business for over 7 years. She doesn't have any assistants, but rather counts on the help of her husband, who works about 10 hours each day. She sells capulanas (traditional colorful skirts) and sometimes even travels to Swaziland to do this. With this work, she earns about 6,000 MZN each month, which she uses for household costs. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of the institution. This is her third loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. She plans to use this loan to buy products (capulanas and lenços, or headwraps) in order to increase her supply and diversify her merchandise. The previous loans were for 7,000 MZN and 18,000 MZN, both for the same purpose. Her objective is to diversify the products she sells in order to satisfy her customers and increase her income. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans in order to open a hairdressing salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell capulanas (traditional colorful skirts)

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 30 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of her children go to school.  Monica also takes care of two of her sister’s children and her old mother.  She rents and lives in a two-room house with six people.  They neither have electricity nor piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Monica's monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala, selling new clothes in mobile markets to an average of fifteen customers day. She sells to all categories of people mainly on a retail basis. Monica started this business seven years ago and has managed to improve her family's standard of living.  

She uses public transportation to and from work. This presents a problem because at times the buses are delayed. Monica wants to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to see her business grow bigger so that she can own a permanent place to work .

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra C. is 53 years old and she lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on to earn the family's living. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn only a little income to support their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Ra C. decided to ask for a loan to buy two mother pigs and pig feed for breeding. This loan will increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Ra C. is a mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer and also supports the parents' business while the second one is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two mother pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is divorced and has five dependents. She has received a senior high educational background.

Afia sells fresh tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant) and maize at Jukwa market and has been doing this for some time now. At the time of visit, she had run out of her stock of maize and was yet to receive some from her supplier.

Afia uses her income to provide meaningful education for her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to sell since demand is very high. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to sell

loans.name: Confiance ["confidence"] Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Confiance (6 femmes mariées  et 1 célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire et tous les neufs précédents ont  été bien remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente des condiments alimentaires, de  gingembre, de  bois de chauffe,  de pomme de terre, de savons et  de chaussures. 
Kadi S. qui la présidente du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Sikasso où elle reçoit beaucoup de clients.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter,   des paquets de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes et qualités. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues, la plupart au comptant, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Les membres du groupe Confiance envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Confiance [“Confidence”] group, six married women and one single woman, average 39 years of age and three children and live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a district in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better satisfy their customers’ needs. This would be their tenth joint loan, with the previous nine loans having been duly reimbursed. They are engaged in various business activities, such as selling food condiments, ginger, heating wood, potatoes, soaps and shoes. Kadi S., the group’s leader, buys and resells condiments. Her business is well-known and popular in Sikasso, where she has a lot of customers. With this new loan she plans to purchase packs of condiments of various types and quality grades. She buys her stock at the big market of Sikasso and in nearby villages. Her goods are sold mostly for cash at the different markets in Sikasso as well as in residential areas, to a customer base composed of both women and men. The members of the Confiance group anticipate obtaining a monthly income of 13,500 West African francs for each member, a part of which will be put aside as savings and the rest reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments (for resale)

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. BERTHA, TIENE TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, Y FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "PRIMAVERA" FORMADO POR 8 SOCIOS MÁS, TODOS ELLOS RESIDENTES DE LA 5TA. ZONA DE COLLIQUE. EN RECONOCIMIENTO A SU TRABAJO Y HONESTIDAD, SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE 9 AÑOS, LA SRA. BERTHA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE EXTINTORES Y BRINDA SERVICIO DE FUMIGACIÓN, SU NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO. SUS PRIMERAS EXPERIENCIAS LAS OBTUVO  TRABAHANDO PARA UNA EMPRESA, DONDE APRENDIÓ EL MANEJO, POCO A POCO TOMÓ CONFIANZA Y SE ANIMÓ A INDEPENDIZARSE, DESDE EL COMIENZO LE FUÉ BIEN GRACIAS AL ESFUERZO Y ENTUSIASMO QUE LE PUSOS DESDE UN INICIO.
CON SU TRABAJO PUEDE PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS HIJAS, HA ARREGLADO Y CONTINUADO CON LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DE SU CASA.
UNA DE SUS METAS, ES APERTURAR UNA BODEGA, LA CUAL FUNCIONARÍA EN SU CASA, SOLO LE FALTA JUNTAR UN POCO MAS DE DINERO Y FORMAR SU CAPITAL.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN COMPRA DE EXTINTORES PARA SU NEGOCIO.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Bertha is 39 years old and has two small children. She is part of the nine-member "Primavera" group, all of whom live in the same area of Collique, Peru. Because of her honesty and dedication, her colleagues have made her the treasurer of the group's board of directors. Nine years ago, Bertha began selling fire extinguishers and offering a fumigation service, working from her home. Initially, she worked for another company, where she honed her management skills. Little by little, she gained confidence and decided to become independent. Everything went well from the start, thanks to her effort and enthusiasm. She has been using her earnings to pay pay for her daughters' education, as well as to build and improve her house. One of her current goals is to run a store out of her home. She needs a little more capital for this project. The requested loan will be used to buy extinguishers for her business. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fire extinguishers for her business

loans.name: Dirita Group

texts.es:
Dirita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Luisa Antonia H. Robleto  comerciante de frutas y verduras actividad que realiza desde hace cuatro años con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus tres pequeños de 8, 7 y 2 años.
De la misma manera Heling Jarquin H. comenzó con su negocio de verduras y frutas, mientras Mayra del Carmen Velázquez López tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellas invertirán su crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Dirita is made up of 3 hard-working women. One of these women is Luisa Antonia H. Robleto, a businesswoman who sells fruit and vegetables. She has been doing this for 4 years with the goal of improving the situation of her 3 small children - 8, 7 and 2 years old. Heling Jarquin H. began with a fruit and vegetable business, while Mayra del Carmen Velázquez López has a small grocery store. The ladies will invest their loan in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
As a “sari-sari” (variety) store owner, Bernadita D. hopes that someday through her store proceeds she will be able to set up a savings fund to finance building a comfortable better house which would be able to accommodate all of her eight children. Though her store is currently small selling only a few varieties of grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages as per the definition of  “sari-sari”, Bernadita is still hopeful that her aspirations will come true in future as she is able to request another loan after paying off the previous one. This will help her to support the growth of her business resulting in much greater profit.

Because life was very poor for Bernadita before she joined ASHI and her husband is only a small-time hired laborer, she wasn’t able to support the education of her five older children. All of them have only reached high school thus they are not able to be employed where they would receive a regular higher salary. Despite this, Bernadita still feels happy because her two sons are able to have their own livelihood as a security guard and a hired driver. Nevertheless, she still wants her three younger children to be able to graduate from college and have their own careers in future which is much better that what she and her husband have.

loans.use: To purchase bulk grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages to add to her store's inventory

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla J. is 42 years old and married with three children. For 29 years he has been running a business of beekeeping, which he originally started because he had difficulties finding employment. The collaborative effort of his family has been the key to his business' growth and he now has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products.
