Currently, Abdulla is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni that he wishes to use to expand his business and allow him to offer better products. Abdulla and his family sincerely thanks you for your support in becoming a part of their achievements. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding his bee-keeping business

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Cantón Amate, del Municipio D. Santa Elena, departamento D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y tres hijos D. las edades D. 13,7 y 5 años respectivamente. Posee una tienda D. productos básicos, se Llama Tienda Sagrado Corazón D. Jesús.
El negocio fue por iniciativa propia, trabaja junto son el esposo y la hija mayor, no tiene horario fijo, son una familia trabajadora y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en productos para tienda, como son aceite, arroz, frijoles, Harina D. Maíz, y otros que le demandan los clientes con estos ayudara a incrementar las ventas ya que tendrán más mercadería, la dificultad que presentaría seria que las ventas no fueran positivas.
Los sueños D. María son ver dos negocios grandes que le permitan darle una vida desente a la familia, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios, para que estos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and lives in Cantón Amate a village in the municipality of Santa Elena in the Usulután department. She is married and lives with her husband and her children, 13, 7, and 5 respectively. She has a small general store named The Sacred Heart of Jesus Store. She started the store herself; she works alongsiD. her husband and their eldest daughter. They don't have set hours at the store. They are a hardworking family and they are currently applying for a loan to invest in products for their store like oil, rice, beans, cornmeal, and other products their clients want. With more inventory sales will increase. The only risk is if sales are not good. María's dream is to have two larger businesses that will allow her to give her family a decent life and support her children's education so that they can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, bean, cornmeal, and other products

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger was born in 1983 and is single. Roger owns a small business selling various products such as juice, water, sugar, salt, bananas, and so on. Roger has chosen to do this business because it is profitable. Roger is a relatively new entrepreneur in this business because he has an experience of one year. The hours of his daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day. Roger employs one person as a helper so that his business runs well.

Roger is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more products. With this loan Roger will be able to satisfy his customers, which will allow him to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Pastor C. Q. tiene 36 años y vive en casa de sus padres en el barrio 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de Tarija. Pastor es casado con la señora Angelica Vargas Gutierrez de 33 años de edad con quien tiene 4 hijos. Pastor se dedica a trabajar como taxista desde hace más de 10 años.   
                                                                                                                                                                                                   Pastor quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar un equipo de gas natural para su vehículo con lo cual el costo del combustible que utiliza para trabajar le sería mucho más barato y sus gastos serian reducidos en más de la mitad. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra del equipo de gas para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Pastor nos cuenta que quiere darles a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Pastor C. Q., 36, lives in his parents’ home in the May 3rd neighborhood of the city of Tarija. Pastor is married to Angelica Vargas Gutierrez, 33, with whom he has four children. Pastor works as a taxi driver which he has done for over ten years. Pastor wants a better income in order to offer a better life to his family, but tells us he needs to purchase a system for outfitting his vehicle for natural gas by which his fuel costs would be much lower and his expenses would be cut by more than half. Thus the loan will be used to purchase a natural gas system so that he will be able to enhance his income. Pastor tells us that he wants to do as much as he can for his spouse and children and so the next loan request he makes will be for improving the condition of the house where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a natural gas system for his vehicle

loans.name: Floreliza

texts.en:
Floreliza C. is a single woman who lives in Sitio Saksak, Barangay Buanoy, Balamban, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a sari-sari (variety) store and a food vending business. 

Floreliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Floreliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of $135, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store business so that she can continue to save up for the future and for a down payment on a 50 square meter lot and for house repair. Floreliza C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of stock to sell

loans.name: Rean

texts.en: Rean V., 35, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. and his wife sell groceries at home for a gross income of USD 20 per day.  V. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Mokinyo

texts.en:
Mokinyo S., aged 23 years, is married to Bushet Mona and together they have two children aged four years, and one year. They live in Bissil which is a rural area in Kajiado.

Mokinyo operates a restaurant in Bissil which is a busy market centre. His clients are mostly adults and he mostly cooks traditional foods. He has been running this business for the last two years and his monthly profit is about Kshs 13,000 (approximately US$161).

Mokinyo was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kajiado. Mokinyo wants to use Kshs 5,000 of his loan to increase his stock of foodstuffs and Kshs 25,000 to open a butchery within the same building for easier supervision.

Mokinyo aspires to have a big restaurant and butchery which, from the income, will enable him take better care of his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and to open a butchery

loans.name: Arbildo

texts.en:
Arbilido, age 29, earns his living by driving a motor taxi and raising animals in his back yard. He has been involved in these activities for the last five years and is known in the area as a responsible service provider. His wife works in a chicken factory in the city of Lambayeque and earns a stable salary. They live with their two children outside of the city of Lambayeque, in an industrial zone called Mocce Antiguo.

Arbilido is requesting this loan in order to purchase more animals and additional feed as well as to repair his corrals. He hopes to be able to raise the new animals to the point where he can sell them at good prices when the holiday season arrives.

Arbilido is a dedicated worker and an innately happy person. He and his wife are devoted parents who strive every day to create a better life for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and additional feed as well as to repair his corrals

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. L. is fifty-nine years old and is married to a farmer. They have three children aged between eighteen and twenty-eight years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is widely known as the "sugar belt" region. She has a shop in which she sells groceries and other general items to the local people. Besides this business, Margaret also does farming. She has been in this business for the last five years. She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is that there are many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, so customers are not loyal, as they have plenty of choices. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to stock her grocery store in order to grow her business while meeting her customers' needs. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future and she sees herself owning a plot. She describes herself as a hardworking and visionary woman.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
The twenty-three people who form this village loan, located in Preaek Ta Ker village, Kandal province, have selected Ms. Soy Y., 29 years old, as the village bank president. All members of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Ms. Soy Y. is single and earns her living by cultivating corn and peanuts. She works very hard but still lacks money to support her farming. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and peanut seed. Aside from farming, Ms. Soy Y. also works as a deputy to the village chief, receiving a small salary to help support herself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and peanut seed

loans.name: Faraho

texts.en:
Faraho is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Faraho has operated her food selling business selling chapati (flat bread) and beans for over five years, She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells clothes as another source of income. Faraho cites seasonality as her major challenge. During rainy season, she experiences a poor turnover of customers. She hopes to own a boutique for selling clothes in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000  loan Faraho wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children .

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood and necessary ingredients and materials

loans.name: Gertrudis Ramona

texts.es: Gertrudis Ramona tiene 54 años, se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 22 años,  los cuales vende por encargos de forma ambulante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Inicio esta actividad debido a la necesidad de empleo pues no tenia los recursos suficientes para salir adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de azúcar, aceite, huevo, mantequilla, harina entre otros. Por lo que nos encontramos en una temporada en que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en: Gertrudis Ramona is 54 years old and has worked for 22 years selling bread. She takes orders and delivers the bread on foot. Gertrudis is very happy with her life style. She started selling bread out of necessity because she had no other way to support herself. This isn't the first time she has received financing. The loan will be used to buy sugar, oil, eggs, butter, and flour, among other ingredients. Gertrudis needs more working capital because she  currently has a lot of orders to complete.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 34 years old, married and has three children who are in the range of 5 to 12 years old. Currently, two of her children are enrolled in school. Charlotte sells vegetables, which she has done for four years. Unfortunately, her husband is currently in prison.  

Charlotte will use the loan to purchase pineapples, avocados and green bananas. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charlotte plans to buy more houses for renting because she has many houses, which also generates income. In addition, she would like to sell livestock in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy additional cosmetics for his business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se encuentra en su tercer ciclo.
La Sra. Juliana P. con 50 años de edad, tiene una despensa y hace sus compras en el Mercado Municipal Nro.4, sale de su casa bien temprano para realizar sus actividades y poder proveer a sus clientes todos los productos necesarios.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado, pero con mucha ganas de superación.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is currently in its third round.
Sra. Juliana P., 50 years old, has a storeroom and she does her shopping in the Municipal Market No4. She leaves the house very early to work, providing her clients with all their necessary goods. She is a resilient woman whose daily life is very hard, but she is also keen to overcome it all.

loans.use: To buy paper bags and polyethylene bags, coal, fruit and vegetables, cleaning products etc

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a resident of Samanabad, which is a small housing colony located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Unfortunately, none of them was able to get an education due to financial constraints. 

A talented lady, Lubna owns & operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She learned this art from her mother before her marriage and is now taking good advantage of it.  She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and earns income after completing orders on time. Her clients prefer getting service from her, due to her good quality work and reasonable charges. 

Lubna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is old and doesn’t produce quality work. She has good expectations that she will be able to expand her sewing business because she will be able to finish the orders in a shorter time.   That will allow her to take more orders every month. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and is confident that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
"Responsible woman" describes Mrs. Judith Laurie, 28 years old, who is married and resides at Clarin Settlement, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has 3 children. Her eldest child is six years old and youngest is one year old. She got married at an early age but she never regretted it because she is contented and happy with her family.

The need to have an additional source of income aside from that of her husband, inspired Judith to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request start-up working capital for her auto-load business. Nowadays, electronic load and cell phones are quite in demand both for youth and adults. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy electronic load and some goods for sari-sari store business. She hopes that her business will continue throughout the years despite the business challenges.

loans.use: to buy electronic load & goods for sari-sari store business

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “María de Jesús II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es Conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, solo uno es independiente.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia la motivaron a iniciarce como comerciante.  Empezó con la venta de cerveza; con los ingresos de la cerveza, Gloria convirtió su local en una pequeña bodega haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.

Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, compró: chizitos en paquetes, lejía, leche, té  en cajas, dulces y algunas golosinas. En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio en búsqueda de artículos de primera necesidad así como también de una refrescante cerveza. 

Con este crédito de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche, gaseosas en diferentes presentaciones, Cerveza de reconocidas marcas y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Gloria se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y desea seguir cumpliendo sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “María de Jesús II” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province.  She lives with her partner and has two children, only one of whom lives independently.

Gloria's enterprising character and her love for her family motivated her to set herself up as a saleswoman.  She started out selling beer and, using the income she made from her beer sales, she set up a small grocery store and became very well known and liked among her customers.

Gloria used her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles to buy packets of 'chizitos' (cheese puffs), bleach, milk, boxes of tea, sweet treats and some candy.  She currently has regular customers who come to her business every day looking for essentials and also a refreshing beer.

Gloria will use this loan for 2,000 soles to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, soda, well-known brands of beer, boxes of different brands of canned fish, trays of eggs and personal care products, so that she can continue providing good customer service.

Gloria feels very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos and would like to continue achieving her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, beer and canned food

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is 32 years old and blessed with two children.  He started running his cafeteria in 2006.  He is a hard-working man who dreams of expanding his business for more profit.  Faulu Kenya has made a difference to his business by giving him business loans.  Hence he has improved his business.  He wants a loan of 30,000 Kes to use for opening another outlet of his business.

loans.use: To open another outlet of his business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como gallinas, ella los hace crecer y engordar y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y alimentos para las gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Delia, age 30, lives with her partner and her two children. She is a member of the communal bank “QORILAZO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Delia divides her time between her daily activities and her poultry business. She grows chickens and later sells them in the Huancaro market. Delia would like to expand her chicken business and is seeking a loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merenciana S. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Merenciana is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Merenciana raises crops, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Merenciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Merenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Merenciana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. This loan will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish filets and crab.

loans.name: Nakisunga Development Group

texts.en:
Norah, 37, is such a fascinating lady with a sparky sense of humor. The happily married mother of three likes to put smiles on people's faces. 

She says getting into people's good graces is the key to maintaining good relationships, not only in business but in the other aspects of life. Striking the right impression in a client's mind as she transacts her pig sales business is what she considers her pivotal precept. Four years is the time she has been showing forth her worth, diligence and shrewdness in a business venture predominately run by men.

Norah, like many other enterprising young women in Uganda, is breaking that false stereotype about the inability of women in Uganda and the rest of Africa to run businesses such as these. She says she now knows the checkered experiences that come with running a business. She says in the near future, she will also confidently call herself a master at business.

Her first business was a retail shop, which she still operates. After much stock taking and consultations with friends and family, she decided she would have a crack at a pig sales business.
 
She has been making lots of headway in her business owing to the high demand for pork in Mukono Town, where she operates. The fact that she handles at least 10 to 25 clients a week is one of her business's selling points.

Norah has in this short period made tremendous strides. She anticipates further growth of her business once she gets this loan. She says once she expands her pig sales business to other areas like Kampala, she will be able to make more sales profits.


On the face of it, it is a decision she has never lived to regret. Weekly she says this business generates her profits to the tune of UGX 85,000. 

Norah says with proceeds from this Kiva loan, she is going to purchase more piglets. Her plan is to nurture these piglets so that they grow sturdy and she can sell them at a higher price to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun is 37 years old and resides with husband and children at Ta Keo province. She has been a flower planter at her yard since 2005 and is able to make a profit of about US $1.5 per day. Her husband has been a construction worker at Ta Keo province since 2006 and he earns US $3 per day. She has seven children. Three are students and two are working in the factory. Each of them earns US $4 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $40 on food, US $5 on utility expenses and US $35 on other expenses. 

Eoun has asked for a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike for her child to go to work. In the future, she wants to sell coconut at the market and repair her house to be more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's traveling to work.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth is 42 year old. She and her husband are farmers. Their income is $6 per day. They have four children. Two are in school and one is a worker.

Every month, she has to spend about $45 on every expense in the family. 

She does not want to change her career as a farmer but wishes to extend her farmland. She wants to send her children to study in the university. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son's travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's travel to work.

loans.name: Edilson Vladimir

texts.es:
Edilson, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo, solamente este hijo depende de él, su oficio es la ganadería, inicio con ayuda de su padre, no tiene un horario fijo establecido.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto, esta compra le permitirá crecer y ampliar el número de ganado.
Su aspiración es ser un ganadero en grande, que produzca lácteos, y proveer para su familia el sustento necesario.
texts.en: Edilson lives with his family, his wife and son; this son is his only dependent.  He raises cattle.  He started out with help from his father.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.  He is currently asking for the loan to buy more meat producing cattle.  This purchase will help him grow and expand his herd size.  His goal is to be a large scale cattleman, to produce dairy products and to provide his family with the necessary nourishment.

loans.use: to buy meat producing cattle.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Rubie. She is married to a petty trader and has one child who is 14 years old. In 1996, Rubie established her assorted textiles - cotton, lace and ready-made bags business. She began her business because she needed to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le Le900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le Le5, 000,000. Rubie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan to purchase one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,900,00, two bales of local cotton @ Le1200,000 and 40 bags @ Le30,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le Le200,000. In the future, Rubie plans to travel to Dubai for modern designs, quality and lower cost of her products.  She wants to educate her children and become a supplier to retailers in the surrounding villages. She is hard working and honest. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sell

loans.name: Maria Rosalia

texts.es:
María D. 67 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Túcume que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera, artesana y turismo.
	
DesD. hace algún tiempo María se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en puesto que ha colocado en una zona concurrida del lugar donD. vive, también venD. periódicos y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias.
	
Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más golosinas y bebidas, para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes y con las ganancias poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel D. vida.  María con trabajo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante por sus propios medios.
texts.en:
María is 67 years old and lives in her own home. She receives services, such as running water and electricity. María resides in the District of Túcume, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, handicrafts, and tourism.

For some time, María has been selling candy from a stand established in a busy area in the place where she lives. She also sells newspapers and the income she generates is used to cover her daily needs.

María is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to buy more candy and beverages so that she can continue offering these products to her customers. With her earnings, María will be able to repay the loan and improve her standard of living. Through work and dedication, she will able to move forward as a result of her own efforts.

loans.use: to stock her business with candy and beverages.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Matiko, leader du groupe d’affaire « Amkeni », est entrepreneur, âgée de 57 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous et  autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des pommes de terre. Son mari est un Militaire, ancien combattant passionné (mise en retraite). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. En outre, elle vend aussi des unités cellulaires d’appel  à son domicile. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle a eu son premier capital de la tontine initiée par les femmes de militaires dans le camp ; Plus tard, elle a reçu une petite commission issue d’une vente de parcelle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 sacs de pomme de terre à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique et surtout, dit-elle, nul n’ignore les conditions macabres de vie militaire et leurs familles.
texts.en:
Matiko is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Amkeni business group. She is 57 years old, married, and she has seven children still in school whereas others are already independent. Her husband is a retired veteran of the military. She sells potatoes at the central market of Virunga. As a secondary activity, she also sells cell phone units from her home. 

She has been making a living from these activities for over 15 years. She obtained her first capital through the local tontine (a revolving savings fund) initiated by military wives of the area. She later received a small commission on the sale of a plot of land. 

This new loan will allow her to buy five sacks of potatoes for resale. Her goal is to provide for her children’s tuition and have a house built for them. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. More importantly, she says that no one should ignore the gruesome conditions of military life and its impact on the families.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potatoes for resale

loans.name: Paimpai

texts.en:
Paimpai is 26 years old and married to Jeniffer. They are blessed with two children  aged four years and nine months. He has been selling milk for the past three years. He has been loaned KES 30,000 which he plans to use to purchase dairy cows.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a dairy, and in the near future he hope to supply KENYA CREAMERIES COMPANY with milk.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated a weaving business. She sells her products at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her primary challenge as of late is the high cost of transportation to her workplace. Halima dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to renovate her house and to purchase timber, blocks, and cement. She decided to join Yehu to gain access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her house and to purchase timber, blocks, and cement.

loans.name: Martha Celsa

texts.es: La señora Martha es natural de Ancash,soltera , tiene 41 años y tiene 02 hijos, siempre le ha gustado trabajar y estudiar para poder salir adelante y superarse por sus hijos. En la actualidad ya termino la carrera de Enfermeria Tecnica y ahora va a empezar a llevar cursos de especializacion para luego poder realizr su tesis y obtener su titulo. El prestamo es justo para sus cursos de especializacion. Su meta es poder culminar su carrera y poder ser un buen ejemplo de superacion para sus dos menores hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is a native of Ancash.  She is 41 years old and single with two children.  She always has enjoyed working and studying to be able to get ahead and improve herself for her children.  At present she already finished the training in technical nursing and now is going to begin taking specialized courses to later be able to write her thesis and get her degree.

The loan is just for her specialized courses.

Her goal is to be able to finish her studies and be a good example of self-improvement for her two minor children.

loans.use: to pay for specialized courses for her profession.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal, 34, is married and has three sons and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Jamal has a project  raising sheep and benefiting from the sale of their products. He wants to expand his project by purchasing more sheep in order to increase his income by selling more products. As he doesn't have enough money to pay for them, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Jamal gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more sheep and sell more products, thus increasing and improving his income to provide his family with better living conditions. Jamal is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep to benefit from the sale of their products.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила замужем. Имеет троих детей. Бизнесом  занимается  четыре года. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Она на  рынке торгует женской и детской одеждой. Ей в бизнесе помогают ее сестры. Начала она свой бизнес  с малой суммы. Она хочет получить займ для расширения  бизнеса и оптовой покупки зимних товаров для продажи.
texts.en: Jamila is married and has three children. While her husband is away working in Russia, Jamila sells women's and children's clothing on the market. She's been in this business for four years and is assisted by her sisters. She began with a very small capital. She's asking for a loan in order to expand her business and stock up on winter goods for later sale.

loans.use: to purchase winter goods.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en: Junie, 45 years old, is married, and they are blessed with five children. Three of his children are currently in school. Junie has been growing corn for almost 35 years. Last growing season his net income was 18,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. His future loans from KIVA would be very helpful to him as he sees the loans as the only chance for the development of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more milk and new equipment for making cheese.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su hijo en una zona muy concurrida de la localidad. Ella posee una tienda, la cual le es muy rentable para mantener su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su tienda está muy accesible y vende productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable Teresa siempre tiene una sonrisa para el que la visita; es una mujer emprendedora con una enorme visión para su futuro, ella piensa que no hay montaña tan alta que le obstaculice para cumplir sus metas, quiere ver crecer su negocio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, cereales, pan, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros. Teresa de Jesús tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús, 44, lives with her son in a very busy area of town.  She has a store that is very profitable for her to run in her home.  She has many customers because her store is very affordable and she sells products of excellent quality at truly affordable prices.

Also, the service is unequaled.  Teresa always has a smile for those who visit.  She is an enterprising woman with a grand vision for her future.  She thinks there is no mountain so high that it will get in the way of realizing her goals.

She wants to see her business grow and so she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy bulk grains, cereal, bread, sweets, and drinks, among other things.

Teresa de Jesús is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, cereal, bread, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 54 year-old Memunatu. She is married to a trader, and has 6 children aged 25, 20, 19, 17, 15 and10 years. Three are all school going children. In 1997, Memunatu established her groundnut and onions business. She began her business because she was living with her uncle, who intended to see her through school, but his wife refused to allow that and suggested instead that Mumunatu join the business. Memunatu's parents were poor and could not help her, so they had no alternative but to agree with the aunt since Memunatu was living with the aunt and uncle. Memunatu was introduced to the business at a young age and now she can boast of being a very good business woman.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,564,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy groundnuts - 8 bags @ Le450,000 and onions 5 bags @ Le80,000. She hopes that this loan will help increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 385,000.

In the future, Memunatu plans to build a house. She wants to educate her children because she herself was deprived from it. A part of the profit will be reinvested in her business and the rest will be saved for her children's education. She is hard working and honest, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and onions for her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia de 26 años, convive con Roly de 30 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada, que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Ella se dedica al servicio de transporte fluvial, 
actividad que lo realiza en sociedad con su esposo ya hace más 5 años. Cuenta que en un inicio empezó con una canoa no tan nueva  ni con un motor adecuado, pero poco a poco fue juntando su capital que compró un motor nuevo y ahora piensa invertir en la compra de una canoa nueva para realizar un servicio con toda las comodidades. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 nuevos soles incrementará su capital para la compra de una canoa nueva.
texts.en: Sonia, 26, lives with Roly, who is 30-years-old. With the fruit of this great love, they have a son.  Together, they live in a rented house, which is located in the Pichari district.  She is dedicated to the river transportation service, an activity that she has done in partnership with her husband for the past 5 years.  She says that she initially started with one not-so-new canoe that didn't have a suitable engine, but gradually gathered their capital and bought a new engine.  She now plans to invest in the purchase of a new canoe to provide a service with all the comforts.  This is her first loan with MFP, and agrees to promptly repay the loan.  With 1,000  nuevos soles, she will increase her capital in order to purchase a new canoe.

loans.use: To buy a new canoe.

loans.name: Yackelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yackelin; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de salchipapas que es un plato a base de salchichas y papas fritas, ella tiene un carrito salchipapero donde salchipapas en forma ambulatoria, la socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la salchipapas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papas y salchichas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yackelin, 20, belongs to the “Tinka” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She is single and alternates her daily activities with a business selling “salchipapas” which is a dish based on sausages and fried potatoes.  She has a salchipapas cart that she uses to sell salchipapas in an itinerant manner.  She wants to get ahead by means of this business.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the salchipapas.  She’s requesting a loan to buy potatoes and sausages at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and sausages at wholesale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a resident and a farmer in Eldoret and has been in mixed farming for two years with his milk being sold within the local market. He is 43 and married with two children, age 16 and 9 years and both schooling.

Edward has made a second loan request for 32,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he will use the income to educate his children and uplift their living standards.

He laments of high costs of medication for farm animals, especially dairy and poultry.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services and says they are a great help to small holder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Angelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetables. Angelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Angelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This business is a member of Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Mary comes from Ole Roimen area. She is the chair lady of the group and has shown excellent leadership skills over the duration she has been the leader to the group.

Her business has expanded from operating a community phone to sale of other domestic food stuff. Her customers are those people who reside in the rental houses near by. Her business is doing well and it has enabled her to pay up her previous loans promptly.

loans.use: Mary intends to put up a room which she will use as a shop since the one she is operating from is jut a small structure. This will create room for expansion.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.en:
Mrs Ayélé F. is a young mother of three (3) children. She is married to a bicycle mechanic. Early on, Mrs F. understood that the revenue of her husband wouldn't cover the expenses of the household. In order to do this, she started a business and opened a small restaurant. The quality of her service and the cleanliness of her restaurant mean a parade of many clients throughout the day. Mrs F. has demonstrated honesty and has proven herself a trustworthy woman, paying back her first two loans without incident. Today, she is hoping to newly impress her clientele by introducing new meals into her menu. To do this, she needs more consistant financial support. The loan of $700 that she is asking for will be used to fix up her restaurant. It will also be used as permanent business capital to acquire the raw materials for the preparation of her meals. This will definitely increase the revenue of Mrs Ayélé F. to the benefit of her family.

Translated from Fench by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame F. Ayélé est une jeune femme mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour mari un mécanicien à 2 deux roues. Très tôt, Madame F. a compris que les revenus de son mari ne lui permettent pas de couvrir les charges du foyer. Pour cela, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce en ouvrant un petit restaurant. La qualité de son service et la propreté qui prévaut dans le restaurant font défiler à longueur de journée de nombreux clients. Madame F. a fait preuve d’honnêteté et de femme de confiance à travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crédits obtenus. Aujourd’hui, elle cherche à séduire davantage sa clientèle par l’introduction de nouveaux repas dans ses menus. A cet effet, elle a besoin d’un appui financier plus consistant. Le crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite va servir à aménager son restaurant et à disposer d’un fonds de commerce permanent pour l’acquisition des matières premières nécessaires à la préparation des repas. Cela renforcera à coup sûr le revenu de Madame F. Ayélé pour le bonheur de sa famille.

loans.use: fix up a restaurant and acquire raw materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells garri, a product from cassava dough. She lives in a school-going community where she sells to the public and the students. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is seeking for a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel C. is 34 years old. She was born in the Matola, province of Maputo. She was raised by her aunt. Her family’s financial situation allowed Isabel to study. She studied until the 2nd year of technical professional training in the area of chemistry. Isabel gave up her studies in 1989 because of a pregnancy.

Since 1990, Isabel has been providing for her family through the sale of food and apparel for retail businesses. She serves the area of Boane and Matola. Isabel has 2 children. She was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by a friend. There she requested her first loan. Today her business is doing well. It provides employment for Isabel and one of her sons. With the income from the business Isabel provides for her family and pays for the schooling of her children.

With the loan of 25.000,00, Isabel plans to increase the stock in the shop. Isabel’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment and brings goods closer to the retail shops in the district of Boane and Matola.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Matola Rio - Boane CLIENTE: Isabel C. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO : 25.000,00MT (1,000.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Isabel C. de 34 anos de idade, natural de Matola , Provincia de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade da sua tia e a situação financeira da familia era razoavel, estudou ate 2 ano do ensino tecnico profissional no ramo da Quimica tendo desistido em 1989 por motivo de gravidez e apartir deste momento nao continuou mas com os estudos. Desde 1990 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da familia e possui um estabelecimento Comercial na sua casa e e fornecedora de produtos alimentares assim como vestuario para os revendedores de Boane assim como da Matola. Tem quatro (4) filhos. Por indicação da sua amiga teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA tendo se aproximado e solicitado um emprestimo para ampliação do seu negocio.

Actualmente o seu negocio esta num ritmo razoavel e providencia emprego para ela propria e um dos filhos. com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, incluindo despesas escolares de dois filhos. Com o emprestimo de 25.000,00MT pretende comprar produtos para o aumentar stock na sua loja.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela e seu filho, coloca o produto mas perto da comunidade em particular destaque para todas os revendedores do Distrito de Boane assim como da Matola.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria X. Curacan cooks and sells menudo, the traditional soup made out of tripe, every market day in Tecpan. On Thursdays and Sundays she gets to the market at 3:00 am to start cooking the tripe that was delivered the night before, and then she sells all day to the crowd at the market. She’ll use this credit as she did the last, to buy the tripe and other ingredients for the menudo. Before starting with Friendship Bridge she couldn’t purchase enough materials at a time to maximize her profits, but now she can purchase enough that she can sell a boatload of menudo on market days.

Gregoria is 63 and single; her 32-year-old youngest son is still living with her. He’s been disabled since he was 9 years old when a disease damaged his back or spine.

The picture shows Gregoria at her loan set up meeting. It was not possible to take her picture in the market selling menudo because it was not market day.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Gregoria attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make menudo

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Alicia belongs to the "The Damsels" Communal Bank, from the A.H Luz y Paz from the Manantay District in the State of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is mother of four children. Her husband is a construction worker. However, his income is not enough for their home expenses.

Alicia, after being invited by one of her neighbors, decided to get integrated to Manuela Ramos communal bank. With the first loan of S/ 300.00, she started selling candy, "kekes", home baked bread- since the closest bakery was 4km away. Therefore, she decided to build an artisan bakery.

With the recent loan of S/.1,200 (US $400 aprox.), granted by Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 quotas, she will be able to expand and improve the oven. Purchase 1 bag of flour, 1 box of eggs, 5 kgs. of sugar, 2 boxes of milk. Therefore, she will be able to sell home baked bread, "kekes" and more.

Alicia is very happy that she can have her own oven and bake home baked bread and "kekes", allowing the neighborhood dwellers to have a closer place where to purchase and consume these products.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Doncellas", del A.H. Luz y Paz del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años, y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es albañil, sin embargo lo que gana no alcanza para los gastos de su hogar. Con la invitación de una vecina, Alicia decide integrar al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 soles decide vender golosinas, kekes, panes caseros, dado que la panificadora más cercana esta a 4 km, por lo que decide armar un horno artesanal. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200 (US$ 400.00 aprox.) pagaderos en 4 cuotas, podrá mejorar y ampliar su horno, además comprar de 1 saco de harina, 1 caja de huevo, 5 kilos de azúcar y 2 cajas de leche, con esto podrá vender panes caseros, kekes y otros. Alicia esta muy contenta de tener su propio horno y así elaborar panes caseros, kekes permitiendo a los pobladores de ese lugar, que tengan cerca alguien que venda este producto y poder consumirlo.

loans.use: Oven maintenance and  ingredients purchase

loans.name: Shahjahan

texts.en: My name is ShahJahan B. and I have two children. I have always been eager to help my husband with the household expenses. So, after my marriage, I started a clothing business. I buy clothes from a busy nearby market and sell them from my house to my neighborhood clientele. I make a good profit from this business and that has enabled me to help support my family. My son has recently joined in this clothing business and he travels to various parts of the city and sells clothes door to door. I would like to expand my clothing business by adding new types of clothing to the existing inventory. I would like a loan of $350 to expand my business.

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothes for the business

loans.name: Zaituni's Group

texts.en:
Zaituni N. has a shop and is seeking a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator and shelving. She also wants to use the loan to increase her inventory. She looks after 3 orphans and also took in a child she picked from a garbage dump.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase store fixtures

loans.name: Sanu Rana

texts.en: Mrs. Sanu Rana M. and her husband Mr. Gamber Rana M. are both farmers in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati in Nepal. They grow various types of vegetables, mainly seasonal, on their own land.  They have two sons, the eldest of which is an electrician and the younger who is in Grade 12 at school. Mr. M. supplements their farming income by working at an office. Mrs. M. is requesting for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She wants to stand on her own two feet and together with her husband to uplift the standard of living of their family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Dossy Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa S. is a single 23 year old who owns a small charcoal store that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses as food vendors, shopkeepers, and food and soft drink sellers.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha, 38, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished high school and now has two children, both of whom still live at home. She earns a living making whatever clothes are appropriate for the season of year. For example, she's now making skirts and trousers appropriate for high school students at the beginning of their school year and smocks for kindergarten aged children. Furthermore, she makes blouses, dresses and skirts. When Martha started her business, she only made costumes, but as she's become known, her customers have ordered everyday articles of clothing from her.

Martha belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to make articles of clothing that had been ordered. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen school sweaters that the students of a local school always want and cloth to make 20 skirts and smocks. Her greates dream is to set up her a tailoring shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha Elizabeth H. L. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Estudio secundaria completa, tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Se dedica a la corte y confección de ropa, de acuerdo a la temporada, por ejemplo en esta época del año esta elaborando faldas y pantalones de colegio, además mandiles para niños que asisten al jardín así también blusas, vestidos y faldas para dama. Cuando la señora Martha inició su negocio confeccionando solo disfraces poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y le hacían pedido de prendas de vestir.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para confeccionar algunas prendas pedidas. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara, una docena de chompas de colegio que siempre le solicitan de algunos colegios particulares y tela para la elaboración de 20 faldas y mandiles para el jardín. Su mayor sueño es instalar en su casa un taller de costura

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Thị Thìn

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thin is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 125USD to buy material to make clothes and sell it. Besides that, she also be a meat retailer. The money she got from these jobs will help her repay the loan easier. Mrs. Thin likes Binhminh's (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) Microcredit program a lot. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thiet, 25 years old, also wants to borrow 125USD to buy material to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Thìn (MS: 050042), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải may cho khách. Ngoài ra cô chú còn đi mua thịt trâu bò về bán buôn và bán lẻ, với mức thu nhập thường xuyên hàng ngày sẽ giúp hoàn trả và thực hiện tốt với chương trình. Cô rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm này. Chị N. Thị Thiết (MS: 050044), năm nay 25 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải và đặt may cho khách.

loans.use: do their business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Creativity and determination best define Jorge, a young 23-year-old entrepreneur who, thanks to his talents, has become the owner of a small carpentry workshop. This industrious young man makes office, kitchen and bedroom furniture according to the preferences and requirements of his demanding clients. But this hard-working young man feels he still has a lot to learn so that he is able to apply his knowledge to the furniture he makes. This is why he needs to set up his workshop and have more raw materials so that he can offer his clients a greater range of high-quality products. With this goal in mind, Jorge is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La creatividad y empeño son las principales características de Jorge, joven emprendedor de 23 años que gracias a su habilidad se ha convertido en propietario de un pequeño taller de carpintería. Este diligente joven elabora muebles para oficina, cocina y dormitorios de acuerdo al gusto y requerimiento de sus exigentes clientes. Pero este laborioso joven siente que aún tiene mucho que aprender para al mismo tiempo plasmar sus conocimientos en cada mueble que elabora, para ello necesita implementar su taller y contar con mayor materia prima, para ofrecerles una inmensa gama de productos de óptima calidad a sus clientes. Con esa intención Jorge desea obtener tu apoyo.

loans.use: To set up his small workshop and buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru:
Despite his young age (he's 30), Dilmurod is already married and has three children. Besides his main work buying and selling dried fruits, he himself, with his family, dry apricots.

To purchase fresh apricots, he uses his own reserves. To procure more apricots, Dilmurod has applied to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Несмотря на свой молодой возраст (30 лет) Дилмурод уже женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Кроме своей основной деятельности – купли продажи сухофруктов, Дилмурод каждый год вместе со своей семьей занимается сушкой абрикосов.

Для закупки свежих абрикосов он использует свои сбережения. Чтобы приобрести больше абрикосов Дилмурод обратился в Микроинвест за займом.

loans.use: To purchase apricots

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi A. is 32 years old and originally from the village of Yohonou, but today he has opened a hardware shop in downtown Amégnran. He is married and the father of five children. His shop is in a favorable location, since it is the only shop in the area that sells hardware. However, Mr. Koffi A. lacks the financial means to respond to the high demand he faces. Therefore, he is requesting funding that will improve his sales and revenue.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

De 32 ans d’âge, Monsieur A. Koffi est originaire du village de Yohonou. Mais aujourd’hui, il a ouvert une boutique de quincaillerie à Amégnran-centre. Il est marié et père de cinq enfants. Son point de vente se situe à un endroit très favorable puis qu’il est le seule à vendre les articles de la quincaillerie. Mais face à la forte demande, Monsieur A. Koffi manque de moyens financiers pour y répondre. Ainsi, il sollicite un financement. Ceci va améliorer son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: Hardware shop

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Mrs. Águeda, is a member of the El Arenal Community Bank, located in Jr. Callao #427, of the Calleria district, Ucayali Department. She is 43 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of $100, Águeda decided to invest in the sales of general goods. Beacuse she is in the business of selling products, her first need was to incorporate the sales of undergarments and other clothing articles. With this loan of $450, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 1/2 a sack of rice, a 1/2 sack of sugar, 1/2 crate of eggs, sweets, 15 meters of fabric, elastic, padding, and thread. Águeda is a seasoned woman who continues to see different business opportunities and sees how to make her business grow so that she can support her family's economic needs.

Tranlsated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Águeda, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr Callao # 427, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 4 hijos. Su esposo es obrero. Águeda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de abarrotes. Además de la venta de productos de primera necesidad esta incorporando en el mismo local la venta de lencería y otros Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 1/2 saco de arroz, 1/2 saco de azúcar, 1/2 caja de huevo y golosinas y 15 metros de tela, elásticos, blondas, hilos. Águeda, es una mujer aguerrida que continua viendo diferentes oportunidades de negocio porque esta viendo en hacer crecer mas su negocio y así pueda brindar y apoyar económicamente a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of various products at wholesale (general goods)

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang V., is married with five children and works as a rice farmer earning only $1 each day. Her husband is a middleman buying cow to breed for only a short period then resell them for a profit. This daily business activity earns him around $3 each day. Meanwhile, one of her children is employed by a garment factory and her other two sons work at a construction site, making collectively $6 a day. Cow selling is a profitable and better business for Mrs. Lang V.'s family. She and her husband would like to purchase more cows from the breeders to increase her daily income. But they still need more capital to help them.

( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Lang V. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more cows from the breeder to increase more income.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.  Esta carismática joven se dedica, desde hace 6 años, a la elaboración, compra y venta de mantas bordadas, recibe pedidos de señoras que le compran su mercadería, para vender a los turistas, no teniendo un horario fijo para su labor, ya que al recibir pedidos, trabaja desde su casa, elaborando sus bordados, los cuales toman tiempo para llegar al acabado final, a veces durante todo el día.  Le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede explotar sus dotes de artista y puede hacerlo desde su casa, la desventaja, es que a veces no puede ella sola con todos los pedidos que su clientela requiere.  Carmen trabaja mucho para su futuro, quiere crecer como persona y como negociante y así cumplir todas sus metas y sueños.  Con el dinero que reciba del préstamo solicitado, comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados y así poder cubrir la demanda de su clientela. Carmen quiere progresar, teniendo un negocio mucho más grande en el futuro y contratar un ayudante para poder cubrir los pedidos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Carmen is 21-years-old and lives in her parents' home. She is a charismatic young lady who has bought, sold, and made embroidered blankets for 6 years. She receives orders from ladies who purchase her merchandise to sell to tourists. She doesn't have a fixed schedule. When she receives the orders, she works from her home to make the blankets, and it takes a long time to produce a finished product, sometimes all day. She likes her job since she can make the most of her talents as an artist and can work from home. The disadvantage is that sometimes she alone can't fill all of the orders that her clientele requires. Carmen works very hard for her future. She wants to grow as a person and a businesswoman and fulfill all of her goals and dreams. With the money that she receives from this loan, she will purchase materials to do her embroidery so she can cover her clientele's demand. Carmen wants to progress and have a much larger business. In the future, she wants to hire an assistant so she can cover all of her requested orders.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to do her embroidery so she can fill all of her orders

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is a 30-year-old single woman with one child who is currently in school. She is a seller of pharmaceutical products, including antibiotic drugs, pain killers, and blood tonics. She sells such pharmaceuticals at the local market in Ashaiman, where she lives with her family.

She proudly states that most people in her community buy their pharmaceutical products from her because of the current national health insurance policy being implemented by the government of Ghana. Even so, she is seeking a loan to increase her supply of pharmaceutical drugs to better meet the needs of her customers. In doing so, she hopes to generate enough income to pay for her child's education.

Gifty is a member of the community group known as the “Ultimate” Trust Group. In this group, members not only provide support for one another in their efforts to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by increasing her supply of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Kiswahili Cell A-Night Group

texts.en:
Night A. is a hardworking and determined businesswoman. She rents a stall on Mbaguta Street, Mbarara, at the rate of 150,000 UGX per month, in which she sells second hand clothes and offers tailoring services. From her savings as a poultry keeper, Night raised the capital to set up this business that now earns her an approximate weekly profit of 120,000 UGX.

She is using the loan funds to purchase a variety of fabrics to meet the demands of her clients. Besides her ten years' experience in this business, Night attracts her customers by being social and friendly to them. She hopes to own a unisex boutique stocked with the latest designer outfits.

Married to a businessman, and a mother of three, 40-year-old Night is also a loving guardian to her late sister’s daughter. Her children and niece attend the same primary school in Mbarara. This is her third loan and she hopes that it will help her business grow, thereby increasing the profit margins. If that happens, she will be in a position to help her husband in the construction of their residence, and with school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María tiene 50 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores, ella empezó vendiendo empanadas en la calle y luego de  mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de sus hijos logro montar una pequeña despensa .Ella le provee de alimentos, productos de limpieza a todos sus vecinos del barrio donde vive.
Es un verdadero sacrificio para ella porque se tiene que levantar en la madrugada para realizar sus compras en el mercado de San Lorenzo. En el futuro espera tener un negocio más amplio, para poder contratar gente, y así ayudar a su comunidad, y lo más importante darle estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 50 years old and has 2 grown-up children. She started out by selling empanadas (stuffed pastry) on the street. Then after much effort and with the help of her children, she managed to set up a small general store. She provides food and cleaning products for the local residents.

This business is truly a sacrifice for her because she has to get up very early in the morning to buy products at the San Lorenzo market. In the future, she hopes to expand her business so that she can hire staff, thus helping out her community and more importantly, giving her family financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, sugar, noodles, milk, meat, eggs, herbs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina B. is a widow who lives in Belaya Tserkov. She owns a small vending container-store in the central market of Fastov, a neighboring town about 30 kilometers away from Belaya Tserkov. Katerina has been in the clothing sales business for ten years. Experience, personal characteristics, and financial assistance have promoted stable expansion of Katerina’s venture. Presently, she has about 60,000 Grivnas invested in turnover capital. Minimum income is about 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Katerina is seeking to have a business which would provide her with stable income. She knows she doesn’t have another source of income as her husband passed away and she earns her own living. Katerina is responsible and hard-working. She never sits idle and loves busy days. Today she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to purchase additional clothing for her inventory. Katerina is hoping to repay the current loan in 2 months.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been a bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to A'Mola loan group (Group code 2039).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money for future use.  

Mariam is 24 years old, married, and has one child: aged 10 months.

loans.use: To buy more breads for her business.

loans.name: Kuziboy

texts.en:
M. Kuziboy has been in the farming business for 22 years. It is through farming that he was able to provide for his family and send his children to school, even though they were not able to earn a college degree. Kuziboy would like to request a loan of 4500 Somoni to buy necessary farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers, as they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Kuziboy always makes sure that he respects the people around him because he believes that respect begets respect.  

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes,  is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and to a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.
