To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren D. lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife takes care of their two infant children at home.

Purevsuren makes various types of wooden furniture, including beds, chairs and tables. Although he was trained as a tractor driver, he has a talent for carpentry. Using this ability, he has been running a small carpentry shop for the last dozen years. During these years, he was able to equip his shop with many of the necessary tools.

Today, Purevsuren’s business capital is close to 2,700,000 MNT ($1 USD is approximately MNT 1,500) and he sells 1,500,000 MNT worth of products in a month. He hopes one day to open a carpentry company with his own employees. Purevsuren is a humble and responsible person. He requests a loan to purchase lumber for his carpentry shop.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace M. lives in the municipality of Hamtic in beautiful Antique Province. Antique is located on the island of Panay, which is situated in the west-central part of the Philippine archipelago. People say Antique is where "the mountains meet the sea"; its economy revolves around fishing and farming.

Mary Grace and her husband, Julito, raise carabao and cattle. Carabao--a kind of water buffalo that many consider to be the national animal--are usually used as farm work animals, and they also produce milk. Mary Grace plans to use this loan to buy two head of carabao, two head of cattle, and food supplements for her livestock. Besides livestock, Mary Grace also earns income by selling fruits and vegetables, and charcoal for cooking.

Mary Grace has five daughters and three sons; the youngest is six, and the oldest is 28. Her oldest daughter has a college education, and so far is the only one of her children to attain that level of education. Mary Grace says she hopes to be able to continue to support her children's education, and hopes they all find stable jobs so they can become independent and be happy. She also dreams of having enough money to be able to build a more durable house.

loans.use: To buy two head of carabao (water buffalo), two head of cattle, and livestock food supplement

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas
Renee es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Renee junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante chifa en un local alquilado, su esposo es quien cocina y cuentan con la ayuda de 1 personal, actividad que realizan todos los días.
Renee necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y huevo.
Los sueños de Renee son trabajar para ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the Orquídeas communal bank. Renee has a live-in partner, is 28 years old, and has three children. Renee and her spouse have a Chinese-Peruvian fusion restaurant in a rented building. Her husband does the cooking and they have one other employee; they work every day. Renee needs a loan of 900 soles to purchase rice, sugar and eggs. Renee dreams of working to expand her business and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
HEIDY VASQUEZ D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” vive en el Jr comandante suares Nº 620, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 52 años D. edad, tiene 1 hija y su esposo es mecánico.

Ella y su hija trabajan juntas en el negocio D. preparación D. comidas tales como juanes, tacacho y pescado asado, esto lo hacen por la tardes y noches. Por las mañanas venD. frutas. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 le permitió  implementar este último negocio.

La buena atención que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  lo invertirá en la compra D. madera para hacer arreglos en su local y pintarlo para tener una mejor presentación, además comprará mas frutas D. la Región.
 
Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Heidy V. D. V. belongs to the Loreto Communal Bank. She lives on Comandante Suares Avenue in the city of Pucallpa. She is 52 years of age and has one daughter. Her husband is a mechanic. She and her daughter work together at her business of preparing meals such as "juanes" (rice and meat cooked in a banana leaf), "tacacho" (grilled plantain) and grilled fish. They do this in the afternoon and evening, and in the morning they sell fruit. With her first loan of 300 Sols she was able to get this business started. The good service which she is known for has brought her many customers. This loan of 1,000 New Sols will be used to buy lumber to fix up her shop and to paint it in order to have a better appearance. She will also buy locally grown fruits. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that is working to proviD. low-interest loans and that makes it easy to obtain them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and fruits.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дилбар – продаёт детскую одежду. Товар завозит из Бишкека два раза в месяц. Она досрочно погасив кредит хочет получить повторно кредит для закупа летнего ассортимента детской одежды.
За товаром ездит сама в Бишкек и Истаравшан. Она планирует привезти футболки для мальчиков и платья для девочек. На снимке Дилбар в день выдачи.  На предыдущих снимках она на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dilbar sells children’s clothing. She brings her merchandise from Bishkek twice per month and also from Istarvshan. She repaid her previous loan ahead of time and wants to obtain another loan in order to purchase summer assortment of children clothing. Dilbar plans to bring in t-shirts for boys and dresses for girls. The photograph shows Dilbar on the day of loan disbursement. Previous photographs show her at her place of business. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer assortment of children's clothing

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei M., 28, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the bakery business. She sells to the public and village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Avei’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to hire more staff for her business, and also for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, tank of oil,  and other things used for bakery

loans.name: Norkul

texts.en:
K. Norkul lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan, and is dedicated to the cattle business. From very early in the morning he tends to the animals. He returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all his dilligent work, in order to bring food to his table for his wife and beloved five children. Norkul says that he works with only one aim in mind – to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Norkul would like to expand his business and purchase two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 5100 TJS and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Norkul’s business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Señora Virginia sells delicious regional dishes in front of her home in the evenings. Virginia is 52 years old and resides in the city of Pucallpa. She lives with her husband and the youngest of their three children. Virginia's husband is also an entrepreneur.

Virginia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about 7 years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends). She invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in purchasing iron which she sent to the city of Tarapoto to be sold. Virginia plans to use this loan of 2,800 soles to invest in her small restaurant business and also to purchase more iron to sell in Tarapoto.

Virginia's dream is to build a large patio area in front of her house so that she can serve her meals in a space that is more pleasant for her customers. Virginia is happy to be receiving financial support from Manuela Ramos for her business ventures.

loans.use: Food for a restaurant business; iron to be resold in a nearby city

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary sells drinks, provisions, etc. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Rosemary is 48 years old and married with six children. She hopes for the loan amount of 70000 NGN to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Cristina Jose

texts.pt:
Cristina nasceu na cidade de Maputo, têm 35 anos de idade, casado e mãe dois filhos de dois e sete anos de idade. O mais velho freqüenta escola. Freqüenta segundo ano no Instituto de formação de Professores Primários a distancia. O marido é motorista e vive na casa própria no distrito de boane, bairro Mussubluluko, sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade.

Mudou se para boane no ano de 2006 com seu marido e passou a viver apenas com seu marido (vivia em casa dos sogros). Trabalha como auxiliar administrativa na Escola primaria local há mais de 9 anos com salário mensal de 2.373,00MT. Feitas as despesas domesticas, consegue poupar algum valor com os colegas num circuito rotativo de poupança e credito obrigatório (xitique).

Através de vizinhos e outros colegas clientes, teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema e tendo aproximado, solicitado e pago os primeiros dois empréstimos de 1.500,00MT e 1.800,00MT para compra de bens de consumo (eletrodomésticos).

Já tinha se beneficiado de 2 empréstimos em outras instituições (ex-GGLS, actual FDM) nos valores de 10.300,00MT e 12.000,00MT, respectivamente para habitação (compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria). Pagou sem problemas, apenas reclamou o juro alto.

Com o presente credito de 10.000,00MT pretende continuar com a construção da sua casa, comprando cimento e outros materiais para finalizar a obra.
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas e sonha com mais créditos para compra de mais bens de consumo
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the city of Maputo, is 35, and is married. She is the mother of two children, who are 2 and 7. The oldest one goes to school and is in her second year in primary school. Cristina's husband is a driver, and they live in their own home in the district of Boane, in the neighborhood of Mussubluluk. They aren't financially responsible for anyone else besides their children. Cristina moved to Boane in 2006 to live with her husband (they used to live in her inlaws' home). She has worked as an administrative assistant in the local primary school for 9 months and has a monthly salary of 2,373 meticais. Due to her living expenses, she is saving some money along the other members of her bank. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through other members and neighbors. Her first two loans were for 1,500 and 1,800 meticais so she could purchase products (household appliances). She has has two loans from other institutions (for construction materials to build a house out of bricks). She paid them back without any problems and barely complained about the high interest rate. With this current credit of 10,000 meticais, she will continue with construction on her home and will buy cement and other materials to finalize it. She proposes to pay back this loan without any problems and dreams about having more credits to buy more goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, stone, and sand)

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife R. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Marife owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In September 2009, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jemelita

texts.en:
Jemelita O. is a rice grower. She started her business in 2000. Her only child is nine years old.  She has been doing the best she can to help her husband earn an income for their family needs like food, clothes and other basic needs for their home. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities. Receiving a loan will definitely help her achieve not just a better yield but income for her family as well.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia tiene 49 años, es muy alegre y servicial con las personas; sobre todo con los niños, ya que tiene 4 hijos, siendo cada uno de ellos sus más grandes tesoros con los que vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres.

Ella se dedica a la prestar sus servicios como ama de casa en varias viviendas de su localidad, donde es muy querida. Eta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, desde que su pareja tuvo que viajar fuera de la ciudad en busca de mejoras económicas, por lo tanto tuvo que buscar la manera de cubrir los gastos diarios en casa. Gracias a la recomendación de algunas amigas empezó a trabajar limpiando casas y cuidando ancianos y niños; encontrando en ello, su verdadera vocación.
Ahora Delicia considera que prestar sus servicios tiene un nuevo significado y lo que más anhela es abrir un centro de rehabilitación, donde se vele por el bienestar de las personas más indefensas.

Este es su noveno crédito en microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura de seguir conformando un bonito equipo de trabajo con su banco comunal, donde cada uno de los miembros se tiende la mano. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planes adquirir algunos materiales necesarios para seguir prestando sus servicios.
texts.en:
Delicia is 49 years old. She is very happy and friendly with people; especially with children, as she has 4 of her own, who are her greatest treasures. She lives with them in a house she inherited from her parents. Delicia provides housekeeping services in various homes in her neighborhood, where she is well loved. She has done this type of work for 4 years, ever since her spouse had to leave the city to search for a better economic situation. She therefore had to find a way to cover the daily expenses at home. Thanks to recommendations from friends, she began work cleaning houses and caring for the elderly and children: and found it to be her true calling. Now Delicia feels that being of service has a new meaning, and what she wants most is to open a rehabilitation center, where she can provide for the wellbeing of those who are most defenseless. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is sure she will continue to be a part of a good working team at her communal bank, where each of the members support each other. With the money she is currently requesting, she plans to purchase materials she needs to continue providing her services.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for work

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S. was born in 1957; she is married and blessed with four children. Her husband, Kim Heap, is 55 years old and works as a taxi driver. To make a living, Chhay S. has built a small store in front of her house, where she sells a few groceries for a profit. Chhay S. will be using her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Uy S., 37, is married with two children. One of his children is enrolled at a local high school. He resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, with his wife and children. To make a living, he is a supervisor at a small place that produces bricks. He earns an income of $7.50 per day. Also, his wife is a worker at that place, earning an income of $2 per day. 

Mr. S. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a money-exchange shop at a local market in the town.

loans.use: Open a money exchange shop

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 33 years old and married with three children. He started his business six years ago. He is using the loan to purchase retail items: essentials such as sugar, salt, soap, and so forth. He wants to boost his business by stocking all kinds of essential goods; he wants to be a prominent distributor of necessary goods on the market.

loans.use: To purchase essential goods (sugar, salt, soap) for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has three children. She has received a senior high education.  Mary operates a provisions shop in which she sells raw rice, fresh eggs, powdered milk, and bags of water and so on at Chapel Square near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2003. Her husband is a teacher.  Mary uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fess and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to buy more bags of rice and bags of water and so on for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to open a container store.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to buy more bags of rice and bags of water and so on to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva R. is a 56-year old married woman who lives in Had. San Jose in  Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and sell fruits, soft drinks, and gasoline to passing motorbike drivers.

Eva’s husband, Roberto, is a laborer in sugarcane plantation. They have 10 children between 13 and 40 years old, seven of whom have their own families. Two of her children work with her in her business and one goes to school. The children living at home also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 with the hope that she would bring in additional income and be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF she has been able to bring in extra money for the family, with an average monthly income of Php 2,400 from her business.

Eva is a member in good standing. She used her previous loan of Php 11,500 to fund her business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. She intends to use her current loan of Php 12,000 to buy additional inventory for her store. Eva is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline A. M. is 37 years old, married and has six children. Her husband is a businessman and they hope to buy land of their own some day. She makes a living in Kakamega selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has been doing this for one year and despite many challenges -- including a large number of competitors -- she is determined to grow her business. As time permits, she also helps run a farm. She has applied for this loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell. She is very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: Clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace I. is 57 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is self employed and he also supports the home. Her children are excelling in their various jobs and school. Grace sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She wants to expand her business in the future. Grace hopes for a loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.  She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 48 years old and is married with four children aged between 12 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has no access to electricity or to piped water but gets three meals a day.

Teopista sells bananas in Ndeeba market and doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for fourteen years and works six days a week, selling to an average of twenty customers a day.

Teopista has been with MCDT for six years and is servicing her thirteenth loan working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and aspires to start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
With her heart filled with aspiration, Beverly P. joined Kiva's first field partner in the Philippines: ASHI. With the loans she can access through ASHI, she is optimistic about having her own business to grow as much as she wants in partnership with her husband. Proceeds from this would make her capable of improving her family’s standard of living and she would be able to support the college education of her 21-year-old brother-in-law until he graduates, since she and her husband don’t have their own child yet. Beverly is just 27 years old now but her visions are about preparing for the future, especially of their children. She doesn’t want them to experience being poor the way she has experienced it.

Presently, Beverly runs a mini grocery store in their town’s public market. She wants her store to have more kinds of items for sale and to increase its inventory so that she can supply her increasing number of customers as well as their needs. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI. Despite not having any children yet, Beverly enjoys her married life because she has a business and her husband is working with her on it.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store and to increase its inventory.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa F. is divorced and has three children. She hasn’t received any form of education.

Adwoa is a seamstress at Jukwa and uses her income to pay her children’s school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fabric and other sewing supplies to aid her in her sewing work.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is the wife of A. D. and lives in a city named Multan in Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines and sweetmeats.
 
She is a very active and caring lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family and does the domestic chores. She has five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is a carpenter and makes furniture on order to generate income. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Her husband has been operating a wood-selling business for the last five years. He has a good number of customers and receives many orders. Irshad has applied for a loan to buy wood in bulk because the currently available wood is insufficient for filling the orders. Buying in bulk will allow him to complete the orders on time, which helps his customers and makes a profit.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk to complete orders

loans.name: C2145 Haguruka Group

texts.en:
Juvenal is 69 years old, married with five children aged between 5 and 29. Juvenal is an older man but in business terms he is so young simply because he has an experience of only two years selling green bananas. Juvenal is also group representative; this group composed of five people: four women and the one man who is group representative.

Juvenal and his group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business through purchasing more products for sale. The people who make up this group sell foodstuffs; some sell green bananas while others sell beans. This business is profitable in their region and that is the reason why it was chosen by them in order to earn more profit from their business. The purpose of Juvenal who is the leader is to save money which will help him to buy land for his family.

loans.use: Expanding their businesses

loans.name: Ulices Arelio

texts.es:
Ulices de 38 años, vive en una zona urbana en la Guasmo de Guayaquil, el tiene dos hijos de 2 y 7 años, Ulices era empleado en un almacén de muebles pero por la falta de ingresos decidió independizarse e invertir lo que le quedaba de dinero en muebles para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco le empezaron a comprar y a tener rentabilidad.

Ahora tiene un local de mueblería, compra los muebles en una fabrica y los vende en su local, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 14h00 con su esposa todos los días, vende modulares, cajones, camas de madera. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cajones y modulares para vender en su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener mas locales para vender muebles.
texts.en:
Ulices is 38 years old and lives in the urban area of Guasmo in Guayaquil. He has two children, ages 2 and 7. Ulices was previously employed at a furniture store, but he decided to become independent and use his remaining money to buy furniture to sell to his neighbors. Over time, he began buying more furniture and making a profit.

Ulices now has his own furniture store. He buys the furniture pieces from a factory and then sells them in his store. Every day he and his wife work together from 8am until 2pm. They sell modular storage cabinets, dresser drawers, and wooden beds. With this loan, he will buy dresser drawers and modular storage cabinets to sell in his business.

In the future, he wants to open more locations where he can sell furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresser drawers & modular storage cabinets

loans.name: Sokno

texts.en:
Mr. S. Um, is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Um, 36, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. S. was not in the photo, his wife was available instead. 

S. has been selling cows for ten years. He buys cows from other villages far a way from his house and sells them to the slaughterhouse. His wife has been farming for seven years. She grows green beans on her farmland in the village. S. is asking for his first loan of 600USD to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Hapuyo Kamukamu Group, Mubende

texts.en:
Enterprising 48-year-old A. Richard has operated his alcohol-selling business for the last six years in Kirayabyenju, Mubende. He was first operating a tailoring business before he made a decision to start up this business.

This kind of business is highly profitable given the high consumption rates of alcohol in parts of western Uganda. In a week, Richard makes profits totalling 100,000 shillings. He is upbeat that his profits will increase once he can access this loan. With the self-belief he personifies, his future in this competitive business is bright.

Richard also ekes out profits from a tailoring business. With this loan, he wants to buy more crates of beer and other alcoholic drinks for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer and other alcoholic drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
la sra. Maria S. tiene 66 años de edad y es viuda, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo de la ciudad Capital.
Maria se dedica a lavado de ropa, de esta actividad se sostiene, lo hace 3 veces por semana.
tambien recibe un dinero de una pension del Instituto Hodureño de Seguridad Social por la muerte de su esposo.
Maria utilizara el credito para hacerle una mejora a su casa. 
Maria es una mujer responsable, sociable y es muy querida por sus vecinas. 
dice sentirse feliz ya que va contruyendo su casa poco a poco y la esta dejando como ella quiere.
texts.en:
Maria S. is 66 years old and is a widow. She lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood of Tegucigalpa. Maria works washing clothing and supports herself with this work, which she does 3 days a week. She also receives a small pension from the Honduran Social Security Institute because of her husband's death. Maria will use this loan to make improvements to her home. She is a responsible and outgoing person and is well liked by her neighbors. She says that she feels happy and is building her house bit by bit in order to have everything as she wants it.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, bricks, sand and flooring

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 31 femmes. Elles sont du même villageois. Elles se sont constituées en groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Elles font partie d'un des groupes du banc Villageois de PALENE COKI.

Madame Astou D. est âgée de 29ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle fait un petit commerce de savon en poudre, d'encens, de parfums, de colliers en perles, de pagnes et de chaussures. 

Elle a une ancienneté de 06 mois dans le Banc Villageois et en est à son second prêt
 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa marchandise en s'approvisionnant en quantité plus importante. 

Son objectif est de soutenir financièrement son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar solidarity group formed on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of 31 women from the same village who came together through friends and neighbours. The group belongs to the Palene Coki village bank.
Mrs. Astou D. is 29 years old. She is married and has three children, one of whom is a boy. She sells powder soap, incense, perfume, pearl necklaces, cloth and shoes.
She has been a member of the village bank for six months and is on her second loan.With this new loan, she’ll expand her stock by stocking larger quantities.Her goal is to help her husband cover family expenses like food and healthcare.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy powder soap, incense, perfume, pearl necklaces, cloth and shoes

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Salvador Antonio tiene 42 años, es casado tiene 4 hijos. Salvador se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos usados. Sus hijos son consientes del sacrificio que realiza su padre y ayudan también en algunos quehaceres diarios en el hogar a tareas sencillas. Los sueños de Salvador es ampliar su vivienda y el negocio para generar más ingresos para el hogar. El crédito que solicita es  para la compra de repuestos usados de vehículos ya que tiene ciertos encargos pendientes. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Salvador Antonio is 42 years old, married and has four children. He runs a business selling spare parts from used cars. His children are aware of the sacrifices that their father makes for them and help him with some of the small daily tasks around the home. Salvador is requesting a loan to purchase used spare parts as he already has orders pending. He dreams of increasing his business to provide a better service and generate more home income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita B. is from the village of Calamagui 1st. She is 38 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Marita owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Marita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Marita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Oyundelger B. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in Hentiy province, central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest two daughters, aged 21 and 19, both attend a different university while her youngest son studies at a local high school. Her husband operates a taxi service for locals to supplement the family's income.
Oyundelger operates a meat trading business in her town by herself. She purchases a variety of meats from the local market and sells the products in Huchit Shonhor market, one of the largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has monthly sales of approximately 2,750,000 MNT. Her husband earns between 15,000 and 25,000 MNT per day from his taxi business. Oyundelger's business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. The operating cost of her business is around 9,000 MNT and her monthly net profit reaches 490,000 MNT. In addition, she owns three houses which she lets out, for which she receives an extra income of 100,000 MNT per month from each house in rent.
Oyundelger hopes to grow her business in the future and continue her success. She says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my children." Oyundelger is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan. She will use 1,800,000 MNT to purchase more meat in order to increase her sales, and the rest to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben L., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. L. produces traditional baskets for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. The family has to spend USD 80 on food, USD 20 on public transportation, and USD 60 on children’s education every month. 

L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more traditional baskets to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more baskets to resell.

loans.name: Fouléra

texts.fr: fouléra est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adéwi à lomé. En 1990 elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle exerce son commerce dans une boutique à la devanture de sa maison. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. en prévision à la demande de sa clientèle qui va s'accentuer compte tenue de l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 8 cartons de lait, 5 cartons de sucre, 10 sacs moyen de riz et divers autres produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Fouléra is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Adéwi neighborhood of Lomé. In 1990 she started a business selling grocery products. She does business in a shop in the front of her home. Her customers come from diverse backgrounds. Anticipating her customers' increasing demand due to the approaching holiday season, she is seeking a loan through WAGES in order to stock up with 8 cartons of milk, 5 cartons of sugar, 10 medium bags of rice, and various other grocery products.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M.  is currently in the business of selling various items at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc. to sell.  Joseph is 40 years-old and is married with a husband that is an engineer. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock items such bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc to sell

loans.name: Hudoykul

texts.ru: Хасанов Худойкул проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян. Он хочет посеет и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Hudoykul H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 51 years old, married and has 7 children.  He has a secondary education.  Hudoykul has been involved in agriculture for over 8 years.  He has a land plot at home, where he grows vegetables.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.  He wants to plant and gather a good harvest for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Shalimar with her family in a two-room brick house. She came here after her marriage.

Her husband’s name is M. W. and he is a motor mechanic who runs a motor workshop. He has 12 years of experience in his work and has a good technical knowledge of his business. He can repair every kind of vehicle and people approach him and trust him for his good and quality work.

Nusrat is a very supportive lady and supports her family financially by making artificial jewelry. She receives orders from different jewelry shops and makes jewelry on order to earn an income for the family. She also has a part-time business selling clothes to her neighboring clients. She has four daughters and a son. All of her children are very young and getting their education, except for the youngest who is four years old.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. He will invest the loan in purchasing the latest repair tools for his motor workshop to provide better quality services to his clients and finish repairing orders on time. Nusrat is hopeful that a loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and help her family achieve a better standard of living.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy the latest repair tools for a motor workshop business.

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren L. is 46 years old and a single mother and lives with her three sons in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student, and her twin sons attend a local high school. Otgonsuren supports her family by operating a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products and fruits. She started her business in 1994, selling only flour. 

After years of successful operation, she was able to expand her product line by selling a variety of foodstuffs and fruits since 2004 and has built up a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her son's tuition fees but also to provide her family. 

Otgonsuren is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more varieties of grocery products in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery products

loans.name: Maria De Las Nieves

texts.es:
Maria de la Nieves es socia del Banco comunal Gotitas de amor, es casada, tiene 46 años y  7 hijos.
Maria de la Nieves es feriante, aprendió de este negocio de una amiga,  viaja a la feria de Tambo, ahí vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños y le va bien.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para surtir.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria de la Nieves is a member of the 'Gotitas de Amor' community bank.  She is married, 46 years old, and has 7 children.

Maria de la Nieves is a market trader and learned the business from a friend.  She travels to Tambo market and there she sells women's, men's and children's clothes.  Her business is doing well.

Maria de las Nieves will invest the loan she is requesting in buying clothes to stock her business.  She likes her community bank meetings because they allow her to access loans and to save.  Her dream is for her business to grow and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes

loans.name: Bonavanture

texts.en:
Bonavanture is 31 years old and is married with five children between the ages 1 and 14 years old.  Bonavanture is a self-employed businessman who sells cassava flour.  His shop is open from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and he has been working in the business for five years. He is an ambitious man.

Bonavanture will use this loan to purchase a large quantity of cassava flour.  With this large quantity, he will also start wholesaling. He hopes to earn more profit to help provide for his family and to save in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. W. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

For 20 years, Ama has been smoking fish for sale at Elmina. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

She is asking for the loan to buy an extra quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy land.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou N. est âgé  de 39 ans .Il est marié et s'active dans la vente de matériaux de quincaillerie (boulon ,vice)il bénéficie de plusieurs années d'expériences dans ce secteur. Il collabore avec un magasin à Mbour qui lui fournis de la marchandise et lui disposant de sa propre voiture livre la marchandise directement à ses clients ce qui élimine d'office la concurrence car souvent le client achète et supporte les frais de transport. C'est une activité très rentable et qui lui permet de payer sans difficultés aucune
texts.en: Mamadou N. is 39 years old. He is married and works selling hardware items . He has (bolts, nuts). He has many years of experience in this sector. He collaborates with a store in Mbour where he gets his merchandise. Having his own car, he delivers the merchandise directly to clients, which gives him a competitive edge, since   clients often pay for  goods and delivery. This is a very profitable activity, which allows him to repay his loans without any difficulty.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: Hakim Mubarik Ali's Group

texts.en:
Hakim lives in the small Pakistani city of Kot Radha Kishan, which is famous for its dairy industry. She has lived in the area of Rawal Jhangerh in a three-roomed brick house with her family for the past 30 years. She doesn’t have any children and spends her time carrying out her household responsibilities. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he takes lands on contract to grow different seasonal crops and vegetables. Basically, he is a farmer by profession. He has been engaged in this business for 25 years and has vast experience.
Hakim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to invest in his business. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to grow seasonal crops and to earn more profits from his work. Hakim is a very religious person and has a firm belief in her God that after investing the loan, if her husband works hard, he will definitely gain more profits from his business.
Hakim is a regular loan user of Asasah. She never gives any cause for complaint and always pays her loan installments on time. This is her sixth loan application.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing seasonal crops

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 28 years old and she is married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years old. Marie’s husband is a businessman, and they do the same business. Marie owns a business selling mobile phones.

Marie has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing various styles of mobile phones to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to resolve the problems she has.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana Maria A. F.  , tiene la edad de 37 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo que le apoya con los gastos del hogar , doña Juana desde hace cuatro años labora como auxiliar de farmacia en el hospital de Ticuantepe  , con mucho esfuerzo y el de su esposo han logrado mejora de la vivienda , se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva atrávez de Afodenic , ya que los intereses son bajos y eso le permite adquirir un crédito para tener una mejor condición de vida  ya que con su salario cada mes no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales de construcción que le pide el maestro de obra para iniciar la obra . Con el crédito quiere comprar bloques, cemento, arena,  hierro, estribos, clavos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana María A. F., 37, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband who helps with household expenses.

Juana has been employed as a Pharmacy Aide at the Ticuantepe Hospital for the last four years.  With much effort of her own and of her husband they have managed to do some home improvements.  

She feels happy for the help Kiva provides her through Afodenic because interest rates are low and that allows her to get a loan to have better living conditions because her monthly salary isn’t sufficient to buy all the building materials and supplies that the master builder asks for to start the project all at once.  

She will use the loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, iron rods, struts and nails, among others.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en:
Hajidmaa P. is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her son, Batzaya, in their own house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband died in 2007. 

She manages a goods-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with working capital of 350,000 MNT. With 11 years of stable business operation she gained much experience and expanded her business. She travels to China once or twice a month in order to import her goods. 

Recently she opened a hair salon in her town. She built a strong customer base and customers are happy with her polite and quick service. Now her working capital has reached 2,800,000 MNT. 

She is a polite woman who says."Being polite is number one importance for business success." 

She is requesting a 2,100,000 MNT loan to purchase a collection of goods from China.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of goods from China

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy E. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She and her husband have six children, of whom four are already married and the rest are still single and at their adolescent stage. 

The couple has been engaged in fishing as owners and operators of a fishing boat locally known as “Sakayan.” For over 30 years, they’ve been in this kind of business to support the family. At this time they are earning an average net income of not less than PHP 4,000. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 1 year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a second cycle loaner with a good credit record, she has requested PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies. 

The future income from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs, to repay the loan and to save for the future. She is hoping that this project will yield a good catch with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita is 69 years old and married with two children. Laurita works very hard to provide for them. She  buys and sells "Nipa" (palm leaves) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more palm leaves to sell.

Laurita has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Laurita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Solitario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Solitario”, se encuentra en el estado D. México en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Natalia es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el sexto año D. primaria, es comerciante. Ella se dedica a la venta D. verdura que inicio hace 10 años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y diariamente necesitan verduras para su comida. 

Al solicitar este prestamo las señoras se sienten muy contentas ya que estaban muy necesitaban el apoyo para poder solventar sus gastos para la temporada. Sus clientes nos cuentan que les gusta comprarle por que siempre tiene limpia y fresca sus verduras y es muy amable al atenderlos. 

La señora Natalia desea este prestamo para poder invertir en materias primas. Con esto esperan poder incrementar sus ventas y en consecuencias sus ganacias porque sus perspectivas son buenas y productivas al querer ampliar su negocio y tambien tener dentro D. sus posibilidades el poder pagar el prestamo que se le dará. También desea con las gananciasd ahorrar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos y en lo que necesite su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Solitario” (Solitaire) and is located in the Mexican state of México.  The group has 9 members.  

Natalia is the group's President.  She’s 46 years old and completed 6th graD.; she’s a merchant.  She started selling vegetables 10 years ago and is asking for the loan to invest in her business since she has many customers who need vegetables daily for their meals.

While requesting this loan the women feel very happy because they were quite needy of support to meet their expenses for the season.  Their customers tell us that they like to buy from her because her vegetables are always clean and fresh and she is very kind to them.

Natalia wants the loan to invest in raw materials.  They hope with it to increase sales and consequently profits because their prospects are good and productive in wanting to expand their business as well as having repaying the loan within their possibilities.  She also hopes to use profits to save in order to help her family with expenses and whatever else they may need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Wokulira Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and has been running a grocery store in Mukono for the past seven years. She mostly sells watermelon, pineapples, soft drinks, and other items. The mother of six says that she has learned a great deal about many business fundamentals during this time. Her business goal is to find ways to improve and expand her business. Sarah has used her good relationship skills and work ethic to make significant strides. She believes that her business prospects will continue to expand as long as she maintains her unwavering attitude. Sarah says that she was prevailed upon by her husband to start her business. Prior to that, she made ends meet through teaching. She has not dispensed with teaching, although the remuneration for teachers in Uganda is not something one can talk of in the highest of terms. Sarah’s weekly profits are approximately 60,000 UGX.

Sarah will use her portion of her Kiva loan to purchase more pineapples, jakefruit, watermelon and soft drinks to sell at her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en:
Nhorn, 42 years old, resides with her husband and children at Siem Reap province. She has been a farmer since 2008, earning US $2 per day. Her husband has been a policeman since 2000, earning US $10 per day. She has two children. One is a student and one is a construction worker, earning US $3 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food, US $15 on school fees and US $20 on transportation. 

Nhorn would like to ask for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to go to work and to the field. This loan will help her to reduce the costs of motor taxis and be convenient for her husband's career. 

In the future, she hopes to have a toilet for her house and she wants her children study at university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
Toujours en activité dans son atelier de réparation de machines à coudre, l’emprunteur est devenu, depuis la mort de son pére , le responsable de sa  famille composée de 10 personnes. Il est marié  et a trois enfants. Toutes les dépenses de la famille (location,  nourriture, éducation, santé,  factures d’eau et d’électricité) sont à sa charge pour un montant de  225 000 par mois. La famille vit dans la promiscuité si bien que 4 personnes dorment dans une seule pièce . 
Sa journée démarre très tôt à 6h 30  et il lui arrive de travailler toute la nuit lors des grandes fêtes. Il répare des machines à coudre en panne. Il achète aussi des machines neuves ou d’occasion chez des grossistes qu’il revend en détails aux tailleurs. Il a réussi à ouvrir une petite mercerie dont il a confié la gestion à sa petite soeur.Son activité a de relles opportunités pour reussir car le marché de la couture est tres large et la demande est forte aussi bien dans sa localité qu' à l'étranger.
. C'est pourquoi, il demande un crédit de 350 000f pour augmenter ses marchandises en achetant notamment 4 machines à coudre, du fils et des garnitures.Il n' a jamais sollicite de prêts à l'IMCEC bien que sociétaire de cette institution depuis 2008.
Les bénéfices tirés de ce financement pourront lui permettre  d’augmenter  et de diversifier les produits de sa mercerie, de se lancer dans la vente de pièces détachées de machine à coudre. Il pourra également mieux supporter les charges sociales de la famille qui pèsent lourd sur lui (location, alimentation, éducation …).
Son ambition est de générer assez de revenus pour se lancer dans l’importation de matériels et de fournitures pour la couture.Il reve de construire une maison pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Always busy in his sewing machine repair workshop, the borrower became the head of his family of 10 people after the death of his father. He is married and has three children. All family expenses (rent, food, education, health, utilities) fall on his shoulders and amount to 225,000 francs a month. The family is living from hand to mouth, such that four people sleep in a single room. 

His day begins very early, at 6:30 am, and sometimes he works through the night when it is a big holiday. He repairs broken sewing machines and also buys new or used machines from wholesalers and then resells them retail to tailors. He has also managed to open a little sewing notions shop which he has  his little sister manage. His business has real opportunities to succeed since the market for tailored goods is very big and there is plenty of demand, in his own locality and elsewhere. 

This is why he is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to grow his stock of merchandise by buying in particular four sewing machines, some thread, and accessories. He has never asked for a loan from IMCEC even though he has been a member since 2008. 

The profit from this loan will allow him to add to his stock and diversify the products in his sewing notions business and get into selling spare parts for sewing machines. He will also be able to deal better with family expenses, which are quite a burden for him (rent, food, education, etc.)

His ambition is  to generate enough income to get into importing sewing materials and supplies. He dreams of building a house for his family to live in.

loans.use: tp buy sewing machines, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widow selling clothes and underwear at Kokoado, a village near Elmina in Cape Coat. She has 7 dependents. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her home. The loan will serve to buy more clothing and underwear. Mary plans to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and has four children. She is 38 years old and lives in Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Flora has a restaurant. Each month, she earns approximately 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Flora has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay her children's tuition. Flora has been a member of PMPC for over two years. In the future, Flora would like her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 44 years old and married. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is taking care of her 5 children. She owns and operates a retail store at home to earn a living. For 5 years of running the store, Sheila typically gets PHP 8,700 a month.

In 2007, Sheila joined GDMPC. The cooperative had approved her 9th loan application, of PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy additional products to sell such as grocery items, school and office supplies, etc. With the loan taken, Sheila hopes for further improvement of the business operations to gain more income.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as grocery items, school and office supplies, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with nine children. Seven of her children attend school and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the summer hot season the availability of vegetables for resale is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nchoke

texts.en:
Nchoke is 26 years old, married to Kateto, and they are blessed with three children aged between eight years old and nine months old. He has been selling milk for the past seven years. He has been loaned KES 30,000 which he plans to use to add more cattle for rearing and selling.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a ranch in Athi River, in the near future. He hopes to become a  KENYA CREAMERIES COMPANY  supplier in two years.

loans.use: to add more cattle for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Noubignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUBIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Roseline Nadia, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Roseline Nadia est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à Sylvain, un tailleur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Roseline Nadia et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Roseline Nadia vend des chaussures et divers articles (conserves, sucre, lait, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Roseline Nadia s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Roseline Nadia et les autres membres du groupe NOUBIGNON sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group NOUBIGNON is comprised of three persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Roseline Nadia. In the photo, she is the one with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and married to Sylvain, a tailor. They have three children, who are all in school. The family lives together in the same house. 

Roseline Nadia and her husband jointly provide for the need of their home. To do so, Roseline Nadia sells footwear and a variety of items (canned foods, sugar, milk, etc.) at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the demands of their customers, Roseline Nadia and the other members of the group NOUBIGNON are requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy shoes, boxes of sugar and milk, and some canned foods

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. Clementina es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, este lugar es de clima frió y propicio por sus pampas para la cría de ganado, su población se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Clementina tiene 66 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo en su juventud.

Doña Clementina se dedica a laborar en los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa se dedica a la agricultura que es solo para su consumo, también cría cuyes, gallinas y ganado los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. 

En el banco comunal es socia hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the "San Vicente" communal bank.  She lives in a community that is part of the Victoria del Portete parish. This is a place with a cold climate, and because of its grasslands, it is suitable for raising livestock. The people who live there raise animals and farm. Many work in the city of Cuenca in various activities. They maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Clementina is 66 and a widow, but she has seven children who are adults, married, and on their own.  She owns the house where she lives, and it represents the sacrifice and hard work of her youth.

Clementina works doing her household chores, and as she spends her time at home, she farms to supply her own needs.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock, that she sells when she has any financial need. She has been with the communal bank for two years, and she will use her new loan to buy chickens. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 45-year-old divorced woman with one child. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been in the produce business for ten years. Her hardship is high transport charges and her vision is to own a big food store plus a good residential house.

Eliza needs the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Marceline habite au Sénégal dans la région sud ,elle fait le commerce de poissons fumés mariée depuis 19795, elle a 4 enfants.Avant de se marier ,elle pratiquait se commerce car elle habite dans une zone producteuse de poissons.
Marceline avec son commerce,elle soutien son mari pour les frais de scolarisation des enfants et la nouriture de la famille.Avec son commerce elle pense contruire en dur leur maison qui est un ancien batimen en banco.
texts.en: Marceline lives in the south of Senegal and sells smoked fish.  She has been married since 1979 and has four children.  She carried out this business before she got married because she lives in a fishing area.  Through her business, Marceline supports her husband in covering their children's education expenses and in feeding the family.  Through her business she plans to re-build their home from durable construction materials as it is an old house made from mud.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish to increase her stock

loans.name: Srey Orn

texts.en:
Srey Orn is 32 years old and married with 3 children who attend school. 

For the last 8 years, she has been farming on her land to earn a living.  Srey Orn also plants cassava and works at other plantations to gain additional income. 

Srey Orn has been with VisionFund for 3 years and is now requesting a loan to cultivate rice on her farmland and to plant cassava trees.  With this loan, she hopes to earn more income to feed her family, to buy necessary household goods and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cultivate rice paddy and plant cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines with her two children. She is a widow who supports her family by selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for the last two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from one of the institutions in Waterloo, a town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. School staff and other salaried workers do come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni to seek loans. With the help of these loans, they are able to solve problems that their salaries alone cannot solve. Then at the end of each month their bursar or finance officer repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Hassan is the leader of this group of teachers. The twenty-three year old is a native of Mile Ninety village. He is married and has three children. Hassan has requested this loan in order to buy a television set for his household.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his household.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old.

Muia owns and operates a business venture selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has three years of experience in this business.   

Muia needs a loan of WST 1800 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be  $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Muia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Muia's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y trato jovial. Convive con Elías quien es cocinero. Viven juntos a lado de su hermana y su hijo de 2 años de edad, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Luz es la venta de abarrotes en general, para eso abrió un bodega en su propia casa. Negocio que aprendió de su padre, quien tenía su bodega en su casa, y contando con un apoyo financiero de MFP comenzó con éste negocio comprando productos en pequeñas cantidades , logrando crecer así su tienda durante estos 04 años que viene funcionando, y que hasta el momento lo hace sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, sin embargo no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan, pero aun así continua con su trabajo. Pero su fin es crecer como comerciante y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un tienda donde pueda vender toda clase de productos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría, aun existe el ingreso de algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Luz, 24, is a happy and hard-working woman, besides having a very kind and jovial manner.  She lives with Elías, who is a cook.  They live together next to her sister and her two-year-old son, in her own home.  

The business Luz has is selling general groceries, so she opened a grocery store in her own house.  She learned the business from her father, who had his grocery store in his house, and with financial help from MFP.  She began her business buying small quantities of products, in this way managing to grow during these four years she has been operating, which up to the present she does alone.

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home to be able to take care of her young child, as well as the economic income that serves her to buy what she needs for her home.  Nevertheless, she does not like that some of her customers ask her for credit and then get behind when it comes time to pay.  Even so she continues with her job.  But her goal is to grow as a merchant and expand her grocery store until she converts it into a store where she can sell all types of products.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  She also comments that she feels good about her communal bank because she knows the majority of the members, although there are still some new ones joining.  She hopes they are responsible like the rest of the group.

With the requested loan of 1500 PEN she will invest in buying wholesale products for her store, such as sugar, rice, oil, and others.

loans.use: to buy household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Miriam Judith

texts.es:
Mirian Judith tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y el hijo de  1 año en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Mirian Judith se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además cría animales como los cerdos y pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar, insumos, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas. Con el apoyo del crédito le facilitara para mejorar y hacer más desmontes a los terrenos.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas esto ocurre cuando hay mucha lluvia. El sueño es comprarse tierras y trabajar en algo propio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar al hijo y jugar con él.
texts.en:
Mirian Judith, 28, is married and has a son; she lives with her husband and one-year-old son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank located in Recinto Cachely Grande that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Mirian Judith farms corn and also raises animals like pigs and free-range chickens.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, seeds, manure, fertilizer and liquids for the infestations.  Support from the loan will help her improve and remove weeds from the fields.

She faces challenges like infestations which occur when there is an excess of rain.  Her dream is to buy land and to work for herself.  In her free time she enjoys caring for her son and playing with him.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 39 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids. For her family, cassava farming is the main source of income that she can earn up to 28,000 KHR per day. Now, she is in need of working capital, therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She really hopeful with this loan that can make her farm well than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Offelia

texts.en:
Offelia works hard to support her family. Offelia is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Offelia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Offelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is a lively and active member of Life in Africa. She is currently working in the Invisible Children Bracelet Project. She is educated and holds a Bachelor's Degree in Development studies but, since finishing her University studies, she has been unable to find a job. She supported herself by doing odd jobs and managed to earn enough money to open a small retail shop.

This shop is in a very good location and is lucrative because there are few other shops in the village. The people would have to walk very long distances to find the products she plans on offering.
