By bringing these products closer to them she will be guaranteed a large and solid customer base. This will not only provide more income for her but will also serve her community. For this reason she wishes to grow and expand her shop.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to purchase the stock needed to expand her existing shop.

Below is her budget:

  • Sugar 2 bags @70,000/=
  • Rice 1 bag @70,000/=
  • Batteries 2 boxes @ 5,500/=
  • Cooking oil 1 jerry can @ 20,000/=
  • fridge 1 Unit @ 300,000/=
  • Soap 2 boxes @ 10,000/=
  • Maize flour 1 bag @ 12,000/=
  • Salt 2 cartons @ 10,000/=
  • Paraffin 1 jerry can @ 26,000/=
  • Match boxes 1 carton @ 7,500/=
  • Baking Powder 1 box @ 48,000/=
  • Geisha 1 box @ 8,000/=
  • Millet flour 1 Bag @10,000/=
  • contingencies 32,000/=

Total------------------ 800,000/=

She will be paying 102,890/= per month for 10 months in order to completely service the loan properly. Edith has designated 25% of the interest she pays on the loan to support the Internet4Change team at Life in Africa, where she is an Agent in training.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs and household commodities

loans.name: Délali

texts.en:
Mrs. Délali Y. is a gentle and friendly woman. Married to a carpenter, she is the mother of four children. The income from her husband’s job varies according to his clients’ demands, and it usually falls well short of the household needs. In order to contribute towards the family expenses, Mrs. Y. has ventured into making a baby’s porridge in her neighborhood, using her modest savings from selling iced water. She hopes to take advantage of financial support to stock up on more corn in order to safeguard against a shortage of raw materials. To do this, she needs a loan of $700, which will provide the funds for stocking up on corn and preparing the porridge. The sale of the porridge will allow her to meet her household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Y. Délali est une douce femme très accueillante. Mariée à un menuisier, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Les revenus du travail de son mari varient en fonction de la demande de ses clients, et sont la plupart du temps largement en dessous des besoins du foyer. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Madame Y. Délali s’est lancée dans la préparation de la bouillie dans son quartier à partir d’une petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée. Elle compte bénéficier d’un appui financier pour stocker plus de maïs afin d’être à l’abri de toute pénurie en matières premières. Pour ce faire, elle a besoin d’un crédit d’un montant de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour le stockage du maïs et la préparation de bouillie. La vente de cette bouillie lui permettra de couvrir les charges du ménage.

loans.use: To stock up on corn in order to prepare and sell baby porridge

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks palm kennel oil and sells it in gallons to her clients. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. Saúl began his business 4 ago with his bricklayer salary. He sells everything related to locksmiths: doors, windows, gates, etc. Mr. Saúl started out with very few clients. Now, a few months later, he has clients constantly working with him.

Use of Loan: Mr. Saúl has the tools he needs to work with but not the funds to purchase material and merchandise to meet his clients’ demands nor an adequate workshop to work in.

Personal Information: He is single, his house is made of concrete and his goal is to have a bigger workshop to provide others in need a job opportunity.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: El Señor Saúl empezó su negocio hace 4 años producto de un dinero que ganaba como albañil, el vende todo lo concerniente en cerrajería tales como puertas, ventanas, rejas, etc. El Señor Saúl empezó con muy pocos clientes de los cuales con el pasar de los meses esto ha cambiado y hoy tiene clientes que siempre están trabajando con el.

Uso del Préstamo: EL Señor Saúl tiene hoy en día todas las herramientas necesarias para trabajar pero su capital no es suficiente, pues el cuenta con este crédito para poder comprar mas material y mercadería para poder atender todas las demandas de sus clientes y de esta manera poder tener sus taller mas adecuado para trabajar.

Información Personal: EL es soltero, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es poder tener un día su taller mas grande y de esta manera dar oportunidades de trabajo a mas personas que necesitan.

loans.use: Invest in prime materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. is 42 years old, and married with six children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs.  She is in need of the funds above to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sunadi

texts.id:
In Bali, wife's role in the family is very important. Besides raising children, also manage household needs, awife is also required to have enough income to support husband's income, so that all needs could be fulfilled. Thi role is fulfilled by Ni Ketut Sunadi since she married I Wayan Suda, a man who works as a tenant farmer. Mature age is not stopping Sunadi to do business. For Sunadi raising pigs does not require a lot of energy. Important is capital and persistant for her to expand the business. Her last sales was Rp1,950,000 (about US$220) from sales of 2 pigs, that she raised for 5 months with a capital of Rp750,000 (about $82.50) for feed expense, and Rp400,000 (about $44) for feedstock. Sunadi's profit was Rp800,000 (about $88). Sunadi plans to expand her business by obtaining a loan from Dinari for Rp1,500,000 (about $165), which will be used to buy 4 piglets, since 2 parts of her stall are now empty, because the pigs were sold to pay for Final exams expenses of her child I Putu Pande Kartika Yasa, who finished Mechanical Middle School. Sunadi hopes the results to be obtained would better than previously, so that it could pay for her child's higher education, which up to now is still postponed.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di Bali peranan Istri dalam suatu rumah tangga sangatlah penting. Disamping sebagai pengasuh anak-anak dan juga mengurus segala keperluan rumah tangga seorang istri juga dituntut untuk dapat memiliki penghasilan yang mampu menunjang pendapatan suami sehingga semua kebutuhan bisa terpenuhi. Peranan ini telah di lakukan oleh Ni Ketut sunadi sejak menikah dengan I Wayan Suda, laki-laki yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai petani . Usia yang kini semakin lanjut tak menghalangi Sunadi untuk terus berusaha , bagi Sunadi memelihara ternak babi tidak memerlukan tenaga terlalu banyak , yang penting ada modal dan ketekunan itu sudah cukup baginya untuk mengembangkan usaha ini. Hasil penjualan terakhir yang di peroleh Sunadi sebesar Rp 1.950.000,- dari 2 Ekor ternak yang di pelihara selama 5 bulan .dengan menghabiskan modal sebesar Rp 750.000,- untuk biaya pakan dan Rp 400.000,- Untuk Bibitnya, Sunadi mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 800.000 ,- Sunadi bermaksud mengembangkan usahanya ini dengan meminjam modal dari Dinari, sebesar Rp 1.500.000 ,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit lagi, karena dua bagian kandang miliknya kini kosong karena babinya di jual untuk biaya Ujian Akhir anaknya, I Putu Pande Kartika Yasa,yang telah menyelesaikan sekolah mekanik (STM). Dan Sunadi pun Berharap hasil yang di dapatnya lebih baik dari sebelumnya. Sehingga bisa membiayai kelanjutan pendidikan anaknya ke Perguruan Tinggi yang sampai sat ini masih tertunda.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Boin

texts.en: Mrs. Boin H., age 38, works on her plot of land raising pigs, earning less than US$1 a day. Her husband sells firewood and charcoal, earning $7 a day. They have two children, one of whom also works selling wood, earning about US$100 a month, while the other one is a student. Mrs. H. would like to borrow US$1,200 in order to purchase more wood to invest in her family’s business. By purchasing large amounts of wood, she can take advantage of bulk discounts which will increase their profit margins. The additional inventory will also meet growing customer demand, thereby increasing the family's income revenue.

loans.use: Purchase wood for sale

loans.name: Maria Lissette

texts.es:
Señora R. used to just attend to her house because of the difficult situation she was going through since she was unemployed. For this reason, she saw the need to help her husband with the education of their four kids and started selling miscellaneous products.

She started her business with $100 that her sister provided her as a loan. Her business is located in her home, which is favorable for her because she doesn't have to pay rent or taxes, and she also has a good influx of clients since her house is one block from La Estación market.

For a year and a half, señora R. has worked with the credits provided to her by Ceprodel, and she has managed to achieve favorable conditions for the sale of her products and to buy display cases, shelves, and a refrigerator. She has also been able to help better her family's quality of life and to help educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. R. anteriormente solamente se dedicaba a atender su hogar por la situación difícil que atravesaba ya que estaba sin empleo. Por esta razón se ve en la necesidad de apoyar a su compañero en la educación de sus cuatros hijos e inicia a vender productos misceláneos.

Inicia su negocio con U$ 100 que le es facilitado por su hermana en concepto de préstamo, el mismo es establecido en su casa lo cual le favorece su posición puesto que no tiene que alquilar ni pagar impuesto además de tener buena afluencia de cliente por encontrarse ubicado a una cuadra del mercado La Estación .

Durante año y medio la señora R. ha trabajado con los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel habiendo logrado alcanzar condiciones favorables para la venta de sus productos y compra de vitrinas, estantes y refrigerador sin olvidar la ayuda al mejoramiento de sus condiciones familiares y el apoyo a la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola A. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells clothes and has been in business since 2000. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more clothes for sale. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos R. is a blacksmith who has been working in this area for over 13 years.  He currently works out of his house and works very hard to support his family--he is married with five children.  With the loan of $375, Carlos will buy a semi-industrial cutting machine for his business.  

With access to better machinery Carlos will be able to make and fix items faster and with more efficiency. This will increase his earnings and help put his children through school.

loans.use: To buy machinery for his blacksmithing business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H. and her husband, Ra Seng, have been married since 1988. They have one daughter who is weaving silk at home. The family lives along the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chea has been a silk weaver for twenty eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for two years. It’s a skill he learned from Chea. They sell their finished products to the middle man inside the village.

Mrs. Chea is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Syoni

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Syoni M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 13 and 22.

In 2004, Syoni established her clothing business. Syoni requires a loan in order to purchase traditional African cloth, dresses, and sarongs. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase and make traditional African cloth, dresses, and sarongs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina has always been a very responsible woman in her household. In her noble profession as an artisan she makes beautiful and elegant ponchos for women and bedspreads for babies. Thanks to her agile and talented hands she is managing to fulfill the weekly requests from her customers. In addition to this work, on Sundays and Mondays he works selling American-style clothing though which she earns extra income that allows her to live peacefully with her dear youngest son Enrique, who is 9 years old. Agustina's wish is to buy more raw material (wool) in order to increase the volume of production of her beautiful, intricate hand-woven garments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Agustina, siempre demostró ser una mujer muy responsable en su hogar, con sus hijos y en su noble oficio como artesana, elabora manualmente hermosos y elegantes ponchos para damas y colchas para bebés, gracias a sus ágiles y talentosas manos está logrando cumplir satisfactoriamente con las solicitudes que semanalmente le hacen sus clientes, Adicionalmente a esta labor los días domingos y lunes se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, negocio mediante el cual también obtiene ingresos extras que le permite vivir en tranquilidad a lado de su querido y menor hijo Enrique de 9 añitos de edad.El deseo de Agustina es contar con mayor materia prima ( lana) para aumentar el volumen de producción de sus hermosas prendas tejidas manualmente con finísimos detalles.

loans.use: Increasing capital in order to buy more raw material

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo A. is 30 years old, married, and the father or two. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for more than five years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To earn more money and to improve his living conditions, Kodjo would like to use this loan, the first with FECECAV, to buy a new motorbike.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Kodjo A. est âgé de 30 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 5 ans à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour gagner plus d’argent et améliorer ses conditions de vie, Kodjo désire utiliser ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, pour acheter une nouvelle moto

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a fifty-nine year old married mother with nine children. Gregoria works in the central street in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells “cancha” (corn snacks) from 2:00 PM in the afternoon to 10:00 PM at night from a cart. She buys the ingredients for the cancha and makes them herself. Additionally, Gregoria sells sweets and canchas at different city events.

Gregoria is a member of the Violeta Village Bank

Gregoria needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

Gregoria´s dream is to have a stable grocery store and supply her business, while having a home of her own.

loans.use: to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Iris Diana

texts.es:
Iris belongs to the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, she lives at Jr. Arenal # 1063, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 24 years old and is single. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling candy.

Today she continues selling a variety of candy and soda pop.

With the current loan for S/1.100 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 3 boxes of small soda pop, 3 packages of large soda pop, and a variety of candy

Everyday is a challenge for Iris. So she is happy for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos provides her to receive a loan and invest in her business. This way she can bring income to her family. She has always liked being independent and this is why she likes her business as she can converse with her customers and make many friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Iris, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal # 1063, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años es soltera. Iris con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de golosinas.

Actualmente continua con la venta de variedad de golosinas y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 cajas de gaseosa chica, 3 paquetes de gaseosa grande, y variedad de golosinas.

Para Iris cada día es un reto. Es por ello que Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir. Y de tal forma ella pueda llevar un ingreso a su familia. A ella Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente de tal manera le gusta mucho su negocio ya que de esa manera puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos.

loans.use: Buy soda pop and candy

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout H., 49, is a true entrepreneur and has a business selling groceries for her local people. On average, she makes US$3 of profit per day. Her husband, Hean Rith, 48, is a fisherman from the river. He always sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 per day. This couple together has seven children; two of whom are students, three others are employed in different work. Mrs. Hout needs a loan from Kiva of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for transportation.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia tiene 48 años, vive con sus ancianos padres y sus 2 hijos.   Trabaja  cada día con su propia herramienta de trabajo, que es su máquina fotocopiadora, en un pequeño espacio que alquiló en el centro de la ciudad, todas las mañanas se dirige a su puesto para dedicarse a sacar copias de los pedidos que le hacen, de esta manera, consigue lo que necesita día a día, para conseguir el sustento diario, ya lleva 2 años con esta labor, antes se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero las constantes caminatas hicieron que prefiriera cambiar de rubro, a pesar de que este mes la entrada ha sido baja, ella no desespera, porque el resto del año tiene mejores temporadas.  Clelia trabaja de esta forma para poder educar a sus hijos.   Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de papales al por mayor para sus fotocopiados, en un futuro, desea alquilar un stand en un local más céntrico y visible al público.
texts.en:
Clelia is 48-years-old and lives with her elderly parents and 2 children. She works every day with her own tool for work, her photocopier. She goes to a small space that she rented in center of the city every morning where she makes copies that people order from her. In this way, she makes what she needs every day to cover her daily living expenses. She has done this work for 2 years. She used to sell cosmetics, but the constant long walks made her want to change jobs. Even though her income this month has been low, she isn't giving up hope because the rest of the year will be a busier season. Clelia works to be able to educate her children. She is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of wholesale paper for her photocopies. In the future, she hopes to rent a stand in a more central location that is more visible to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of paper for her photocopies

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Su Nombre es Blanca Nubia Olivia López su estado civil es casada, ella tiene 53 años de edad, Doña Blanca tiene una hija de 33 años de edad, que trabaja por cuenta propia y no depende de su mama, su compañero de vida labora como albañil, los propósitos que ella tiene es de establecer un local donde obtenga mas ingresos y proporcionar mejoras para ella como lo es la compra de un electrodoméstico como seria una refrigeradora pues la que posee no es de su pertenecía sino de las diferentes casas que le distribuyen el producto como la coca -cola  y pepsi y entre sus propósitos esta obtener sus artículos para su hogar ahorrando lo poco que obtiene en sus ingresos.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pollo y venta de jugos, gaseosa y  cerveza el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por motivación propia ya que siempre le ha gustado actuar de forma independiente y buscar el medio para sobrevivir e inicia con la venta de pollo del cual recibe ingresos y decide colocar otro negocio con la venta de gaseosas, jugos y cerveza ya que esta representa una fuerte demanda en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en león en la siguiente dirección barrio de subtiava de la Texaco guido 3 ½ cuadra al norte, la solicitud de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para estar de esta manea activa en su negocio necesita incrementar mas en los productos de coca- cola, pepsi y cerveza por lo que tiene que tiene que satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes y recurre a este financiamiento por medio de la empresa Fundación León 2000 que le ha brindado su ayuda en los créditos.
texts.en:
Her name is Blanca Nubia Olivia López, she is married, 53 years old, and has a 33 year old daughter who works for herself and does not depend on her mother. Her lifetime partner works in construction. Her goal is to establish a locale where she can earn a greater income, and make improvements such as buying a refrigerator because the one she uses now does not belong to her but to the different houses that distribute such products as Coca-Cola and Pepsi to her. Her intentions include obtaining household products for her home by saving the little she earns.

The business she dedicates herself to is the sale of poultry, as well as juices, sodas, and beer. She has been in business for four years, having started by her own motivation as she has always liked to work independently and find her own way to survie. She started with poultry sales which generates income, and then decided to start another venture with the sale of sodas, juices and beer as these are in high demand in her hometown of León. Her reason for requesting a loan is for working capital to stay active in her business, as she needs to increase the quantity of Coca-Cola and Pepsi products she stocks to satisfy the different tastes of her customer base. She turns to this financing by way of the Fundación León 2000 which has provided her with loan assistance.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Adjovi Apéafa

texts.fr:
Madame D. Adjovi Apéafa est née le 15 juin 1987 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Cette jeune fille qui a vingt-et-un ans est très motivée et elle a sa propre entreprise à ce jeune âge.  Elle est célibataire, et elle n’a pas d’enfant.  Elle a pour l’activité le vente des produits d’alimentation et n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’achète 10 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de macaroni, et 6 cartons de tomates.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année.
texts.en:
Miss Adjovi Apéafa D. was born on June 15, 1987 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This young woman, 21, is very motivated and she has her own business at this young age. She is single and she has no children. Her business is selling foodstuffs and she has never had a loan from WAGES.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 10 sacks of rice, 10 jerry cans of oil, 10 cases of macaroni, and 6 cases of tomato paste. With this new stock, she will be able to make a lot of sales and serve her customers during the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. and her husband, Mr. Si Nob, both 38, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have three children: one son who attends school and two young daughters.

Samnang has been selling vegetables for three years, buying them from Kean Svay for resale at Chbar Ampov market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a military policeman. Samnang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. sells tailoring materials like thread, needles and landings. She has been in this business for a long time. Now, Juliana needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She would like to grow her bsuiness.

Juliana is 44 years old. She is married with 5 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Merit

texts.en:
Merit A. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Merit was diagnosed with HIV several years ago. For a time she was sick at home, but when she began to feel better she talked with her friends about how to live with HIV. Her friends recommended that she start a business so that she could keep busy and be active. In 2005 Merit began a business selling chips (french fries) in the Nyalenda neighborhood of Kisumu.

Merit chose chips because her parents used to have a similar business and she grew up knowing how to cook and sell chips profitably. Merit purchases about 10 kilograms of potatoes from the Kibuye Market in Kisumu weekly. On a busy day she can sell about half her stock.

Because she has this business, Merit is able to provide for herself and to eat what she wants. She says she doesn’t need to rely on anyone else.

Merit has applied for her first loan from K-MET, of approximately $275. She plans to use this money towards purchasing a machine to fry the chips. If she has a machine, the chips will cook faster and then Merit will not lose customers to long waiting times. Merit would also like to purchase a fridge so that she can sell cold soda with the chips.

loans.use: To purchase a fryer

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Fati tells us her two youngest children are currently in school and the rest are married and live independently with their spouses. Fati lives with her husband and their two younger children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi, a gold-mining town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai engage in commercial activities.

Fati trades in fresh yam to earn some income to support her husband and cater for the family. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Ejura in the Brong Ahafo region, where prices are more economical. She then distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for eight years.

Fati wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to support her husband so that they can improve upon their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past five years.

Riwind city is famous for its shrine places. Parveen husband runs a grocery shop. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: Buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta S., 62, is married with 2 children. She lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, and started her snack vending business from capital of just PHP3,000. Her husband, who is a pensioner, is very supportive of her business.

The small business has been doing so well that she is confident to expand. She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to receive loans. She is applying for PHP 8,000 to buy food for her snack vending. She envisions acquiring a stall in the public market. She also dreams of renovating the family's little house. Mrs S. in on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Buy additional food for snack vending

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Sofia es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Sofia junto a su esposo tienen carros con los cuales realizan transporte publico a diferentes distritos de la provincia, su esposo conduce uno de los carros.
Sofia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos para carros.
Los sueños de Sofia son comprar otro carro y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sofia is a partner of the Villa Hatatas community bank. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Sofia and her husband own cars, which they use for their public transportation business. Her husband drives one of the cars. Sofia needs a loan of 900 soles which she'll invest in car tires. She dreams of buying another car and helping her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sofia needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in car tires.

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es: Martha Alejandra S. es un señora que esta al tanto de la educación que se le da a sus hijos, Ella cree que al ponerlos en una escuela particular aprenderán mas y a parte aprenderá una lengua extrajera. Su hijo esta en preescolar pero esta requiriendo el pago para la colegiatura de este mes. Ella trabaja en una guardería  de cocinera y su esposo a la venta de automóviles.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is a woman that is attentive of the education that she gives to her children. She thinks that by putting them in a particular school they will learn more, in addition to learning a foreign language. Her son is in pre-school, but she requires the payment for school fees this month. She works in a nursery kitchen, and her husband sells cars.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Исломкулова Матлуба  занимаетс откормом скота.Матлуба сама швея, дома шьет национальные платья.  Ее муж находиться в России на заработки. В данный момент она одна содержит семью.  Первый кредит получила в 2007 году. На кредит она приобрела 2 овцы и корм для них. В этом году за счет продажи коров она провела капитальный ремонт. За это она благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Matluba I. breeds cattle. Matluba is also a seamstress and makes national dresses at home. Her husband works in Russia. At this time she supports the family. She received her first loan in 2007 and used the loan to buy two sheep and fodder for them. This year she sold cows and it allowed her to make a complete renovation in her home. She is very thankful to Kiva for this.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Fealofani

texts.en:
M. Fealofani, 30, is married with two children. She has four years of experience in her taxi business. She provides transportation to the general public seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are M.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and pay for taxi registration

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina, a 38-year-old trader, is married and the mother of four children, all in school, the eldest attending university.  Georgina has been selling onions, rice, tinned tomatoes, pepper, etc. at the local market for 22 years, a business that has enabled her to support her children’s education.  For some time now, however, she has been facing challenges in her business due to inadequate funds and is therefore requesting a loan to enable her to buy increased stocks of tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, onions, and pepper in order to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to better support the children’s education to give them a future filled with hope. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, onions, tinned tomatoes, pepper and other spices, etc.

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en: Mrs Sithon S. lives in Smorn Pream village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom works at a garment factory while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. Mrs Sithon S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr Kol Saroeun, is a policeman in the local district. Since his workplace is far from the house, he has to pay for a motor taxi to get to and from work. Now Mrs Sithon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa D. D. H. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa tiene 29 años D. edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja para el servicio militar y también con sus hijos  Wilber D. 8 años edad y Stefany D. 3 años D. edad. Rosa se dedica  a su negocio desD. su casa, venD. variedad D. productos como ropa y  perfumes, Rosa solicita un crédito ya que desea aumentar su inventario en sus productos,  lo que ayudara a mantener un equilibrio con mercedaria que tiene 50% por cobrar y desequilibra su liquidez económica.
texts.en:
Rosa D. D. H. lives in the district of La Libertad. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, Wilber (age 8) and Stefany (age 3). Her husband works for the military service. Rosa operates a business from home, selling a variety of products such as clothing and perfumes. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of products. This will help her maintain a balance of 50% merchandise on hand that her customers have already paid for with the other half being items that her customers requested on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Remember #2 Group

texts.en:
Remember #2 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Sambah K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Sambah is 35 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 2 and 7.  Her oldest child is in 1st grade. Sambah was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu City in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Sambah’s runs a cookshop, a fast-food roadside café for workers in the fields and other general laborers. She has run her business for 2 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic – she stays open long hours for them – and the way she prepares the food. She’s taking a loan to increase her food stores of rice, oil, mapo, and soup to meet the demand of the growing economy. Her dream is to expand her business so she can one day have a real restaurant in town. With the profits from her business, Sambah dreams of sending her kids to college.

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, mapo and soup

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 and married with six children.  Three of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Margaret works seven days a week.  Margaret owns shop selling second hand clothes in Margaret. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping Margaret doesn’t pay rent for her business premises as she works from her home.  She sells to all people on both retail and whole sale and besides selling second hand clothes she does tailoring when need arises Margaret has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothing and materials for tailoring. Margaret  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: To buy more used clothing and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites A. is from the town of Northern Pob. Calamba Mis.Occ.. She is 40 years old. Marites is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marites is just starting this business.In 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Capital for her  proposed  project

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 41 years old. Josephine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 1,700 PHP for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mrs. Rin S. lives in Trapeang Pring village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Heng Mao, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from home and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, Mrs. Rin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio césar M. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ilopango junto su esposa, su hijo y tres sobrinos todos menores de edad. El posee una tienda en su propia casa, así mismo realiza viajes para otras personas ya que posee un pick up y así mismo vende gas propano. Julio solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su tienda con productos como pollo, pan, lácteos, entre otros más. Julio césar es una persona con muy buenas referencias de sus vecinos, el cual se destaca por tratar de diferentes maneras de  brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio César M. A. is 41 years old and lives in Ilopango with his wife, son, and three young nephews. He runs a small shop out of his house, works as a driver for other people because he owns a pick up, and sells propane gas. Julio applied for the loan to be able to offer more products for his store like chicken, bread, and dairy products among others. Julio César has good references from his neighbors who note the many different ways he tries to improve his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Jesus Is Real Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Jesus is Real' Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding and clothing them,  and in their academic pursuits. 

Teresa K. on the left is the leader of this group. She is forty-four years of age, born in the southern city of Bo. She is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier and two of her children are in college, two in secondary school, and two are already adults. Teresa is a businesswoman who sells fish and meat. She has been a businesswoman for almost ten years now. With her share of the loan, Teresa will buy more cartons of fish and meat to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy cartons of fish and cartons of meat to sell

loans.name: Akouavi Rita

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Rita est née en 1968 à Comè, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Akouavi Rita s’est installée à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, il y a environs neuf ans. Mariée à ANATO Médard, un agent permanent de l’Etat, Akouavi Rita est mère de sept enfants, dont cinq sont à sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Lokokoukoumè. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouavi Rita n’a pas été à l’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Akouavi Rita vend des divers (farine de manioc, sucre, lait, conserves, savons, pâtes alimentaires, sardines, fil à coudre, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Akouavi Rita s’approvisionne. Akouavi Rita a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Akouavi Rita sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Akouavi Rita A. was born in 1968 in Comè, in the Mono department of Benin. About nine years ago, Akouavi Rita settled in the Lokokoukoumè area of Sèmè-Podji. She is married to Médard ANATO, a government agent, and mother of seven children, five of whom are still under her care. Only some of the children are educated. The family lives together in Lokokoukoumè, and the couple share household expenses. Akouavi Rita has not been to school. To help her husband meet household expenses, Akouavi Rita sells various goods from her home (manioc flour, sugar, milk, canned food, soap, pasta, sardines, sewing thread, etc.). She gets her supplies from the international market of Benin, Dantokpa. Akouavi Rita has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé, that were both repaid in full. She now requests a third loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her capital base and increase her level of activity to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of sugar, milk, canned food and soap

loans.name: Fiaaveifo

texts.en:
Fiaaveifo L. is 39 and married with 7 children (ages 1 - 16 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Fiaaveifo has many years of experience in this business.  Fiaaveifo needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 160 tala or US $67 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Fiaaveifo joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiaaveifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiaaveifo L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.9 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 59 years old and lives in the 3rd class municipality of Morong, an attractive province of Rizal. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are legal age and college students. She is married to Jaime S., a 63-year-old electrician and a loving husband.

In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.) a microfinance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. Marieta makes and sells peanut butter and coco jam (sweet delicacies). She has been in business for more than five years. She has learned this kind of business through business training and seminars she attended. Her products are display and available at INSOL (and NGO partner of ASHI that provides business development training to entrepreneurs) enterprise center. Sometimes her products are also available at INSOL trade fair booths in shopping malls.

Marieta believes this loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loans funds to expand her business of peanut butter and coco jam making.

Marieta dreams of having a stall for her growing business. She wants her children to finish their studies and live in comfortable house.

loans.use: Additional working capital for a peanut butter and coco jam making business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 14 years old. She is happy because her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. Mabel is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells electronics like microwave ovens  and electrical kettles in her shop. With over 19 years experience in sales, she has been able to attract and retain more customers to her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  Mabel says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, age 30, owns a one-hectare rice field. She also maintains another eight hectares from which she also earns extra income. Together with her husband, she spends the whole day tilling the farm and making sure it is free of weeds and pests to ensure that their rice crop grows healthily. She said that she works hard for her three children. She wants them to have a proper education and a bright future. She was also able to start a small store, which she hopes will grow soon.

Mary Jean is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies. She is also hoping to add supplies to her store.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian P., 51, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Filomeno P., a driver, she is blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Vivian has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her current product inventory.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas al crédito por la zona de Pampahasi lleva tres años con esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona y los pedidos que tiene son joyas artesanales para señoras de pollera ya que ellas utilizan joyas grandes para su sombrero, el topo para la manta, los anillos y los aretes grandes, tiene unos juegos de joyas completas que son muy bonitos y caros todos bañados en oro, ellos compran hechos y despues los venden en su joyeria, también Es casada, su esposo tiene su movilidad y trabaja como taxi, tiene tres hijos que están en  el colegio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de anillos y aretes, ya que tienen estos pedidos para una fiesta que se lleva cada año por la zona de Pampahasi estas joyas las usan el generalmente para las danzas de la morenada La Morenada o Danza de los Morenos es una danza Folkclorica Boliviana donde los bailarines se disfrazan como negros enmascarados con rasgos prominentes y las cholitas usan estas joyas para adornar sus sonbreros y para sujetar sus mantas, La Sra Teresa esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry on credit in the zone of Pampahasi. She has performed this activity for three years. She is very well known in the area and the orders that she fills are for craft jewelry for ladies who wear the traditional clothing, since they use large jewels for their hats, the fastening on their cloaks, rings and large earrings. She has some complete sets of jewels that are very pretty and expensive, all bathed in gold. She buys the jewels and later sellsthem in her jewelry shop. She is also married. Her husband has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver. She has three children that attend school. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rings and earrings, since she has orders for a festival that is held each year in the zone of Pampahasi. The jewels are used traditionally for the dances of the Morenada or Dances of the Dark, which is a folkloric Bolivian dance where the dancers disguise themselves in black adorned with prominent characteristics and the celebrants use these jewels for adorning their hats and to fasten their cloaks. Señora Teresa this very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewels, rings and earrings for resale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Antonio es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycui, vive en el Bº Santa Rosa de la misma ciudad, empezó en el negocio de la zapatería desde el año 1999.
         Con el correr de los años la producción de su negocio no fue del nada bueno, por esa razón sus hijos tuvieron que emigrar a otro pais con el fin de enviar ayuda económica, después de un tiempo pudo acceder a comprar una vaca lechera con la cual empezó a vender leche a vecinos, después compró otra vaca hasta que llegó a 5, la cantidad de vacunos con los que cuenta ahora gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y con eso ya le provee de leche a todo el barrio donde vive.
         Al mismo tiempo trabajaba con su zapatería y con el correr del tiempo empezó a producir más, solicitó un préstamo a nuestra institución, para compra de materiales para la confección de calzados para estudiantes ya que en estas fechas es la temporada en la que más salida tiene ésta mercadería.
         Agradece a La Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA por su apoyo y por seguir confiando en él.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio is from the city of Ybycui, where he lives in Bº Santa Rosa. He started his shoe business in 1999. Over the years, the productivity of his business was not going well, so his children had to emigrate to another country, with the goal of sending money back. After some time, he agreed to buy a dairy cow, and he began to sell milk to his neighbors. Later, he bought another cow; he now has five cows, thanks to the help of his children. With these cows, he is able to provide milk to his entire neighborhood. At the same time, he continued to work in his shoe store, and with time, he began to produce more. He is requesting a loan from our institution to buy materials to make footwear for students, since this type of merchandise sells well at this time of the year. He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support and for their continued confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and accessories to make shoes

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou S., né en 1966, est plombier de métier depuis 28 ans. Avec la rareté des marchés de plomberie, il s'est lancé dans le commerce avec l'aide de ses 2 femmes pour augmenter ses revenues.Il a commencé cette activité en 2005 et vend particulièrement de l'huile de palme, arachide, ...etc. Il va très souvent à la rencontre de ses clients pour les placer les marchandises tandis qu'une de ses femmes se charge de la vente à la maison. Cependant, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour renforcer cette activité secondaire qu'il gére avec ses femmes.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou S., born in 1966, has been a plumber by trade for 28 years.  With the low demand for plumbing, he got started in commerce with the help of his two wives in order to increase his income.  He started this business in 2005 and sells in particular palm oil, peanuts, etc.  He often goes to meet customers to deliver merchandise, while one of his wives is responsible for making sales at the house.  However, Amadou is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for bolstering this secondary business that he runs with his wives.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for resale

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 46 años, es natural de Ollantaytambo y tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, su principal actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ya son 17 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Gumercinda es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para construir su casa y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo bloquetas de construcción y cemento. El anhelo de la socia es abrir un hotel en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Gumercinda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gumercinda belongs to the communal bank “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” of the Arariwa Association. She is 46 years old, a native of Ollantaytambo and has five children. Currently her main economic activity is raising small animals such as hens and guinea pigs. She has been in the business for 17 years and it is going very well for her. Gumercinda is a very hard-working person and an entreprenuer who looks for opportunities at every moment to get ahead. And with her daily efforts she gets on in life. She needs the loan to build her house. She is going to buy materials like, for example, cinder blocks and cement. Her desire is to open a hotel in the city of Ollantaytambo. Gumercinda is grateful for the opportunity she’s been given through this group and at the same time she promises to make the corresponding payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gumercinda needs the loan to build her house.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is a Cambodian laborer who has been working in the local garment industry, located in the middle of Phnom Penh, for more than eight years. Her husband helps her support their family by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. She is 40 years old and has given birth to four children. Two of the children are now married and sell fish, for their occupation. The other two children attend school or go to work. This is the second cycle of loan that she has requested. Him S. will use this loan to add to her savings in order to purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 33 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 5 years old.  Jean Baptiste is commonly known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and he has been in this business for about 2 years.  The hours of his business are from 6 am until 7 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste has realized that he is not presently able to satisfy the demand of his customers, so he wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jean Baptiste will purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes and he really hopes that the demand of his customers will totally be met.  Once this demand is totally met, Jean Baptiste will hopefully earn a lot of profit, more than previously, and this profit will be used for a further reinvestment in his business as well as saving for a better future.

loans.use: A large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Marlene R. C. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser ropa y zapatos, lociones.
tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Asi mismo los fines de semana elabora Nacatamales ya que tiene muchos clientes y se los encargan porque son muy ricos, esta casada y junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el credito lo utilzara para
comprar mercaderia varias y poder salir a vender a comunidades cercanas. Doña Gloria es una mujer 
muy activa y disfruta mucho lo que hace.
texts.en:
Gloria Marlene R. C. dedicates herself to selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and lotions. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for six years. Likewise, on weekends, she makes nacatamales (steamed corncakes). She has a number of customers who demand her food because it is so delicious. She is married and, together with her husband, has managed to help her family get ahead. She will use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise, and then travel throughout the neighboring communities to sell her goods. Gloria is an active woman, who very much enjoys what she does.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with six children and all of them are at school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a restaurant selling all types of food like traditional and western food.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, Irish potatoes, beef, sweet potatoes and cooking oil. She buys these foodstuffs from Ndeeba market and incurs some little transport costs to and from the market. Besides this food business, she also owns rental rooms, which gives her additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years. She sells to all categories of people, both on a retail and wholesale basis. She works six days a week. 

She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and cooking oil

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, menores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella vende calzado, perfumes, tratamientos y ropa. Ella ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido a los pocos ingresos que tenia decide dedicarse a este negocio. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Carolina is 46 years old and a single mother of 3 children, all minors. She sells merchandise in general, footwear, perfumes, beauty treatments and clothing. She has been in this business for 2 years and started because she had very low income. She would like this loan in order to purchase a variety of products and would like to sell more so she can earn more. Furthermore, the products are becoming more expensive every day and this has become a challenge for her because the country´s economic situation is becoming more difficult every day. She hopes to keep her business going and to always try to have her children study and prepare themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Nop Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people, who live in Tuol Trea village in TaK. province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. K. N., born in 1964, was selected by the group loan members to be the village bank president. Each group member will use their portion of the loan to support their businesses.

She and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Net, are farmers who own one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family's living, and he is a fisherman. Her problem is that her husband does not have enough fishing nets to use. So to improve this condition, Mrs. K. N. is seeking a loan to buy fishing nets and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer and hire farming laborers to grow rice. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending school and helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She is a divorcee. Valentina raises two children– a 19-year-old son Dmitryi and a 7-year-old daughter Elvira. With two children to care for, she works really hard to make ends meet. Valentina launched her knitted wear sales business 17 years ago. To date, she has already invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in this trade. Her turnover capital amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. Monthly net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas. 

Valentina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan. She is hoping to use it as an investment in her working capital. Valentina is planning to increase her supply of assorted knitted wear merchandise for women, thus attracting more potential customers to her kiosk this fall season.

loans.use: To increase supply of knitted wear merchandise for sale

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells chicken porridge, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 80 on food, UDS 20 on children education, and USD 15 on electricity supply every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy construction supplements.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casado con Eleazar, de 44 años, ambos tienen 7 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño cuarto que acondicionó en su hogar, y por las noches vende hamburguesas; de esta manera este oficio le resulta muy rentable y puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica Nery, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ya cuando creció y consolidó su familia, pudo adquirir terrenos en donde cultiva habas, arveja y espinaca; con el tiempo y la experiencia que tiene, logro adecuarse bien al mercado y alquiló más terrenos de cultivo, con ello puede sembrar en grandes cantidades, por ende obtiene mejores ganancias. Ahora ella quiere comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo; como también abrir su propio restaurante. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde reina la unión y solidaridad. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará fertilizantes para su cultivo de habas, ya que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en: Nery, who is 41, is a hard-working woman. She is married to Eleazar who is 44 and they both have seven children. They live in a rented house located in Unión Leticia. Every morning, starting very early, she is dedicated to selling food in a small room in her house. And at night, she sells hamburgers. In this way, this job has become very profitable and she is able to pay the bills. But she is not only dedicated to this work. At a young age, Nery learned to farm and when she grew up and consolidated her family she was able to acquire land where she cultivates beans, peas and spinach. With time and the experience that she has, she was able to adapt to the market and rent more farmland. With this, she was able to plant in great quantities and obtain better earnings. Now, she wishes to buy her own farmland and open her own restaurant. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to belong to her community bank where unity and solidarity reigns. With this loan, she will obtain fertilizers for her bean crops since she will harvest them very soon.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para cuidar su cultivo de habas.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 41 years old. He is married with two children ages, six and 12, who both attend school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces coffee, tea and milk, which he sells through cooperative societies. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

Patrick has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The increased income from the sale of milk will help improve the living standards of his family. His major challenge has been the fluctuation in market prices for his products. He plans to increase the number of his dairy cows, which will increase his milk productivity in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Biyabu

texts.en:
Biyabu is a single woman with one girl who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She operates a  Leso (Kikoi's) selling business from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In additional she owns a rental house that contributes to her other source of income. Biyabu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and build more rental houses in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bags of cement and timber to expand her rental houses and pay for the installation of electricity in her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement and timber to expand her rental houses and pay for the installation of electricity in her rental houses.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman with one child who has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For more than 14 years, she has operated a secondhand clothing sales business, selling at the market to town residents, neighbors and passersby. Aziza faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting clothes to the marketplace. She hopes to establish a boutique in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes.

loans.use: To  purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Bev

texts.en:
Mr. Bev M. (in the photo), 58, is a widower with two sons. Both are garment factory workers.  

Bev is a motor taxi driver. His sons do not have transportation to get to work, so they very often spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Bev is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for his sons.  

The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his sons to get to work.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 69 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio inicio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingreso necesaria para mantener a sus 3 hijos que desde muy pequeños se ha hecho cargo de ellos. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de tener su negocio y atender a sus clientes que siempre llegan en busca de diferentes productos. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos entre otras cosas que son necesarias.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 69, has a grocery store.  She’s had it for over 14 years.  She started it because she needed a source of income to support her three children whom she’s cared for since they were very little.  She has been in business taking care of her customers who always come by looking for various products for a long time.

The reason for the loan is to buy raw materials like: sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains among other necessary things.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty years old, married to a businessman, and has two children living in her own house in Kamwenge Uganda. She aspires to educate her children through university level. She has been trading in produce for four years and the business is very profitable, even amidst the challenge of price fluctuation. Agnes needs the loan to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow; she lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she recovered her senses and started working at people's homes to survive financially. 

Now all three of her sons do different work, so Munawar has stopped working. She now stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her two eldest sons are electricians by profession and have a workshop in the market, where they repair refrigerators and other electronic items. Her youngest son sells clothes. He makes bulk purchases from Multan and Faisalabad and sells in his local city. They all contribute to their family financially through their earnings.  

Munawar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons, who want to improve their electronics-repair business. With the loan, they will purchase the latest repairing tools, which will help them do their business better and offer quality services to their clients. 

They have been operating this business for the past six years and Munawar is confident that an investment will improve their business and increase their income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book called Asasah Passbook is Munawar.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for an electronics-repairing business

loans.name: Lennin Anselmo

texts.es:
LENNIN ANSELMO R. M. TIENE DOS AÑOS DE TRABAJAR COMO CAJERO, ES SOLTERO SIN HIJOS ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD POR LA NOCHE Y TRABAJA POR EL DIA.
EL ACUDE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR SU PRIMER FINANCIAMIENTO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUUCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO Y ZINC PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN CUARTO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
Lennin Anselmo R. M. has worked as a Cashier for two years.  He’s single and has no children.  He is currently studying at the University at night and works during the day.

He is calling upon Ceprodel to request his first loan to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, iron rods and zinc metal sheeting to build a room at his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad del Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Olga trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud en el área administrativa, ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña botica. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Olga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar medicamentos.  

Olga pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Olga is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Olga works for the Ministry of Health in the area of administration. She tells us that she has a small pharmacy. She has been in this business for 10 years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Right now, Olga needs the loan to buy medicines.

Olga belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank within Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided with the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Jairo
