texts.en: Jairo S. Osanois 41 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been operating a cafeteria for four years.  He was previously running a barber shop.   He has employed two people to help him in his business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money, which has helped him to improve his business.  He hopes to open a big hotel in the future.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida tiene 42 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco, Perú. La socia Brigida es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la comunidad donde nació y su actividad económica de Brigida es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, chanchos, gallinas y cuyes. En esta oportunidad Brigida requiere el préstamo para comprar animales como por ejemplo cuyes.  
      
Brigida pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco y se encuentra muy contenta por los servicios que le ofrece la Asociación.
texts.en:
Brigida is 42 years old, and she was born in the community of Yanahuara, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Brigida is married with three children, and she currently lives in the community where she was born. She raises small livestock animals, such as sheep, pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs, for a living. Brigida hopes to use this loan to buy animals, particularly guinea pigs (a traditional food source in the Peruvian Andes).
      
Brigida belongs to the "Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen" community bank, part of the Cusco Arariwa Association, and she is very pleased with the services offered by the association.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mastura's Group

texts.en:
Mastura Z., 62, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the town Kadamjai, known for its stibium plant, exporting its goods to all parts of the country and to neighboring nations. Mastura’s husband works in that plant, while she has been breeding and reselling livestock animals for forty-one years now. 

Her kids are grown and live independently, so she devotes her entire time to promoting her business. The initial capital was only 500 soms, but Mastura believes that the main reason for success in business is commitment and full devotion. Her secret formula of success has worked out well and now her business brings 3 000 soms monthly. The purpose of Mastura’s loan is the purchase of five sheep. As the leader of the group, Mastura promises to control and motivate the entire group to work hard for the sake of family prosperity and successful repayment of the loan.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enhtuvshin is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own house in Dornod province, Mongolia. His older daughter is a student while his younger one helps with the family business. He manages a good trading business at a border city of Mongolia. Before his business operation he used to work as a driver in his younger brother's company for 10 years. He started a motorcycle trading business three years ago and gained much experience. Also, he sells grocery products such is a rice, flour, etc. 

Even within this short period of time, he has managed to build a strong customer base and a good relationship with his suppliers. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a serious man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT of loan to purchase more products and to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more products for resale.

loans.name: Vinanua

texts.en:
Vinanua is from the village of San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Vinanua runs a rice retail business.

She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Vinanua joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Vinanua is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 40 años, es una mujer luchadora y honesta, que tiene 3 hijos, los dos mayores son de su primer compromiso y laboran de manera independiente, mientras el último hijo es de su pareja Jeremías con quien convive desde hace 3 años en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Alto Yapas. Las horas que emplea en la agricultura, junto a su esposo, se ve recompensado cuando comercializa los productos oriundos de la zona. Donde siembra café, frutas cítricas y plátanos, en sus terrenos propios, desde hace 3 años. En temporadas de cosecha, ella recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes le paga por día 20 soles, lo que más le gusta de su labor es retirar la maleza de sus tierras, para que cada fruto se desarrolle libremente; sin embargo le incomoda tener que trasladar sus cosechas hacía su localidad para encajonarlo y embarcarlo a los mercados de “Lima” y “Huancayo“. Por ello hace poco comenzó a entregar el grano de café a una cooperativa que se encarga de exportarlos a otros países. Como su oficio es rentable, quiere adquirir más terrenos productivos y plantar más cantidad de frutos. De igual manera, acondicionó una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Pero según menciona le falta mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, por ello está ahorrando cada vez más, y de esa manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está feliz de continuar perteneciendo a este grupo, porque es unido. Delia, comenzó su cosecha de café, con la primera fase que es la extracción de los primeros granos maduros de café, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos para que se nivele el proceso de maduración.
texts.en: Delia is 40 and a hardworking and honest woman.  She has 3 children, the two oldest work independently and the youngest is the last child of her companion of 3 years, Jeremías; they live together in Alto Yapas. The time she spends working with her husband in agriculture are profitable at harvest time; they grow coffee, citrus fruit and plantains on their own land, and have done so for the last 3 years. Her children help her bring in the harvest, and she pays them 20 soles per day.  She enjoys clearing the cropland and weeding, allowing the fruit crops to develop.  She finds it difficult to transport the harvest, package it and get it to markets in cities such as Lima and Huancayo. Delia has now begun selling coffee beans to an export company, and now plans to acquire more land to put into coffee cultivation. She has also established a small general store in her house, and hopes to improve its conditions in the future. Delia is a member of the communal lender “Los progresistas”, and this loan will be her third with MFP, so she is familiar with the group's credit terms. Delia will use this credit to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crop, to increase quality and production.

loans.use: to buy organic crop fertilizer

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero vive con parientes tiene 6 hijos todos son casado, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y en pocas cantidades siembra tomate de árbol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y de tomate, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta festejar todas las fiestas del año.
texts.en:
Manuel is 61 years old, single and living with relatives.  He has six married children.  They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.

The “Unión y Esperanza” (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office.  The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.

Manuel farms corn and small amounts of tree tomatoes.  He’s been in this occupation for a long time.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

He is asking for a loan to buy corn and tomato seeds.  The loan has helped him increase income and production.  He has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops.  His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys celebrating all the annual festivals.

loans.use: to buy corn and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Luzminda has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income by running a sari-sari (variety) store and raising pigs.

Luzminda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to buy more farm land .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 37 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been in farming for over ten years, producing maize, tea and tomatoes, which are all sold locally. He employs two farmhands.  He also operates a retail shop to subsidize his farming.

Job has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the loan will help uplift his family's living standards. He is planning to get another loan after full repayment of the first one and buy more cows.

Job says lack of capital and crop diseases are the challenges to farming.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has five children. She is married to a farmer. For the past 11 years, Elizabeth has lived in Elmina. She sells ladies underwear and uses her income to support her family and help pay school fees and utility bills. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy ladies underwear to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy ladies underwear to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a mixed farm in his hometown in eastern Kenya that produces milk, potatoes, maize and French beans. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now, selling all his farm produce at the local market. He employs one farmhand. He also depends on his pension pay to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges in farming have been insufficient water for irrigation and pests and diseases that affect his production.

Joseph has made a loan request of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate french beans and cowpeas. He says that the income that will be generated from this project will enable him start a small grocery shop. He intends to acquire at least five dairy cows and an acre of land to expand his horticultural farming in the next five years. 

Joseph is 67 and a married father of four children who are all adults.

loans.use: To cultivate french beans and cow peas.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with nine children.
 
Nilda has a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables like melons & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy squash & melons to sell.

Nilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy squash & melons to sell

loans.name: Chanthouen

texts.en: 27 year old Chanthouen sells vegetables with her husband and makes $5 per day. She has two children, aged 1 and 2 years. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to raise and then sell. This loan will help her family to have another income besides selling vegetables, and will enable them to save money for sending her children to school when they are ready.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista has practiced farming for the last eight years. She is 32 years old and the single mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. Tomasa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old, married and has one child. The family lives in the peaceful village of San Jose, Baggao, Cagayan. To make a living, she operates a general store selling farm supplies in the nearby public market. She had been in this business for almost a year. The daily net profit of PHP 500 goes to their daily needs at home such as meals and the allowance of her child.

She has insufficient funds, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, vitamins, fertilizers and seeds to sell in her store. This will help increase the capacity of sales from her business.

She hopes to earn more income and improve her daily sales to boost her profits for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, vitamins, fertilizers and seeds to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, she has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. Nora’s general store is a great help to her family and helps sustain their day-to-day needs. 

Nora is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more products to sell. In the future, she plans to be more progressive with the help of GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abd Al Kareem

texts.en:
Abd A. Kareem, a hardworking, independent, 57-year-old man, has three daughters and two sons. 

He is a well-known person in A. Karak where he lives because he is running more than one business; one of them is an aluminum accessories workshop where they make and sell aluminum window frames and other stuff. 

This workshop has been successfully running for almost four years. Now Abd A. Kareem has applied for this loan in order to buy more aluminum materiA. and also improve the workshop decorations.

loans.use: to buy more aluminum material and also improve the workshop decoration

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, who is married and blessed with two children, lives in Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela, where he has operated his corn farm business for 10 years. His wife manages their hog-raising business for additional income. He is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for his farm.

In the future, Robert is hoping to grow his business for the betterment of their daily living. He believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and strength of mind.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for his corn farm.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: La señora María es cliente nueva de la institución ella es de nacionalidad Chilena pero esta radicando en Bolivia desde hace diez años  ella tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando a los cuales los esta haciendo educar sola ya que esta separada de su esposo,  la Sra.  María se dedica  ala venta de ropa la cual trae de chile cada dos meses ella esta viviendo en la zona de Irpavi II en una casa en alquiler esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año para traer ropa de temporada ella la comercializa entre sus amigas y mamas del colegio de sus hijos, es una persona muy amable y dinámica, se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Señora María is a new client for the institution.  She is a Chilean national, but has been living in Bolivia for the last ten years.  She has three children who attend school.  She is ensuring their education on her own, as she is separated from her husband.

Señora María works selling clothes that she brings over from Chile every other month.  She lives in the Irpavi area in a rented home.  She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise for the year-end festivals, so that she can get seasonal clothing.  She sells to her friends and to the moms of her children's school-friends.

She is a very friendly and dynamic woman, who is grateful for the trust being given to her through provision of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Orbany

texts.es: El señor Orbany a sus 39 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, se dedica a la soldadura, plomería y arreglos eléctricos en fincas y casas, el cual alterna con la atención de una legumbreria. El señor Orbany aprendió este oficio por medio de un hermano.  El señor Orbany necesita comprar un compresor que le permita realizar con mayor facilidad su trabajo con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El sueño del señor Orbany es tener su propio taller de soldadura, plomería y generar con este empleos directos y mejores ingresos para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Orbany is 39 years old, and is the father of two children aged 9 and 4.  He works doing soldering, plumbing and electrical repairs in farms and homes, which he does in addition to selling vegetables.

Señor Orbany learned his trade from his brother. Señor Orbany needs to purchase a compressor which will allow him to undertake his work with greater ease, with the end goal of providing better service to his customers.  

Señor Orbany's dream is to have is own soldering and plumbing workshop.  With this he would be able to take on jobs directly and earn better income to provide his family with a better quality of life..

loans.use: to purchase a work tool (a compressor)

loans.name: Shida B Group

texts.en:
Bamanasi is the facilitator of the Shida B group. Bamanasi and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bamanasi and his group during Kenya’s next planting seas on in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Bamanasi takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bamanasi had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bamanasi was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Bamanasi will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Shida B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Bamanasi with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 60 years old and earns a living through farming. Beatriz tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Beatriz works hard to improve her income in order to support her family financially. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. She plans to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is 49 years old married woman, a mother of 5 children. she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.
Kefah is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can improve her house living conditions, fix it and buy some new furniture.

loans.use: to fix her home and buy new furniture

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Paul, Sabine est âgée de 24 ans. Sabine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Sabine vit avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Sabine vend des chaussures depuis six ans. Afin de renforcer son activité, Sabine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  María Ines, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  
La socia tiene 41 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades  diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, sopas, saltados entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
L a socia María Ines está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María Ines belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders) which is in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old, single, and has three children. María Ines divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business. She has been in this line of work for quite some time and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business. María Ines prepares different types of dishes such as chicken with rice, soups, stir-fried meats, and other foods. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

María Ines is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, rice, and other items. She is very appreciative of Kiva for allowing her to continue her business since it represents her main source of income for sustaining her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.en:
The 7 women of “Milagro de Dios”, or “Miracle of God” trust bank, live in the Nuevo Amanecer community, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala, a region in the west coast where there are many industrial farms and factories, the hot climate and flat land of the area perfect for mass production of fruit, coffee, and much more. 

Evelyn is an exceptional woman, forging a beautiful reality for herself and her 2 daughters of 7 and 5 years old who are studying in local schools, despite the death of her young husband, 5 years ago. With 25 years of age, and her 4th grade education, this working mother has much responsibility, providing a good life for her daughters. Evelyn runs a business buying and selling dairy products such as cheese and cream, travelling to the factory where she buys her products and delivering them to her clients locally, an in two different towns, neighboring municipality, and far from her home, in Guatemala City each week. She also works with her sister procuring and selling firewood when she isn’t selling cheese. Evelyn plans to use her first loan to buy her products, cheese, cream, and firewood for resale. 


The ages of these ladies range between 21 and 45 years old, and the majority of them earned a 4th grade education before they began working with their family in and outside of their homes. They live in united homes, working together with their spouses to provide education and quality of life to their children and running their various busness, selling tortillas, firewood, snacks, dairy products, vegetables, and animals they raise themselves. 

The members of “Milagro de Dios” continue forward day-to-day, carving paths for themselves and their families that are full of hope.

loans.use: To buy her products, cheese, cream, and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Fouadi

texts.en: Fouadi is a 23-year-old, Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband who represents the main source income. As for her, she is still attending university and doesn’t work. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allowed her to continue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane intends to invest the USD 300 into her business and use it to buy paint. There ready market hence she will be able to pay her loan with ease.

loans.name: Afua Etonam

texts.en:
Ms. Afua Etonam T. is a married mother of four children. Her husband's business of raising chickens is not very profitable, so Ms. T. has begun selling smoked fish in order to meet her family's needs. She is a very devoted and energetic woman when it comes to her business. She is calm and always welcoming and has been able to earn the trust of everyone in her town. Ms. T.'s supply can no longer meet the demand of the market. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of $700 to build a second oven, buy a larger supply of fish and increase her production of smoked fish. This will increase her income and also her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Afua Etonam est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est l’élevage des poules ordinaires, ce qui n’est pas très rentable. Pour cela, Madame T. se lance dans la vente des poissons fumés pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est une femme très dévouée et dynamique dans les activités commerciales. Calme et toujours accueillante, elle arrive à gagner la confiance de tous les habitants de sa localité. L’offre de Madame T. n’arrive plus à couvrir la demande du marché. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour la fabrication d’un second four, s’approvisionner plus en poisson et augmenter sa production en poisson fumé. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire en vue du bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To build a second oven and to buy, smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa sells hats, shoes and clothes to adolescents in her neighborhood. She has three of her own, two girls and one boy, whom she raises and puts through school with the income generated by her business. Teresa has paid off her first loan from Esperanza, which gave her the opportunity to start her own business. This loan will allow her to replenish her inventory and expand the types of products she can sell.

OTE: Teresa is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group, which means this $750 will go to finance her business as well as four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community, whom Teresa has gone through training with and they will make each loan repayment together. You will receive journals covering Teresa's progress and that of her fellow group members.

loans.use: Invest in hats, shoes, t-shirts, skirts and pants for her clothing store inventory

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is married and has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker, and his job is on and off. Angelica wanted to help him with expenses because they couldn't survive on his wages alone. Two year ago, she decided started her own business. Prior to this, she had helped her sister sell used clothing. At first, she started selling beauty products of a well-known Mexican brand, and later she decided to combine both ventures, which is what she does currently.

Angelica is requesting a loan of $200 to add more clothing to her stock and to satisfy her clients' orders for beauty products. She plans to repay the loan within three months and hopes you will help her continue growing her business. She is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por ello es que Angélica decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar por que no les alcanza con el sueldo del esposo. Hace 2 años fue que ella decidió tener su negocio propio por que antes de eso, ella ayudaba a su hermana en la venta de ropa usada, pero luego empezó ella a vender productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida en México y posteriormente, decidió combinar ambas actividades y es ahora a lo que ella se dedica.

Angélica esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder abastecerse de ropa y también pode cubrir los pedidos que ya tiene de sus productos de belleza, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y espera que la apoyes para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella te agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya owns a clothing and shoe sales business in Marganets, Ukraine. She started her business nine years ago, choosing to sell clothing because it was an area she knew well. Her business has done well with a good location and exposure in the market and has had stable sales. Nataliya has developed a good reputation over the years through her personal integrity, kindness toward others, and a positive attitude. Nataliya has requested a loan to add to her working capital and enable her to open a new sales location. She looks forward to expanding her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new location

loans.name: Elghun

texts.en:
Mr. Elghun is a low income vulnerable person. He is 24 and lives in the village of Saatli city, which is situated in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Elghun rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful and needs some investment to increase the daily sales, but Elghun has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks.

That's why he applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $700 loan. This credit could let him buy and sell more goods and better provide the necessities of life for his parents.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida Kurbanova is an active client of Microinvest in the Istaravshan region, Khujand, Tajikistan. She has been in business since 2005. During these two years she has became one of the good sellers at the market and she has learned a lot about what her customers want. She often changes out her inventory and tries to have only stylish goods. Currently she is requesting a loan to use as extra capital to buy new stylish clothes for the winter season.She hopes to get a good profit from holiday trade.

loans.use: to expand her inventory to be ready for the winter season

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
Señora Mery is a member of the Doradinas in Action Community Bank, located in the San Jose de Sisa district, province of El Dorado, San Martin region. She is dedicated to sell casual, sport, and elegant clothes for women, gentlemen, boys, and girls. Her shop is located on the main street in the San Jose de Sisa district at the Jr. Commerce Square (in front of the Central Market). She has been doing this business for 10 years, but before she used to do it door to door and also selling to friends and acquaintances.

With the 2,000.00 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 4 months, Mery will buy more clothes, especially for girls and boys, approximately four dozen elegant dresses of different sizes to take advantage of the seasonal holiday parties, and elegant clothing pieces for women and men ( two dozen of different sizes and brands) so she can meet the demands of her loyal clientele.

Mery is 42 years old, married and only has two children, a boy and a girl. She feels very happy because she has always count with her husband's and her family's support, which in terms has allowed her to have a shop for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal Doradinas en Acción del distrito de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, región San Martín, se dedica a la venta de ropas de vestir casual, sport y elegante para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la localidad de San José de Sisa en el Jr. Comercio Cdra. 4 (frente al Mercado Central), se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, pero antes lo realizaba en forma ambulatoria y vendiendo a los amigos y conocidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará más prendas de vestir, principalmente para niñas y niños como cuatro docenas de vestidos elegantes de diferentes tallas para aprovechar la venta en las fiestas promocionales, prendas de vestir elegantes para damas y caballeros (dos docenas de diferentes marcas y tallas) para poder satisfacer a su asidua clientela. Mery tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene sólo dos hijos, un varón y una mujercita. Se siente muy feliz porque siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo y familia, lo que le ha permitido poder adquirir un local.

loans.use: Buying clothes for selling.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the San Blas neighborhood, a group of women have come together to begin a committee of women entrepreneurs who meet weekly to discuss their businesses and to make payments to their loans. When women come together to form micro credit groups, there is much success. They understand that success comes in numbers and their numbers are large. Sixteen women have come together from various neighborhoods in Carapeguá, and after receiving information about working at fairs and other community activities, they have realized the possibilities how their work can grow.

The women are dependent on the loans to help their businesses grow. With the loans they will purchase goods to make crafts such as linens, thread and embroidery, and also help stock their convenience stores. Together these women have seen much success and will continue to increase the size of their businesses and clientele.

loans.use: The majority of the women involved in the committee have invested their loans to buy goods for their businesses: linens, thread for sewing and embroidery.  Others buy clothes to sell as traveling saleswomen

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a single mother of three children. She and her mother sold a piece of land and bought another piece of property in Ciudad del Este, where they started their own clothing business. With the profits from the business Justina has since paid her mother back.

Justina has been in business now for 7 years. It is successful and brings in enough money for Justina to support her children. However, she would like to expand her business by purchasing more jeans to sell to both to men and women, and clothing for school-age children. By increasing the variety of clothing for sale, she will be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy jeans for resale in her clothing business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa is a 39 year old woman with a great talent for her work. She lives in the Laurels North area together with her husband and her 3 minor children. The spouses work together in her business; they sell food and beverages through the streets. This ingenious couple invented a bicycle food cart from which to sell their products. In the lower part of the cart they installed two cooking pots full of fired charcoal. They place the hot food above these portable heat sources, to keep it warm. They have two of these bicycles. Both Rosa and her husband go out on the bicycles to sell food and beverages in the streets and at construction worksites, where they have developed a good clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad con un gran ingenio en el trabajo, habita en los Laureles Norte junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ambos esposos trabajan juntos en el negocio de venta de comida y refrescos ambulante. Esta ingeniosa pareja en una bicicleta elaboro un anexo en la parte de enfrente en donde en la parte de abajo le adaptaron dos ollas con carbón encendido a fin de mantener caliente la comida y sobre ellos están las porras de comida caliente, tienen dos bicicletas y cada uno de ellos sale a las calles para vender comida y refrescos en las calles y puestos de trabajo de construcción donde consiguen buenos clientes.

loans.use: Invest in the raw materials she uses to prepare her food products

loans.name: Subi

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Subi M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 16.

In 2002, Subi established her mawese (local oil) business. Subi requires a loan in order to purchase the oil from farmers who extract it from the nut of a local tree. She then sells the oild in the market and to soap companies. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase mawese (local oil) in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina G. is a teacher in the urban zone of Acoyapa. She is 53 years old, and is married with two children who are professionals. She has worked in education for 27 years. She has used her previous loans to improve her house, and she will now make her dream of having a dignified dwelling a reality and get some rest once she retires. With this loan, she will put the final touches on her house, such as changing the floor to tile which will improve her status in the society. The teacher Ernestina has stood out in her municipality as a person who is responsible, honest, and dependable, and for these reasons she is much loved by her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina G. es maestra de la zona urbana de Acoyapa, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, con 2 hijos profesionales. Tiene 27 años de trabajo en el sector educativo, los créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda, y ya logrará cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna para sus nietos y descansar una vez que se haya jubilado. Con este credito dará un toque final a su vivienda, como es cambiar el piso a ceramica , para asi alcanzar un mejor estatus en esta sociedad. La profesora Ernestina se ha destacado en su municipio como una persona responsable, honesta y cumplidora, es por esta razon que es muy querida por sus colegas.

loans.use: Install a tile floor in her house.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Zena M.. She is married with three children aged 2, 7, and 10. In 2007, Zena established her own cosmetics business. Zena requires a loan in order to expand her range of lipsticks, eyeshadows and perfumes. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

Thus, SELFINA works for the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To expand her range of lipsticks, eyeshadows and perfumes.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is 51 years old, he is a single father of 2 students. He works buying and selling grains (corn, beans and others) to help support his home, and to pay for the studies of his children. Aquiles wishes to buy more merchandise and take advantage of the season now, because there will be less grain later, he is also thinking of renting a space to sell the grains. For these reasons, he requests a loan through here, hoping to find people that believe in him and in his work and who help him achieve prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Aquiles tiene 51 años, es padre soltero, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, él se dedica a la compra y venta de granos (maíz, fréjol y otros) lo que le ayuda a sostener su hogar, y a pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Aquiles desea abastecerse de más productos, ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada, pues en adelante serán escasos, así mismo, tiene pensado alquilar un local para la venta de su granos. Con estos motivos ingresa su pedido de préstamo por este medio, para que pueda encontrar personas que crean en su trabajo y esfuerzo y lo apoyen a favor de su prosperidad.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale grains to sell them later

loans.name: Muharamhon

texts.ru: Адалиева Мухарамхон проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Клиентка вместе со своим мужем имеют семейный бизнес. Имеют лепешечную , где пекут лепешки. Муж работает в пекарне , а она продает продукцию на базаре. Вместе они запланировали  получить кредит , чтобы закупить муку. Это поможет им бесперебойно производить лепешки  и продавать по тем же ценам . Так как цены на муку с каждым днем растут и цены на хлеб тоже увеличиваются. Погасить кредит смогут в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muharamhon A. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has four children. She together with her husband have a family business. They own a bakery where they make flat breads. Her husband works in the bakery and she sells the products on the market. Together they have planned to get a loan to buy flour. This will help them continuously produce flat breads and keep selling them at the same price, because the price for flour grows every day and price for bread also increases. They can pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean P. lives in Roliek Village in Kampong Cham Province, where she is a farmer who owns a small rice field. After she gathers the rice, she gets a very small revenue with which she cannot support her family well. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Sean P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to expand her rice revenues. Her husband is a foreman whose income is too small to support his family. Mrs. Sean P. is 31 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are one and four years old. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to expand her rice revenues.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 37 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo que vive sola.  Es natural  de la Isla Flotante “Los Uros”, se ha venido dedicando a elaborar artesanías desde hace ya 27 años, para poder solventar sus gastos económicos.  Es independiente, ya que aún no ha decidido formar una familia, esto ha hecho que se dedique íntegramente a su trabajo de elaborar y vender artesanías para los turistas que frecuentan esta Isla. Empieza desde las 7 de la mañana arma el puesto donde ofrecerá las artesanías que elabora, hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche, que es cuando se oculta el sol, a Hilda le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le gusta intercambiar conocimientos con los turistas que frecuentan su isla.   Hilda quiere seguir trabajando para alcanzar todos sus sueños y quien sabe, formar una familia.  Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar material para elaborar sus artesanías y en un futuro expandir su negocio, para poder mantener viva la cultura de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37, single with no children, she lives alone. She is originally from the “Los Uros” island, where she has made crafts for more than 27 years to be able to support herself. She is independent, since she hasn’t decided to form a family, this allows her to concentrate on her work and sell more crafts to tourists that visit the island. She starts at 7 a.m. with the stand where she will offer the crafts she made herself and stay until 6 or 7 p.m., when the sun sets. Hilda really likes her job; she enjoys exchanging knowledge from tourists that visit the island. Hilda wants to keep working to achieve her dreams and who knows, maybe form a family. With the money from the loan, she will buy material for the crafts and in the future, she wants to expand her business, to support the culture of her town.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make local crafts

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Flora N. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Flora is married and has one child who is 17 years old.

Since 2007 Flora has been selling traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called vitenge. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print that is printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings, and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Flora works at the business 9 to 12 hours a week, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional vitenge in bulk for resale. Flora thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitenge in bulk for resale

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.en:
Gulinor P. is 60 years old. She’s a widow and has 3 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work when her husband passed away. For about 7 years together with her son, who is pictured on the photo, she has been purchasing calves in the local market, fattening and selling them.

Gulinor is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Gulinor wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Now she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 5 months to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim M., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Sarim Hoem, 53, who live in a small village along National Road Number Two about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have two children, a son and a daughter. One is married and lives outside the family home, and the other child has full time employment. They also have two grandchildren living with them.

Sim has been a motor remoque taxi driver for ten years. A remoque taxi is a motorbike with a trailer at the back, allowing Sim to transport people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh. His wife maintains their home. Sim is now requesting a loan of $500 to buy a new trailer to replace the old one for his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for his motor taxi business.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima M. is married and an enterprising Tanzanian woman. She runs a salon and cosmetics shop at Temeke Mikoroshini in Dar es Salaam. In Dar es Salaam, the services and products provided by salon and cosmetic shops are in high demand, especially by women because of the hot temperatures. Naima M. sells the majority of her products and services Friday through Sunday. She purchases her products in Kariakoo where the big cosmetic shops are located. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000. ($450) to buy additional supplies to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Salamuu has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year.  
She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Salamuu is 24 years old, married, and has two children: aged 5 and 11 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Asia and Bahati. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan B. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of five kids. She lives in Bekwai zongo community with her husband. Her husband is a security man for a company. Zongo in Ghana is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual labour to help produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's education. Alhasan belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’. She hopes to receive GHS700 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta is thirty-three years old and married with five children. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She produces and sells garri, and has been in this business since 2000. She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more cassava for producing garri to sell. She says thanks to all who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for producing garri to sell

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa P. is 44 years old and a resident of Zone 12, Bunawanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She is married to Iriño P., a farmer. They are blessed with nine children, one of whom is married.

Marites (her nickname) buys bananas and sells them in the market place. Currently, her business is good but due to the demands of her customers, she wants to purchase additional stock. She is applying for a loan of Php 4000 from KIVA partner HSPFI to purchase the additional bananas. This will be her first loan cycle.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for sale.

location.town: Zone 12, Bunawan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in marketing and security equipment

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
"I have a farm with a total land area of 15,552 square meters. Since my husband died, it has been only me managing our rice farm. This is how I am able to send all my children to school as well as provide for their other needs," says Florenda A., a mother of three children. 

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. The loan will help her produce a bigger harvest on her farm and more income for her family.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It helps provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


   Марифат Шодиева женщина 40 лет. Вдова , имеет 3 детей. Работает  Марифат медсестрой в Кайраккумском центральной поликлинике. также подрабатывает санитаркой в том учреждении. Когда год назад потеряла мужа , брат мужа решил помочь ей. Он посоветовал получить кредит на какой либо бизнес. Кредит получать не решалась, не знала как погасит свои долги. Недавно ее племянник сообщил что от откорма скота остается хорошая прибыль. Она решила получить кредит на покупку корову с теленком.
texts.en:
Marifat S. is 40 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She is a nurse at the Kayrakkum central hospital and also works there as a part-time orderly. When Marifat lost her husband a year ago, her brother-in-law decided to help her. He advised her to obtain a business loan. Until now, Marifat has been hesitant to obtain a loan, not knowing how she could repay it. Recently, her nephew informed her that livestock feeding business results in a good profit. Therefore, Marifat decided to request a loan in order to purchase a cow with a calf.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema I., age 47, is married and has four children.  She has 1 year of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people/public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Ema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Her loan will be used only for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, chemicals, knives, a sharpener, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Frozen Fish Mongers Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu T., Sama T., Kadiatu S., Hawa K., and Abie J.. They named their group Frozen Fish Mongers, picking a name that reflects their trade. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They all previously received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Each member of the group received a loan of Le 1,200,000 during the last loan cycle. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more cartons of frozen fish to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu (back row, right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children. Two of her children are in college and two are in secondary schools. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now.

Kadiatu, like the rest of the group members, sells frozen fish. With this new loan, she will expand her business. She will be able to buy about ten cartons of frozen fish. She usually travels to Freetown to buy the fish. The fare to Freetown is Le 12,000 and she usually pays a delivery fee of Le 1,000 per carton. In Freetown, the price for a carton of fish ranges between Le 65,000 to Le 95,000 depending on the type and quality.

So far, Kadiatu faces no serious challenge in her business that are worth noting. Business is going fine and well. She enjoys what she does for a living. To Kadiatu and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs Sarom N. is from Ank Ta Nu village in Takeo province. She is 43 years old and the mother of nine children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, five of whom attend the local school, while the other two are too young to work or study. Sarom N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although she and her husband, Mr Bao Shi, work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs Sarom N. has decided to ask for a loan. She will add it to her savings so that she can buy a motorbike for her husband to set up a motor taxi business. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to set up a motor taxi business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora A. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 56 years old. Flora is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Flora has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Flora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita Jirón tiene 79 años. Ella se ha dedicado durante mucho tiempo al destace de cerdo, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de cómo ganarse el pan de cada día, desafortunadamente Margarita solo logro finalizar sus estudios de primaria. Actualmente esto no fue impedimento para salir adelante, por medio de su familia que siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad fue que ella decide por cuenta propia establecer su propio negocio, en su humilde vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Su mayor aspiración es mantener este negocio porque ya a su edad es muy difícil segur trabajando.
texts.en:
Margarita Jirón is 79-years-old. For a long time she has earned her living butchering pigs, so she's always looked for ways make ends meet. Unfortunately, she managed to complete only a primary school education. This did not stop her from getting ahead now, though. Because her family had always been in this business, she made the decision to start her own business in her modest home. She is seeking a loan for working capital to buy pigs. Her greatest aspiration to to keep up her business because at her age it's very hard to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Darlindo

texts.en:
Darlindo is a resident from the village of Bonfal Proper Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Aida and they were gifted with two children: Erwin and Darlene. They are now in their elementary level of education. Darlindo and his wife is hoping for them to finish their studies so that they will find a good job someday.

With regards to this, this couple is saving some of their business income for the future college education of their two children. He manages a tricycle transport and sometimes sells coconut (buko) in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya particularly in the public market. Through his patience in managing his business, Darlindo is able to earn PHP2, 000 monthly incomes which is being utilize for the needs of his family and support for the education of their children. He is asking to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 that will be helpful in making his business progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ahènlimbavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants ; elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale plus précisément des oignons, de la mayonnaise, du milo, des spaghuettis, des sardines. Grâce à cette activité, elle apporte sa contribution financière dans le foyer. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1999 dans le Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle compte dans l’avenir agrandir son petit commerce en louant une boutique dans le marché. Pour le moment, elle vend à la devanture d’une boutique, sous un parasol. Elle a tout de même de très grandes ambitions pour l’avenir ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter non seulement certains de ces produits manquants, mais aussi agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 2 children. She sells foodstuffs, more precisely onions, mayonnaise, Milo (a cocoa drink), spaghetti, and sardines. Thanks to this business, she is able to make a financial contribution toward supporting the household. She has been in this business since 1999 in the Big Market of Lomé.

She intends in future to enlarge her little business by renting a store in the market. For the moment, she sells in front of a store, under a parasol. She nevertheless has great ambition for the future; this is why she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy not only some of the products she is lacking, but also to enlarge her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely L. is now 31 years old and happily married to her husband, Jerry L., now 35 years old and working as a construction worker. In their long years of marriage, they have been blessed with three kids: Nelly Rose, 12 years old; Jonnel, 6 years old, and Althea Jane, 3 years old. Her oldest child and second-oldest child are in primary level education. Their expenses for the schooling of their children will begin to rise, especially when their youngest child starts to go to school. So Nely and Jerry are starting to save for their future. Aside from the salary Jerry gets from his work, Nely manages a business that buys and sells different frozen foods and some assorted biscuits. Also, she is offering her services to customers that want to have a manicure or pedicure. All of her businesses contribute to covering their daily expenses as well as the expenses of their children in school, so Nely is really trying hard to improve them.

Since she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she has properly utilized every loan that she has received for the improvement of her business. Now she will again use the loan that she will receive to buy different things needed for her businesses. She is really hoping that her business will continue to run.

Now one of Nely's dreams is to have their own house in the future for their family. For her children, she really wants them to finish their studies until college because, according to Nely, this is the only thing she can give to their children, a good education that they can use to fight against poverty.

loans.use: To finance all her businesses

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna S. is a villager in Tuol Kandal Village, Kandal Province. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support her field; consequently, she has decided to ask for a loan. She will use most of the money to buy fertilizer; the remainder will be used to find a way of irrigating her crops. Her husband, Mr. Meim Lun, is a fisherman and helps his wife. Mrs. Vanna S. has six children, one of whom works in a garment factory. Two others are farmers; two others are attending the local school. Finally, the youngest one, a five year old, stays home because he is too young to work or study.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Colupan Bajo in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Teresita raises, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 480 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine sells colorful sarongs in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Her youngest child is 17 years old. Her husband is a trader.

Catherine is very happy with her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: A. Cécile est née en 1961 à Dassa dans les Collines au Bénin. Cécile s’est installée à Sèmè-Podji au Sud du Bénin, il y a environs 18 ans. Mariée à SALAKO Jean, un conducteur de taxi-moto, Cécile est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Cécile n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a environs quatre ans que Cécile s’est mise à vendre de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Cécile vend également du savon (Fanico, Popular, etc.) à son domicile. Cécile s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Cécile sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour augmenter son capital et renforcer le stock de ses produits, afin de mieux répondre à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
A. Cécile was born in 1961 in Dassa, Collines County, Benin. She got situated in Sèmè-Podji in southern Benin eighteen years ago. Married to SALAKO Jean, a moto taxi driver, she is the mother of three children, who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple is covering family expenses jointly. Cécile never attended school. Four years ago, she started selling akassa (a local food made with cornstarch) in her home. She also sells soap (Fanico, Popular, etc.) in her home. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé that she repaid. Cécile is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to augment her working capital and to bolster her stock of goods, so as to respond better to customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ten sacks of corn

loans.name: Matelani

texts.en:
Matelani R. is 32 and married with 3 children (ages 2 - 9).  She is starting a business venture, sewing different kinds of clothes and dresses .  Matelani needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 125 tala or US $52 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Matelani joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Matelani's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Matelani R. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda, 51 years old, has seven children with her husband Rex. She is involved in rice farming. She currently owns 3.5 hectares of rice field, which she and her husband till together. She also raises pigs and chickens to add income to her household. She wants to succeed in business just like any other entrepreneur. She applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, other farm supplies and feed for the chickens and pigs.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose sells starch in Sapele, Delta state. Starch is a staple food in the Delta part of Nigeria. It is usually eaten with a Nigerian soup called banga soup. This meal is very rich in oil and many Nigerians love this food. 

She hopes for a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more starch to sell. She is a widow with five children. Life as a widow is not easy and Bose sells for long hours to meet the basic needs of her children. She hopes to grow her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more starch to sell

loans.name: Jemmar

texts.en:
Jemmar, 23, is the father of a 2-year-old child. He married his wife, Jenny, in 2006. His family lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. 

Jemmar started his own business, which is farming, when he married his wife. He started with two hectares of field and he had his uncle's help to finance the farm. On harvest, he pays the capital, and he and his uncle split the income. When he learned about CEVI, he immediately joined to take advantage of its program. He was glad to have his own capital to use. He applied for a loan of PHP 6,000, which he would definitely use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that he needs. Hopefully, Jemmar will earn better income through this loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sokheoun Leng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Pou Ta village in Kandal province, this is a village bank loan consisting of thirteen people. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokheoun L. is the village bank leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family.

Her husband, Mr. Sophorn Laut, is a plow laborer in the local village. In this activity, they have a problem because their oxen are plowing a lot of places, and the oxen do not find it easy to relax because they do not have a place for their oxen. Thus, Mrs. Sokheoun L. decided to ask for a loan to build a stall for breeding oxen.

Mrs. Sokheoun L. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school and the other is too young to work or go to school.

loans.use: To build an ox stall for breeding oxen

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova es mi Pastor lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que se dedican al comercio de verduras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Liseth B. Calero quien hace nueve años empezó vendiendo limones en la actualidad por medio de los prestamos fue surtiendo su puesto con más variedad de frutas y verduras.
