Las otras integrantes del grupo son Justina del Carmen R. la cual comercializa cebollas, chiltoma, tomates, ajo, achote etc. Y Jamileth de los Santos S. vende verduras como papa, ayote, pipian, chilote, yuca, quequisque…etc.
Ellas invertirán el préstamo en la compra de cosechas en frutas y verduras de temporada.
texts.en:
The Jehova es mi Pastor Group is comprised of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, and tenacious women who sell vegetables. Liseth B. Calero is the coordinator of the group. Nine years ago she started selling lemons. With loans she has now been stocking her stand with a greater variety of fruits and vegetables. Justina del Carmen R. is another member of the group. She sells onions, sweet peppers, garlic, and “achote” (annato, a spice). Jamileth de los Santos S., the other member, sells vegetables like potatoes, pumpkins, chilies, sweet corn, yucca, and “quequisque” (a tuber), etc. They will use the loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 43 años, es natural de la ciudad de Anta, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicios de seguridad personal de forma particular. Actualmente, el socio trabaja en el Ministerio del Interior como personal de confianza de un funcionario público. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Su actividad económica complementaria es  crianza, comprar y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, el tiene un galpón en su casa donde actualmente tiene 40 cuyes hembras. 

Julio Cesar es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para ampliar el galpón y comprar cuyes de raza. El socio con cuenta mucha tristeza que la humedad afecto a sus cuyes muriéndose una considerable cantidad pero el socio apesar de las adversidades del clima seguirá con el negocio. 

El anhelo del socio es ampliar el negocio comprando en cantidades cuyes para vender en las festividades importantes como por ejemplo en el aniversario de la ciudad del Cusco y tambien su deseo es abrir un restaurante donde va vender platos tipos de la región como por ejemplo el “Chiriuchu”. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is part of the communal bank 'Los Diamantes'. He is 43 years old and is from the city of Anta. He lives with his partner and 3 children. His principal economic activity is providing personal security. He works for the Ministry of the Interior as a trusted personal assistant to a public functionary. He has been doing this for 8 years and has done very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He also has a complementary economic activity - breeding, buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs. Julio has a small shed at his house where he has 40 female guinea pigs. Julio Cesar is a very hard-working and empresarial person who is always looking for ways to move forward. By working hard each day he wants to give his children a better future. He requires a loan to expand his shed and purchase a breed of guinea pigs. Julio tells us with great sadness that the humidity has affected his guinea pigs, and a considerable quantity have died. Notwithstanding the adversities of the climate, he will continue with the business. Julio's yearning is to expand his business, buying guinea pigs in quantity to sells them during important festivals, such as the city of Cusco's anniversary. He would also like to open a restaurant selling typical food from the region, such as 'Chiriuchu'. The communal bank has been functioning for 10 loan cycles and Julio stats that he is content and satisfied with the credit services, savings and capacity, for the time that the bank has existed. Julio is very thankful for the opportunity granted to him and promises to meet the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand shed and purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Banco En Desarollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Acosta, 36, is the coordinator of her group, Banco en Desarollo (Bank in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Acosta’s group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children.

Acosta is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by traveling to the capitol to purchase more merchandise in the main markets.

Acosta will use her profits to purchase medicine, clothes, a computer and school supplies for her children. She would also like to repair some things in her home. Finally, her dream is to study medicine and be a doctor. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell

loans.name: Luciano Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Luciano está casado con la Sra. Sara Álvarez, cuentan con 3 hijos que estudian en la Universidad. 
Anteriormente el señor trabajaba como empleado en una empresa de Servicios de Limpieza adquirió bastante experiencia en el rubro, logrando de esa manera y con los ahorros formar su propia empresa. 
Actualmente cuenta con 3 empleados que el maneja y presta servicios para varias empresas.
Le gustaría para el futuro ampliar mas  su negocio ya que cuenta con   local propio y posee buena ubicación contando con gran demanda de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Luciano is married to Mrs. Sara Álvarez and together they have three children who are studying at University. Previously, Mr. Luciano worked as an employee at a cleaning service. He acquired significant experience in this field and in this way, with his savings, he formed his own business. Currently, he has 3 employees that he manages and offers services to various businesses. In the future, he would like to expand his business now that he has his own location in a good spot with a great demand for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for work such as vacuums etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie B. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Josie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as candies, some food for snacks, sugar, salt, noodles, milk, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. She also sells cellphone electronic loads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Josie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Josie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N., from the village of Nazareth Cagayan de Oro City, is 49 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over one year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edith Xioamara

texts.es:
la sra. Edith Xiomara A. O. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la colonia Rivera de la Vega en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene dos años con su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos, pulperias, mercaditos, tambien hace tortillas por encargo para reuniones o fiestas.
el credito lo utilizara  para comparar harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua. desea comprar mas para tener una mayor produccion y asi tener mejores ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia..
texts.en:
Ms. Edith Xiomara A. O. is 28 years old and lives in the Rivera de la Vega section of Tegucigalpa. She makes and sells tortillas and has been running this business for two years. Her customers include her neighbors, general stores, and small markets. She also makes tortillas to order for family reunions and parties. She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn flour, firewood, salt, and water. She wants to increase her production and improve her sales. She needs the income in order to cover household expenses and move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena es de 40 años de edad, casada, tiene cuatro hijos tres varones y una mujer, se dedica a confeccionar blusas para vestir, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de edad, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en tela y materiales para confección, sus referencias personales indican que es  una persona responsable y trabajadora, con la ayuda de su esposo podrá realizar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 40 years old and married. She has four children, three boys and a girl. She makes blouses. She has been doing this for approximately four years. She is requesting her first loan to increase her working capital and purchase materials for sewing. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible and hard-working person. With her husband’s help she will be able to make the monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her house, and for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Turdubiubiu's Group

texts.en:
Turdubiubiu A., 51 and the mother of a 16-year-old daughter who studies in the United States, is the leader of this group. Her husband helps her to keep house and operate her business, a cattle-breeding and milk-selling operation. With an initial investment of 3000 soms, Turdubiubiu started her business four years ago, and she now earns 4600 soms each month. From the profits she has been able to buy home appliances and significantly increase her number of cattle. Turdubiubiu is requesting a loan to purchase hay for the cattle and continue her successful business which provides for the members of her family.

Group members: Buaihan M., 42 and married, is the group's treasurer. She has three children: a daughter, 17, a son, 12, and another daughter, 7. Her husband works in Russia, while her children study in the U.S. For eight years, Buaihan has bred cattle and sold milk, having started the business with the purchase of a cow for 8000 soms. She now earns a monthly income of 3500 soms. Buaihan is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to continue cattle breeding. With the additional profits, she is planning to increase her number of cattle.

Abdyldabek A., 39 and married, has five children: his daughter is 18 and his sons are 16, 14, 9 years old, and 11 months. His daughter works in Russia, while his three elder sons go to school and the youngest son is at home. Abdyldabek breeds cattle and sells milk, assisted by his elder sons. Six years ago, he bought a milk cow for 5000 soms and since then has increased his number of cattle. Abdyldabek now makes 8000 soms each month, and he is applying for loan in order to buy forage for cattle for the winter period.

Asilbek B., 46 and married, has three children: his sons are 14 and 8, and his daughter is 13, and they are all are studying in the U.S. Asilbek started his business three years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms. He makes national items (for example: national souvenirs) and earns 2000 soms monthly. His profits will allow him to start construction of his house. He is now requesting a loan to buy chickens for breeding, the profits from which will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Tulgat

texts.en: Tulgat D. is a 31-year-old married man who lives with his wife and one daughter in their own house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife works as a private businesswoman. Tulgat runs a taxi service in his local town. He started this business in 2006 after purchasing a new car with his working capital and since then he has built a stable operation. He also started a second business in 2008 by selling a variety of products in the local community. His business earnings have enabled him to renovate his house.  After years of successful operation, both of his businesses have become sustainable in the local market. Tulgat is a hardworking and honest person who plans to save his revenue for his daughter's future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some spare parts for his automobile and more inventory products for his trading business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi and more products for his trading business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S., 30, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

S. sells groceries for an income of about USD 5 per day while her husband transports water to sell, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 82 on food every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela V. P. tiene 31 años de edad es soltera vive junto a su madre Rosalía P. Solís que ya es de edad (abuelita), en Colomi Comunidad Candelaria hacia el norte.         

La señora Gabriela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes todos los días aparte de lo que se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, papaliza así se mantienen las dos madre e hija, razón que ella se apersono  a nuestra oficina a solicitar un crédito porque necesitan construir una vivienda donde se compraron un lote terreno sobre el camino, así como también trasladar su venta de abarrotes y tener mejores ingresos, finalmente la señora Gabriela nos dice que ampliara mas su venta de abarrotes para darse mejores condiciones de vida y vivir más cómodos junto a su madre querida.
texts.en:
Gabriela V. P. is 31 years old and single. She lives together with her mother, Rosalía P. Solís, who is already an elderly grandmother, in  Colomi, in Candelaria community toward the north.          

Gabriela works selling groceries every day. She also works in agriculture, producing potatoes, beans and papa lisa (ulluco). In this way, she supports both of them, mother and daughter. For this reason, she appeared in the office to request a loan, because they need to build a house on a lot they purchased along the road. She will also move her grocery business there and have a better income. Finally, Gabriela reports that she will expand her grocery sales to provide better living conditions and live more comfortably together with her beloved mother.

loans.use: Investing in improving her housing

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: O. Micheline est née le 21 Février 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Micheline vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Micheline est mariée et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Micheline aide son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Micheline n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et nourrir sa famille, Micheline vend diverses sortes de savons, mais aussi d’autres articles dont les condiments, dans sa boutique située à son domicile. Micheline se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Micheline désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Micheline sollicite un septième crédit. Plus tard, Micheline ambitionne acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
O. Micheline was born on February 21, 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Since birth, she has lived in the Adogléta district in Cotonou.  She is married and the mother of three children, who are all in school.  The couple have another child in their care in addition to their own children.  Micheline helps her husband to cover family expenses, thanks to the revenue from her business.  

Micheline did not attend school.  To meet her needs and to feed the family, she sells a variety of soaps but also other items, including condiments, in her shop located in her home.  She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

She is a previous client of ALIDé who has always repaid her loans.  She would like to increase her working capital and to respond better to customer demands.  For these reasons, Micheline is requesting a seventh loan.  Later on, she her ambition is to acquire her own plot of land.

loans.use: Buying various personal care products

loans.name: Kito Development Group 1-Mukono

texts.en: Thirty-year-old Fathilia K. is naturally a lighthearted, upbeat and industrious businesswoman who has been operating a fruit and vegetable enterprise in Kirinya-Mukono for the last 5 years. She says that she relied on financial help from her husband to get established. Previously she ran a charcoal sales business. Fathila says that she makes a weekly profit of 100,000 UGX. She plans to use this loan to buy more pineapples, passion fruits, paw-paws and jack fruit for resale. Fathilia has no children.

loans.use: to purchase more pineapples, passion  fruits, paw-paws and jack fruit

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 44 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of fifteen and twenty-two. Only one of her children attends school. Her husband works as a farmer. Claudine sells green bananas and she has spent thirteen years in this business. 

She has requested this loan to buy more green bananas to sell, and the profit will be used to sustain her family's needs. She hopes to diversify her business to sell foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and increase his monthly income

loans.name: Nestor Jacobo

texts.es: Néstor Jacobo, tiene 31 años es casado y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. el se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos pues ha sido una gran experiencia. El inicio hace 10 años, pues con el paso del tiempo fue que el decidió quedarse con este medio de vida y salir adelante. Ahora solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en medicamentos ya que tiene ciertos encargos pendientes.
texts.en:
Néstor Jacobo, 31, is married and has a minor son.  He sells medicines.  This isn’t his first time asking for a loan because it’s been a great experience.

He started out 10 years ago and with the passage of time decided to stay in this way of life and get ahead.

He is asking for a loan now to invest in medicines since he has several pending orders.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Luchando por Nuestros Sueños” y está conformado por 19 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chimbarongo.
Alexis, quien es el presidente de este grupo, en la foto se ubica en la última fila, por el centro y viste camisa blanca.  Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alfajores, cuchuflies y chocolates, desde hace 1 año. Trabaja en su casa y vende sus productos en almacenes y a particulares.
Con este préstamo comprará materiales para hacer sus productos, tanto los ingredientes, como los palitos y envoltorios para los chocolates.
Tiene una hijita de 12 años.  Su sueño es tener un local establecido y vender por mayor.
A Alexis le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, especialmente cuando sus ventas han sido más bajas. También está muy contento de compartir con sus compañeros de grupo.
Chimbarongo es una comuna ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, 150 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "lugar entre nieblas". La economía de Chimbarongo está basada principalmente en la elaboración de artesanías en mimbre, en el cultivo de frutales y la producción de vino.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Luchando por Nuestros Sueños” (Fighting for our Dreams) and is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who live in the city of Chimbarongo.

You can see Alexis, the group's president, in the center of the photo, in the back row, wearing a white shirt.  His business is making and selling 'alfajores' (traditional small cakes) , 'cuchuflíes' (filled sponge fingers) and chocolates.  He has been in this business for one year.  He works at home and sells his products in stores and also to individuals.

Alexis will use this loan to buy materials for making his products, both ingredients and little sticks and wrappings for the chocolates.  He has a 12 year-old daughter.  His dream is to have an established premises and to sell his products wholesale.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been very useful for Alexis, especially when his sales have been very low.  He is also very happy to share with his fellow group members.

Chimbarongo is a town located in Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, 150km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  Its name, in Mapudungan (the Mapuche language) means "place between the clouds".  Chimbarongo's economy is based mainly on the production of wicker handicrafts, growing fruit and wine production.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María del Socorro O. Q. trabaja como Contador General en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 1 año y 4 meses.

Es casada de 62 años de edad, con una persona a su cargo vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua villa 09 de Junio desde hace 10 año.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este crédito ya que lo solicita para mejora de vivienda y darle a su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
María del Socorro O. Q. has worked as a general accountant for an aqueduct and sewerage company for one year and four months. 

She is 62 years of age, married and has one child. She has lived in Villa 9 de Junio, a suburb of Managua in the Managua municipality, for 10 years.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL for granting her this loan, which she will use to make improvements on her house to give her family a decent home.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
Paulo, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Paulo es la pintura. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Paulo en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar oleos, pintura entres otras cosas. 

Paulo pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Paulo is 33 years old and the father of three children. He lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. His main economic activity consists in painting. He has done that for 12 years and earned a good income thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Paulo currently needs a loan to buy oil and paint, among others.

Paulo is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy oil and paint

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, currently in the business of selling fish, is 34 years old, married, and has six children, all attending school. Elizabeth's loan will enable her to stock more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house with the extra profits arising from her business.

loans.use: The loan will enable Elizabeth to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Ii Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Cristina M., quien vive en la zona de Caacupemí de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona.
El comité se denomina "8 de Diciembre II". Están en el Primer Ciclo y está constituido por 17 integrantes.
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajarán en conjunto en la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad, y pretenden tener muy buen cumplimiento con la institución.
La sra. María G. posee un puesto de venta de frutas, desde donde ofrece los mejores productos con excelente calidad a sus clientes, ya que mediante este negocio ella obtiene buenos ingresos económicos para poder mantener a su familia.
Ella desea poder contar con este crédito para adquirir más variedades de frutas.
texts.en:
The group was formed through the efforts of Mrs Cristina M. who lives in the Caacupemí  area of the Cuidad del Este.  She got her friends and neighbors together to form this group in the area.
The group is called "8 de Diciembre II".  They are in the first cycle and have 17 members.
It is a group that is known for being very united and responsible.  The member have a very enterprising spirit and will work together in the activities that will raise the funds to safeguard the group in case of need, and intend to to comply with the rules of the institution.
Mrs. María G. has a fruit stand where she offers her customers the best products,  of excellent quality. Through this business she gets good income and is able to support her family.
She wants to count on this loan to be able to buy a larger variety of fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 44 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 14. She owns a small business sewing clothes. This business is well organized. Marie Jeanne has four months of experience. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day, and she currently employs two people to help her. 

Marie Jeanne has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her business by purchasing a new machine for sewing. Marie Jeanne will be able to satisfy her customers, which will help her to earn more profits. With these profits, she will reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for sewing

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is from the village of Poblacion II, Oroquieta City. She is 45 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lourdes raises pigs. 

Lourdes has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs to sell. 

Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a widow with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth and thread.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 41 años; convive desde hace 16 años con Justina. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapas. A pesar de que sus 3 mayores hijos ya formaron su familia; continúan trabajando conjuntamente. Ambos se ayudan en el cuidado de sus cultivos de Piña, los cuales siembra en terrenos agrícolas alquilados, pues no tenía el dinero necesario para comprar uno propio. Pero a pesar de las dificultades, pudo educar y sacar adelante a su familia. Además comenta que hace 10 años comenzó a incursionar en la elaboración de viveros de café, (una técnica de cultivo para conseguir una buena cosecha), por ello debe invertir gran cantidad de dinero.  Al año realiza un promedio de 100 mil viveros de café promedio, obteniendo una ganancia de 10 mil a 30 mil nuevos soles, todo depende de los pedidos que logra obtener. Le va muy bien, y mientras tenga las fuerzas para continuar trabajando ahorrará el dinero suficiente para poder comprar terrenos agrícolas y así dejar un legado para sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener buenos resultados gracias al apoyo conjunto de su asociación. Jorge, tiene un pedido de mil viveros, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de café.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41 years of age, has lived with his partner Justina for 16 years.  Together, they have 5 children; only 2 still live with them currently in their own house located in the Alto Yapas locality.  Despite the fact that his older children have already started their own families, they continue to work together.  They help each other out tending to their pineapple crops, which they plant on rented land since he doesn’t have the necessary means to buy his own.

Despite the difficulties he has faced, he managed to educate and support his family.  In addition, he tells us that 10 years ago he embarked on creating a coffee plant nursery (a cultivation technique used to obtain a grow a good crop), in which he must invest a great deal of funds.  To date, he averages 100 thousand saplings, obtaining a profit of 10 to 30 thousand soles.  Everything depends on the orders he manages to obtain.  Things are going well for him and, while he has the strength, he will continue to work hard to save so he can buy land for his children to inherit.  

He belongs to “The Progressives” cooperative bank, and this is his first loan with MFP.  He hopes to obtain a good result thanks to the collective support of his association.  Jorge has an order for one thousand saplings, which is why he will purchase coffee seeds with the requested loan.

loans.use: buy coffee plant seeds.

loans.name: Djénèbou

texts.fr:
Djénèbou N. est une veuve de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants qui vit avec ses enfants chez son défunt époux à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Djénèbou N. mène des activités diverses et variées : achat et vente des draps de lits,  de pagnes wax et  des chargements de bois de chauffe depuis plus de quatre  ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans ces activités et reçoit beaucoup de commande, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce cinquième prêt individuel pour acheter, 15 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 5 paquets de draps et 4 complets de tissus brodés respectivement dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso et à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.  
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans et bénéficia de plusieurs prêts solidaires (P.S.) avec une association de femmes de son quarter. Tous  ces prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
  Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Djénèbou N. is a 37-year-old widow and the mother of five children living with her children in the home of her deceased husband, in Wayerma I, a working-class district in Sikasso City. For over four years, she has had various occupations: buying and selling bed sheets, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and loads of firewood. She enjoys a strong reputation and receives many orders. But her resources no longer allow her to meet the demand. And so, she needs this fifth individual loan to buy: 15 cart loads of firewood, 5 packets of sheets, and 5 sets of embroidered fabrics respectively from towns surrounding Sikasso City and in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) in order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She has been associated with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for over three years and has benefited from several solidarity loans with a women's association in her district. The previous loans have all been properly repaid. With this new loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en:
Chhung is a 28-year-old married man who now lives in Siem Reap Province. He has been married for several years without a baby.

He is a domestic fish trader as well as a rice cultivator. He always buys fresh fish in bulk from local fishermen in the village and then he takes them to sell in the market. His wife supports him in fish-selling business as well. 

He planted a rice crops two months ago, but his crop is not growing well because it needs more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, Chhung would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer for his crop and to buy more fresh fish to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer for his crop and to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Turimbere Group

texts.fr:
Maneno est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de souliers  depuis 10ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence apres le commerce de poissons secs appelés « ndagala ». Elle est mariée a Jean et ont ensemble2 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend en charge 3 autres enfants orphelins sans aucune relation parentale avec elle. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 8e année du secondaire.

 Son crédit de 500,000francs burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital pour lui permettre d’acheter beaucoup de souliers à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« TURIMBERE».
texts.en: Maneno is a merchant who is 40 years old and living in the Gatumba District in the capital, Bujumbura. She has been in the shoe business for ten years. This is a trade she started following her ndagala (dried fish) business. Maneno is married to Jean, and they have two children who are in school. She supports three other children, orphans who are unrelated to her. She has an eighth grade education. Her loan of 500,000 Burundi francs is going to help increase her capital and enable her to buy many shoes to sell, so as to make large profits. She is a member of the solidarity group "TURIMBERE".

loans.use: to increase her capital to enable her to purchase many shoes to sell, so as to make large profits

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es: La señora Maria Ignacia cuenta con negocio desde hace 8 años denominado  “Miscelánea El Pelao”  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos. La señora recurre a esta institución para pedir apoyo para surtir su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Ignacia has owned her business, a general store called "Miscelánea El Pelao", for 8 years. She sells basic grocery items, such as snacks and sodas. Maria Ignacia is applying for a loan from this institution to help her stock her business and generate better income so that she can cover her family's financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is married with one child. She is 25 years old and lives in El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Jennifer has a general-store business. It is a new business. Jennifer has requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional stock for her general store. Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for over two years. In the future, Jennifer hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
As heads of the family, Mrs. Pech and her husband always worry about how to create more benefits for their family. She has five children. Two of her children are married and live separately. Three of her children are single. One of them is working in a hotel in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

 Presently, Mrs. Pech opens a retail store where she sells in front of her house. She's owned her business for many years. With the proceeds from the product sales she tries to cover all her expenses and improve her family's quality of life. With the aim of attaining a more comfortable standard of living, Pech wishes to borrow some funds through Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en: Lamula  lives in Uganda. She is single, and has three children all of whom are in school.  Lamula has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. Lamula sells her products at the market by means of retail. Lamula has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Lamula include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes, and also to become a wholesale business. Lamula lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Álvaro José

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Álvaro José  se ha   se desempeña como Guieiza  y se dedica a esta labor desde hace cuatro años. Es acompañado y con tres personas a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción, para comprar cinz, perlines y pagar mano de obra, para reparar techo que se encuentra en mal estado por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Álvaro José works as a guide.  He has been in this job for four years.  He lives with his partner and has three people in his care.

Álvaro José has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets and metal beams, and pay labor costs, to repair his roof which is in a bad state of repair.  Through this building work, he will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвелу 50 лет; он проживает в городе Ванадзоре. Жена Самвела работает учительницей в средней школе, старший сын учиться в Ереванском Государственном Медицинском Университете, а младший учится в школе.  
Более 10 лет Самвел плотницким делом. Он переделал одну из комнат своего дома в мастерскую, где он мастерит изделия из дерева. Самвел принимает заказы на изготовление мебели, а сделанные из дерева сувениры и нарды он продает в арендованном помещении в городском универмаге. Там же он продает настольные часы и картины, привезенные из Еревана. 
Изделия Самвела отличаются высоким качеством, вкусом и мастерством. Он вырезает на мебели и на нардах очень сложные орнаменты, благодаря чему у него всегда есть новые заказы. Бизнес позволяет Самвелу содержать семью и платить за обучение старшего сына. Для увеличения доходов своей семьи, Самвел хочет начать торговлю керамической посудой, вазами, статуэтками и т.д. Для этого ему необходим кредит на сумму 1,000,000 драм.
texts.en: Samvel is 50 years old.  He lives in the town of Vanadzor.  Samvel's wife works as a teacher at a secondary school, oldest son attends the Yerevan State Medical University, and the youngest son attends school.  Samvel has been involved in carpentry for over 10 years.  He re-purposed one of the rooms in his house into a workshop, where he makes products from wood.  Samvel accepts orders for making furniture and sells wooden souvenirs in a leased space at the city department store.  He also sells table clocks and paintings from Yerevan there.  Samvel's products stand out due to its high quality, taste and mastery.  He cuts very difficult ornaments on the furniture and backgammon, which is why he always has new orders.  This business allows Samvel to support his family and pay for his oldest son's education.  In order to increase his family's income, Samvel wants to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.  He needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram for this purpose.

loans.use: to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and children in a house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His two daughters are college students and his other two children are high school students. He started his business in 1995 by driving a taxi in his local town. His business is doing well and his daily income is between 20,000 MNT to 30,000 MNT. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to give a very good education to my children and let them study at the university. This is my main goal in life." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to pay the tuition fees for his daughters.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his daughters.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 51 years old, is a cake seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband, a policeman, earns $3.20 per day. They have four children, three of whom are working, and one too young for school. Every month, Pov has to spend $150 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rent, and $45 on other expenses.
 
She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work. She will extend her career when her profits increase.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El  señor Carlos Alberto es una persona casada y tiene dos hijos  pero su esposa se encuentra  en otro pais desde hace tres años  y por lo difícil que es conseguir un trabajo; a logrado conseguir uno pero este no le alcanza para poder ayudar a su familia aquí en Bolivia, el señor trabaja en una empresa  como chofer de camión de repartición  y el sueldo que el gana es para solo la sustentación de sus hijos y de el.
 
EL Señor Carlos Alberto vive en la zona del plan 3000 a unos 30 minutos de la zona central es por este motivo que el necesita el préstamo para reparar su auto que el utiliza para poder moverse hasta su trabajo ya que el mismo queda al otro lado de la ciudad la empresa en la que trabaja  y así se pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, y llevar también a sus hijos al colegio recogerlos y evitar que les pueda suceder algo peligroso.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is married and has two children but his wife has been in another country for the last three years because of the difficulty in finding employment.  She’s managed to find one but it does not produce enough to help her family here in Bolivia.  Carlos works as a delivery truck driver for a firm and the salary he earns is barely enough for his and his children’s sustenance.

Carlos Alberto lives in the Plan 3000 zone about 30 minutes from the central zone and this is why he needs a loan to repair his car that he uses to get to work which is located on the other side of the city in the firm he works for.  This will improve his quality of life and he’ll also be able to take his children to school and pick them up keeping them safe from anything dangerous that could happen to them.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 27-year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works as a painter to improve and increase his income. 

Alaa' will marry soon, so he is preparing for his wedding.  He wants to complete paying some of his wedding expenses such as: purchasing furniture, clothes, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, that will enable him to complete paying some of his wedding expenses.  He will feel comfortable and prepare well for this occasion. 

Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: pay some of his wedding expenses

loans.name: Elizabeth Rita

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es cliente antigua de la institución ella vive en la zona de Villa Pabón en anticrético tiene un hijito el cual esta en edad escolar antes la Sra. Elizabeth se dedicaba a la venta de carteras, con lo cual no le fue bien en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de sándwich en la puerta de un  campo deportivo  de lunes  a domingo, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus sándwich y fruta, azúcar  para la elaboración de los jugos, la Sra. tiene mucha clientela ya que les atiende con amabilidad, también le va muy bien con la venta de jugos, el deseo de la Sra. es el ver un día a su hijo profesional y una persona de bien, La Sra. Elizabeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is an old client of our institution who lives in the Villa Pabon zone with an 'anticretico' (a pre-paid rental contract common in Bolivia). She has a young son of school age. In the past, Elizabeth sold wallets but that didn't go well. At present, she sells sandwiches at the entrance to a sports field, Monday through Sunday.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making sandwiches, plus fruit and sugar for preparing juices. She has many customers since she attends them amiably. Selling juices is also going very well.

Elizabeth's desire is one day to see her son become a professional and a good person. She is a very hard working woman and very grateful for this offer of help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing sandwiches and juices to sell.

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es:
Jeffer sigue aumentando sus ventas, gracias a la captacion de clientes que ha logrado en estos años, al introducir mas productos de variedad, el cual ha venido rotando gracias a los financiamiento.
Compro una vitrina en donde lucir mas su mercaderia, vende al contado y al credito, dando mas oportunidad a sus clientes para pagar,venta que hace ambulantes y en su casa, con este nuevo prestamo comprara: ropa, zapatos, perfume , para ambos sexo. Con estas ventas ha aumentado sus ingresos, lo que le ayudado para solventar mejor la alimentacion de su familia, mejor equilibrio en sus gastos.
texts.en:
Jeffer continues increasing his sales, thanks to the recruitment of customers he has achieved in recent years by introducing more product variety, which he has rotated thanks to the loans.

He bought a display case to show off his merchandise.  He sells in cash and on credit, giving his customers more opportunities to pay.  He makes sales as a street vendor and in his home.

With this new loan he will buy clothing, shoes, and perfume for men and women.

With these sales he has increased his earnings, which has helped him better pay for feeding his family and have a better equilibrium in his expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and perfume to increase his sales.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and has two working children. All of the family cooperates together especially because of the heavy costs of life.  Hayat had fifteen years of experience in selling detergents until she decided to open her own business in 2006. She sells all kinds of detergents from her home. Her husband has been working as a taxi driver for the past twenty three years. Today, she’s looking to borrow $ 2300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of cleaners and sanitary products in order to earn superior income. In the future she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cleaners and sanitary products.

loans.name: Ana Pearly

texts.en:
Ana Pearly is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, age 12 and 14. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family.

Ana Pearly manages a coconut farm. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business and resells seaweeds. Ana Pearly is a hard-working mother. She said she only wants the best for her family.

Ana Pearly has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell. Ana Pearly hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 40, is married and resides with his wife and two school-age children in Kampong Chnnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman. His wife is a dessert vendor. 

Due to a lack of enough construction materials, Hong is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more to use in his work. This will enable him to run his construction work smoothly and increase his income. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to go further in their education.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to use in his construction work

loans.name: Tuisfolau

texts.en:
Tusifolau is sixty years old. She is married and has 7 children.

Tusifolau owns & operates a business venture, which involves planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tusifolau needs a loan of WST 1,000 (Talas) to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 Talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tusifolau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tusifolau's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Asrar

texts.en:
Asrar is 22 years old single woman, she lives in Al Karak, Jordan.
Asrar is looking to have a loan of 400JDs thus she can sale clothes to increase her income.
Asrar is under 30 years old so her loan is youth.
Asrar is a conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet the photo is for her brother.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Wonder

texts.en: After graduating Junior high school and learning how to weld metals and its accessories, Wonder decided to set up his own welding business center just at the road side Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe) a very vital positioning. With over 5 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him by purchase more different sizes of metals and also pay for his electricity bills. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a seamstress) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their only 1 child and all his unborn children will be able to experience a better life and also save enough to acquire an additional welding machine and get an assistant to assist.

loans.use: this loan will be used to help him by purchase more different sizes of metals and also pay for his electricity bills

loans.name: Seyigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEYIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Esther est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Esther est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Esther a peu fréquenté l’école. Esther est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Esther vend depuis trois ans des conserves et des boissons à son domicile. Esther s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Esther sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEYIGBE.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des boissons.

loans.name: Şemsiye

texts.en:
Semsiye is a married mother of three.  She sells cosmetics products through a network system.  She has used a microloan twice before to buy cosmetic and cleaning products wholesale, which she then succesfully sold.  With her third microloan she plans to buy more cosmetic and cleaning products wholesale and expand her business.  She is motivated by her desire to provide for her childrens’ future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Şemsiye hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Netwörk sistemi ile temizlik ve kozmetik ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor.  İki kez mikro kredi kullandı toptan kozmetik ve temizlik malzemeleri aldı sattı ve para kazandı.  Kullandığı üçüncü mikro kredi ile temizlik ve kozmetik ürünlerini toptan alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirip çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning products

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel Conforme is 52 years old and has 3 children. He’s owned this store for about four years and counts on the help of his wife who also works part time for a bakery and of his kids when they are not in school. He sells all kinds food items but concentrates on selling candies, snacks and other foods for people on the go. He is in need of capital so that he may improve his current product offerings and sell at lower prices. It is very difficult for him to maintain his inventory without the power to buy in bulk.

loans.use: Improve Inventory

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Miss Essi K. transforms hairstyles with a golden touch. She lives with her parents, both non-working. Her father is currently paralyzed and she pays the medical costs, thanks to the income from her job. She is unmarried with two (02) children. Hairstyling is a job she has been conducting for 7 years with pride. She owns a hair salon with many apprentices and hopes to enlarge it and to equip it better to increase yield. These days, her work is highly sought after, and to satisfy this increasingly growing demand, she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy modern dryers and other accessories; this will allow her to continue providing quality training for her apprentices and to take good care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979, Mlle K. Essi a des mains d’or pour transformer les coupes de cheveux. Elle vit avec ses parents tous deux inactifs. Son père est actuellement paralysé et c’est elle qui supporte ses frais médicaux grâce aux revenus de son travail. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. La coiffure est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans avec fierté. Elle possède un salon de coiffure avec de nombreux apprentis et souhaite l’agrandir et mieux l’équiper pour un meilleur rendement. Aujourd’hui, ses prestations sont très demandées et pour satisfaire cette demande toujours grandissante, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour l’achat des séchoirs modernes et tous les autres accessoires ;ce qui lui permettra de toujours donner une formation de qualité à ses apprentis et bien prendre soin de sa famille .

loans.use: To buy modern dryers and other accessories

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beadwork for the local and foreign market. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and has two small children, ages 7 and 12, who are currently in elementary school. Her husband works at a glass factory. Because her husband's salary was insufficient to be able to cover all the family expenses, Maria Guadalupe decided to start her own business a year ago to help pay the bills. After think about what she could offer, she decided to sell shoes by catalogue, since she couldn't neglect her kids or her home. Initially she offered her products to family members, neighbors and friends, and little by little she began building a clientele, who would recommend her services to their friends.

Maria Guadalupe is requesting a loan of $250 to be able to add supplies, tend to her customers better and show off the products she sells in real life and not via catalogue, because she says people are more likely to buy if they physically see things. She plans to repay the loan within three months and is very grateful for your support in helping her move ahead with her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María Guadalupe esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños de 7 y 12 años respectivamente, ellos están en la escuela primaria actualmente, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de vidrio. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente para poder cubrir los gastos familiares María Guadalupe decidió iniciar su propio negocio y ayudar en la economía familiar. Inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente un año atrás, pensando en que podía ofrecer y se decidió por la venta de zapatos por catálogo, así no descuidaba el hogar ni a sus hijos, inicialmente empezó ofreciendo sus productos a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos y poco a poco fue teniendo una clientela, la cual también la recomendaba con sus amistades.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para poder surtirse de mercadería y así atender bien a sus clientes y también poder mostrar los productos que vende en vivo y no solo por el catálogo, por que dice que la gente se anima más a comprar viendo las cosas físicamente. Ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brindes para poder salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and supplies

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Takusan de Ahidjidjio association, led by Ms. Celestine D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Context: The project is located in Oussouye in the south of Senegal. It comprises women who work together to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Oussouye is known for its tourism, which is why local commerce to provide the hotels with foodstuffs is the principal business activity.

Purpose: The objectives of the group include increasing the income of its members, alleviating the burden of the housewife, and improving the living conditions of its members.

Business activities: In order to carry out its business properly, the group is requesting a loan to allow it to purchase merchandise in the markets of nearby towns such as Ziguinchor, Bignona and Kolda, in order to satisfy the local demand for these goods.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le projet se situ à Oussouye au sud du Sénégal ; il regroupe les femmes en en association de développement qui travail dans le but d’amélioré leurs conditions de vie et celle de leurs familles. Oussouye est réputé de tourisme et c’est pourquoi, le commerce est l’activité principale permettant aux structures hôtelières de s’approvisionner sur place.

Objectifs : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autres objectifs : - D’augmenté le revenu de ses membres - D’alléger le panier de la ménagère - D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres

Activités : Pour mener a bien ces activités, le groupement sollicite un prêt de 500 000f qui lui permettra de pouvoir acheter de la marchandise dans les marchés les plus proche tel que Ziguinchor, Bignona, et Kolda ; afin de satisfaire la demande au niveau local.»

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale, transportation and storage expenses

loans.name: Joice Anastacio

texts.pt:
Joice is divorced. Her husband left her for a younger woman. Joice has children, but they live with their father and stepmother. She began the loan program at the end of 2006 to be able to support her children with some of their needs, despite not living with them. Her children study. With the profits of her business, she hopes to build a better home. She doesn't intend to marry; she prefers to live alone and dedicate herself more fully to her children. She tends chickens and her business will likely grow, since after her separation she now lives in an area with great demand for chicken.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Joice e divorciad.O marido lhe deixou porque arranjou outra mais nova que Joice. Ela tem filhos, mas estes vivem com o Pai e com a madrasta. Ela entrou para o Programa em finais de 2006 para poder apoiar os filhos em algumas despesas mesmo que seja a distancia. Os filhos de Joice estudam. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela pretende construir uma casa melhorada. Ela nao pretende casar, prefere viver sozinha para poder assistir melhor os seus filhos.Ela cria frangos e o negocio esta a correr-lhe bem pois que na zona para onde foi viver depoois de se separar ha muita procura de frango.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for poultry.

loans.name: Cristina Mapoissa

texts.pt:
A single mother or six children, Cristina B. operates a small grocery store from home, where she sells rice, sugar, sardines and other staples. She joined the program in November of 2006 and is now on her third loan cycle. Cristina plans to use the requested amount of $250 to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina B. é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro Malanga e tem o seu negócio na sua residência. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia como arroz, açúcar, sardinhas, pasta dentífrica, cremes para pele, etc. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006 e começou com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Está no terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 6 meses com vista a compra de mais produtos para a sua pequena loja.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying her product offerings

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi E. was born on April 20, 1980 in Kouvé in the prefecture of Yoto and is now living in Tsévié with her two children and two servants. Her husband is working in Lomé and, with only a meager salary, he has difficulty supporting his family, so she is responsible for providing for their needs. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, she supports her family using income from her various sales. She has invested previous loans wisely and has repaid them in a timely manner.

She is currently requesting a loan of US$ 400 which she will use to buy some sacks of rice and tins of oil, etc. to expand her little business. This will allow her to do more to improve the financial situation of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Amavi est née le 20 avril 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto actuellement, elle vit à Tsévié avec ses deux (02) enfants et deux (2) domestiques. Son mari employé à Lomé et avec un maigre salaire il arrive difficilement à couvrir les charges de la famille, ce qui fait que toutes les charges du foyer sont assurées par elle. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure ses diverses ventes. Elle a su bien gérer les précédents crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile et autres pour renforcer son petit commerce. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchasing sacks of rice and tins of oil

Achat de sacs de riz et bidons d'huile

loans.name: Pío Agustín

texts.es:
Pío G. is dedicated to selling groceries in his convenience store like oil, soap, detergents, brushes, shampoos, ect. in the El Sauce district of León. He has a humble family that looks to him for education, food and protection. His business started six years ago with $100 in start-up money he obtained with the help of his children.

Pío's biggest need is purchasing supplies for his convenience store and for this reason he has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel for support (he has been a recipient of three loans so far) in investing in his business, which has allowed him to provide for his household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Pio Gamez se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastes, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.) en la ciudad de León en el municipio El Sauce de esta localidad. Posee una humilde familia que tiene el deber de educar y brindar protección y alimentación. Su negocio da inicio desde hace 6 años con una inversión de $100 (Cien dólares netos) que los obtuvo por medio del apoyo de sus hijos para que iniciara el negocio.

Una necesidad que atraviesa el señor Pio es que necesita invertir en la compra de los abarrotes y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 3 créditos a su favor) que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell in store

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Khánh, 32, joined TYM fund in 2003. At first, she applied for a small loan because she was not sure if she would be able pay. But it turned out that she was successful so in later rounds, she applied for max loan. Her loans were used to raise poultry or buying bamboo to weave baskets. Now she notices that there is not much rice husking establishment in the area, she applies for a loan to start up a rice husking business. She needs the money to buy the machinery. She hopes that it would help increase her income, currently at 130 USD a month. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and their 2 young children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Khánh, 32 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Những vòng vốn đầu chị Khánh chỉ dám vay mức vốn thấp vì sợ không trả được. Sau khi sử dụng vốn vay, kinh tế gia đình phát triển tốt hơn, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ thường được chị sử dụng vào chăn nuôi hoặc mua tre đan thúng. Hiện nay, nhận thấy dịch vụ xay xát lúa gạo trên địa bàn còn chưa nhiều, chị Khánh làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua máy xay xát kinh doanh hoạt động này. Chị hy vọng sẽ nâng được mức thu nhập 130USD/tháng hiện tại lên trong năm nay. Chị Khánh đang sống với chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: Buy machine to husk rice

loans.name: Twitike

texts.en:
Mambo (hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Twitike M.. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 5.

In 2002, Twitike established her crop and textiles retail business. Twitike has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and traditional cloth. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, and traditional cloth for resale.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun A. earns $3 a day through her grocery store, which she has operated since 2000. Her husband, Oun Teav, is involved in several different trades, which is common with poor, rural Khmers who must find multiple sources of income in order to make ends meet. He raises pigs and also makes traditional rice wine. These two businesses actually go quite well together as the leftover rice mash from the rice wine can be used as feed for the pigs. He also earns about $3 per day. The couple has three children as well. They hope to use their loan to expand both of their businesses. They will purchase more grocery products for her store as well as better pig feed for his pigs. They hope to focus on pig raising in the future as this has proved to be profitable.

loans.use: To buy pig food and grocery store products.

loans.name: Eliseo Ramón

texts.es:
Eliseo P. is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood. He's married and his wife works as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes. Together he and his wife have 3 boys. His youngest son is 12 years old and is in grade school, while his other two sons are 16 and 14 and are in high school.

Eliseo has a delivery business and he has a van that he uses for this job. Also in his free time, he works as a mechanic. He began his delivery business 15 years ago and prior to that, he worked as a mechanic.

He has plans to acquire a new vehicle for his deliveries, although his current priority is to take care of the well-being of his family. He will use the loan to build a porch for his home to provide better security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer,

Don Eliseo P. tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino. Es casado, su esposa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa y zapatos. Juntos procrearon 3 hijos varones, su hijo menor de 12 años está estudiando la educación primaria y sus otros dos hijos de 16 y 14 años estudian la educación secundaria. El negocio de don Eliseo es Acarreo, posee una camioneta con la que realiza este trabajo, también en los tiempos que tiene libre se dedica a la mcánica.Empezó este negocio del acarreo desde hace 15 años, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a mecánica. Entre sus planes está la adquisición de un nuevo vehículo para sus acarreos, aunque su prioridad en estosmomentos es velar por el bienestar de su familia, por lo que usará el préstamo para construir el porche de su casa de habitación, para darle mayor seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a porch

loans.name: Patrick B.'s Group

texts.en: Patrick B. J. assumes leadership of this group. He was born in Freetown 30 years ago. He is married with 2 children. J.'s wife has been selling food items here in Makeni for the past two years now. J. will like to get a loan to give to his wife to add onto her current business. Other members of the group are: George Bating G., who wants the loan to invest in a business of some sort; George Brima K., who will use his own loan to renovate his house; and Sheka T., who wants to use his loan to continue his education. They are requesting a loan of 3,600,000.00 SLL.

loans.use: Invest in wife's business

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Одинаев Зафарджон проживает вместе со своей семьей в Яване. Работает частным предпринимателем . Занимается купле продажей крупно рогатого скота. Кроме того хочет купить еще одну корову и занять свою жену продажей молока. Это поможет получать дополнительные доходы для семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafarjon O. lives with his family in Yavan. He has a small business in which he trades in livestock. He would like to purchase an additional cow so that his wife can sell its milk. This will help them bring in additional income to support their family. He plans to repay the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Umed

texts.en: U. Umed is 31 years old. He is married and he has 2 children. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market of Isfara town. Umed sells an assortment of good-quality flour. Because he buys the flour at wholesale, the price is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus, he has many customers who even purchase flour straight from his house. Today there is a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to request a loan of $750 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory.
